story:
About My Campaign:


I'm Kiki Strange, a published alternative model and homesteader, located in the heart of Montana.  I've been modeling for over 10 years, and professionally for the last 5. During 2013, I picked up several incredible sponsors, including Anon Latex from England, ToucheKVLT, EdwardTeaBelly, Zombie Tools, and FuxLeep.


I'm launching this campaign in hopes of raising some money towards the purchase of a professional grade  Digital SLR camera, and lighting gear.
The gear that I am able to purchase depends on what I raise via this campaign.

My goal:

Canon 60D with 18-200mm IS Lens= 1200$
Backdrop stand: 75$
Lighting Kit: 200$
___________________

TOTAL: 1500$

I have saved 800$ towards my total of 1500$, which is over half of what I need.  I already have received a huge amount of interest in my studio, including several weddings over the summer, glamor shoots with other models, and shooting a lookbook for a designer.

With your help, I'll be able to greatly increase my opportunities to work with designers and really take my art to the next level. Having my own camera and gear will greatly help with this, as I won't have to depend on finding photographers to work with, and can work on taking new sets on a weekly basis.

I will start doing photography for others immediately, which would help me supplement my modeling income so I won't have to do crowd-funded campaigns. :P

By next year, I would like to have my studio up and running, and this is the first step in making that dream come true!

What I Need & What You Get

My minimum goal is 500$, but realistically the gear I want will be around 1500$, so raising 700$ would be amazing! However- anything I raise will be greatly appreciated.

I am offering a variety of perks to help me raise my goal- everything from digital photos, prints, handmade lingerie and accessories, and coffee table style photo books.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can’t contribute financially, and that's ok! You can still help me out in other ways: word of mouth is a huge help with crowd funding, so sharing with your friends is a valuable contribution.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools: the more views I get, the better!  <3

story:
Subscribe to our book informations


Hello, I am Gábor Matyasi an oral surgeon and a fine art photographer, founder of the Hungarian Society of Dental Photography.

My aim is to spread the importance and usefulness of dental photography more widely, and to make the camera an everyday device such as the mirror or the drill in the practice. This interactive textbook is designed to serve this purpose.

Not just reading - Interacting

It’s time to tun a new page on learning. On iPad, textbooks invite Multi‑Touch interaction — flick through photo galleries, rotate 3D objects, tap to pop up sidebars, or play video and audio. With iBooks, reading is beyond fundamental. And more engaging than ever.

I have tried to make photography, optical term definitions and sometimes the dry rules of physics more colourful with a spectacular, unique, informative and in some cases humorous visual material. I hope to produce a useful, easily understandable and entertaining volume. I particularly enjoyed the formation of creative elements, it has been a great fun for me while learning a lot.


Some randomly selected interactive widgets ...


  • It starts with the basics of optics and photography
  • We will look through the accessories and devices of dental photography
  • I will explain how to set your camera.
  • I will show the standard intraoral views according to the European and AACD protocol, as well. 
  • The perioral views
  • The different portrait techniques.
  • The most common errors in dental photography.
  • Every chapter ends with tests and tasks to check your knowledge :)

The book was made with Ibooks Author software, therefore it can be watched on iPads and Mac computers.

The text of the book is completely ready. We’d spend the donation for the completion of the English translation, for the perfection of animation and 3D elements, but it is highly essential to support the promoting and marketing campaign.

The book is expected to come out in iBookStore in May, 2014.


The expected price of the book is 25 $



who is this book for?

Reading the book gives suitable basics of photography for dentists, oral surgeons, medical students, dental technicians, dental hygienists in their work and documentation.

Naturally, the book provides useful information for photographers as well, who help the work of surgeries as outside specialists. They are probably familiar with the basics of photography, but the medical professional specialities of dental photography contain several new pieces of information.


the author  

The author - Gábor Matyasi - is an implantologist, an award winning fine art photographer and video maker.

He graduated from the University of Debrecen, Faculty of General Medicine in 1992. He worked at the Oral- and Maxillo-Facial Surgery, Merényi Gusztáv Hospital in Budapest until 2000. Then he opened his private dental and oral surgery practice in Budapest where he is currently working.


the Gabor Matyasi Photography

Member of the Hungarian Photo Artists Association since 2007, a leading representative of the contemporary Hungarian surrealistic photography. He has had a number of individual photo exhibitions, a multiple winner of  photo and short film contests. Director of a couple of video clips. He is a musician as well, a blues harmonica player. 

                                 

Visit Gabor's free iPhone portfolio app

or visit is site www.gabormatyasi.com


the truewhy saloon

His studio and gallery is called the TRUEWHY SALOON, a real rarity, an absurd, surrealistic object suiting his visual world. This gallery has been created from a dilapidated circus caravan. It has the authentic circus exterior, inside there is a modern studio and a “print on demand” wandering gallery.  http://www.facebook.com/truewhy


the dental media library

He is the founder of the only dental-specific professional stock media library, the Dental Media Library that [will] contains a photo, video and graphic database available for everybody involving every field of the profession.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us  either with donations or sharing and spreading our project



MIRRORS



What about workshops?
As the founder of the Hungarian Society of Dental Photography I have been the presenter of workshops for years for dentists, dental technicians and photographers. He launched the Hungarian dental photography training, the presenter of international lectures and workshops, founder of the Hungarian Society of Dental Photography.

Why Budapest?

Because I am living there and Budapest is one of the most beautiful city of the world!
"The world's best city is ... " a CNN poll, and Budapest won the second place!!!

FAQ

Do I have to pay for the subsequent issues and upgrades of the ebook?
No, all subsequent issues and upgrades are FREE to download.

In which languages is the ebook published?
Currently it is available in English and in Hungarian.

If I download the ebook in one language, are the upgrages in other languages also free to download?
No, unfortunately, the given language version can be downloaded only. The issues in different languages count as completely different books in iBookstore. Each has an own ISBN number.

Where is the ebook available?
The interactive versions of books prepared by iBooks Author software can be distributed only in iBookstore.

In which countries is the ebook available?
It can be bought in 51 countries where iBookstore is available.

When is the ebook expected to come out?
It is expected to come out in the second half of May 2014.

How can the ebook be read?
It can be read by applying free iBooks on iPad and OS X.

story:
I'm a photographer and I'm having my debut exhibition of my abstract work.
 Space has been secured at my local library for up to 15 pieces. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is a large show and I have no inventory from prior shows, as this is my first!

Funding is needed for printing and framing and mounting of each piece.  

You can choose a perk for specific donation amounts and receive the gift that is described. 

The funding goal is the bare minimum for 5 pieces of various sizes. Funds recieved below the goal will be used to print whatever that amount will allow. Funding above the goal will give me the ability to show more pieces and perhaps print marketing materials for the show. 

The Impact

As an artist, exposure like this can be invaluable. You will be helping me to get my work seen. 

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no risks in fulfilling this project. If this project is successfully funded, the funds will go directly to funding the direct production of prints to be displayed at an exhibit I have already been accepted and scheduled for.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, you can always share this with others to help e get the word out.

    You can use the Indiegogo share tools. Just click and share!

story:
Habitus is a photography exhibition, showcasing the work of a number of MA Photography and Urban Cultures students from Goldsmiths, University of London.  The approach and focus of our research varies from an in depth exploration of familial histories, to the impact of major regeneration projects.  Our work includes subculture studies to techno-waste in Ghana, visual contrast in the city to the fringes of tactile perception and memory.  As urban sociologists, we are brought together by an undying interest in the narratives that underlie the city and our existence in it.  The exhibition, running from October 20th-25th is part of the Urban Photo Fest 2014, which showcases contemporary research, photography and explorations of the urban realm. We are excited and proud to be invited to such a renowned festival.

Due to the huge variety of knowledge and stories collected over the course of our year, putting together an exhibition like this is costly.  In order to give exposure to these untold narratives, we need your help.  We have put in our own funding, but we need additional help for the exhibition to cover essential costs such as gallery expenses and printing.  We believe, with your contributions, we can make a show that is worth the time and effort that has gone into producing this visual research. 

There are many different levels of support you could give and we are thankful for each and every one who helps make this exhibition come together. If you can't spare anything yourself at the moment, please share this with friends and family.  As a thank you, your pledges will be rewarded with gifts directly related to the exhibition and our work.  

As we are exhibiting at the Menier Gallery, you are not only helping us have a great show, but also supporting the Paintings for Hospitals charity. 

We would like to thank you ahead of time for any support you can give and look forward to seeing you all at the show.

Our exhibition dates are:

Monday 20th October-Saturday 25th October

Private View
Saturday 25th October at 6pm-10pm

Opening Times
Monday-Saturday 11am-6pm

story:
Hello, I am a photographer, columnist, writer and magazine editor from Croatia. I travel a lot and make all sorts of photos. However I am especially passionate about a handful of my favorite motifs. One of my favorite photo series is called Expiations, featuring religious temples from all over the world. Catholic, Muslim, Protestant, Hindu, Jewish, Sikh, Orthodox Christian, Sunni, Shiite, Buddhist, you name it, I photographed it.

I recommend taking a look at my first Indiegogo campaign for the series Without People, some additional explanations regarding plans and motives for the "Big Picture" are explained there. The basic idea is to do three photo projects in three years – Without People (abandoned and dehumanized places), Expiations (religious temples), and as yet unnamed third project. The first part of the project – Without People – went very well, thanks to your support. The funding goals were reached and surpassed, the stretch goal reached as well. The book is available on Amazon, It's a great gift for travelers, introverts, loners or survival freaks. Large size prints for international customers are available on Crated. Local Croatian customers interested in buying one of these large format prints – please contact me directly via e-mail or Facebook.

Without People on Amazon: http://amzn.com/1494484846

Without People campaign on Indiegogo: http://igg.me/at/withoutpeople/x/5894566

Selected photos from Without People on Crated: https://crated.com/oleg.mastruko

Now it's time for the second part of the planned trilogy – Expiations!

In the meantime I got some experience regarding self-publishing a book, so the sum I am looking for in this campaign is actually LOWER, perks cost LESS, and yet I can promise that the book will be delivered much QUICKER than Without People, my first photo book. The book itself will also feature more photos than Without People.

By streamlining the production process I managed to cut cost considerably, and can do a beautiful book for a relatively modest sum. I need money to cover the production costs – DTP, proofreading, printing... also, the campaign is the easiest way for you to buy the book.

By pledging your support for this project, you get to participate in what will be a unique photographic document of places and locations that are changing basically every day, and some of them may be lost forever, sooner than you think.

In return for your help you get photographic prints, books, e-books and.... You can see more details in the funding options on the right.

Check out some of the featured photos in the Gallery! 

All photos are subject to change (these are working versions!), and there are no captions in this campaign/preview. In the book itself, captions accompanying the photos are very substantial. 


Perks!

Expiations, the book = 35 USD

~150 pages, 99 photographs, 22 x 22 cm (8,5" x 8,5")

Expiations + Without People = 59 USD

~150 pages, 99 photographs, 22 x 22 cm (8,5" x 8,5") + 150 pages, 83 photographs, two forewords, 22 x 22 cm (8,5" x 8,5")

Book Credit - Book + Large Size Photo Print (like the one from the series Without People my friend Nikša holds on the pic below) + large size credit in the book itself = 299 USD
International orders for this perk will be fulfilled by Crated and will not look exactly like the product shown below (slightly different, but same dimensions)

More large size prints (some of these are from the series Without People)

See for yourself! - all of the above plus a guided tour + photoshoot in the city of Zadar during a weekend = 999 USD (travel and accommodation costs not included).
This is Zadar, lots of churches and interesting things to photograph, trust me....



Thank you very much for your support!

 

That's me and my first photo book

And that's me in Badwater Basin, Death Valley, California

story:
About the Book & Who We Are:

This book will be a gorgeous hardbound limited edition coffee table book that features photos from all over the great state of North Carolina from the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains and mountain towns like Asheville, Blowing Rock, & Cherokee to the breathtaking beaches & coastal areas of the Outer Banks where the wild horses roam free and the Wright Brothers took their first flight!  We will feature everything including pretty landscapes, skylines, businesses, distinctive architecture, unique facts, and photos of people from all over the state.  If you love North Carolina, you will love this book!  We will also have a digital book available for tablets.
The book will not be heavy on text, only a couple paragraphs on over thirty cities and towns throughout North Carolina, and it will feature hundreds of incredible full color pictures.  The idea is to give people an overall taste of what North Carolina is all about whether they are planning on visiting the area, or if they have lived here their whole lives.  It's really a tribute to the state and it's beauty and also its people!  In the future it will serve as an historical benchmark or what life may have been like in the approximate year of 2014 & 2015 because it will showcase the approximate populations of each area, and naturally fashions people wear will change, and businesses will come and go, so it will be a fun way to reflect back at how NC used to be.
We have been publishing high quality books and magazines for over twenty years.  The last two books we published were both sold in select Barnes & Noble book stores, on Amazon, & one was even sold at Costco.  We have interviewed & photographed notable people from around the world from reknown scientists to celebrities & musicians including Pierce Brosnan, Ted Danson, Yoko Ono, Jason Mraz, Jack Johnson, Daryl Hannah, and dozens of others, and our photography has been featured in magazines & newspapers from the LA Times to the New York Times, Golf Magazine, Coast Magazine & over forty others.  We tell you this only to explain that we take our jobs & reputations very seriously, and we are very proud of the way this book has been turning out. We are  passionate about the state we live in and that's why we're also commited to working on promoting North Carolina every single day on line, this is much more than just a book to us! 
What We Need & What You Get:
We are trying to raise $47,000 in order to get our book printed and to pay our hard working graphic artists! Our goal is to publish at least 5000 copies of the book and naturally the more editions we can afford to do the better! We have spent well over $50,000 already of our own hard earned money to get this project off the ground (basically all we had - that's how much we believe in this project).  We have travelled all over the state for the last year and have acquired more tax write-off than we need on gasoline, restaurants, exhibition tickets, and hotels! 
We started a Facebook page a few months ago which already has just reached 7000 likes! As proud of that number as we are, "likes" don't pay the bills! We feel like we should be working for the department of tourism to be honest but unfortunately we are not and that's why we need you!  If you support us we will reward you in many different ways, and no dollar amount is to low for us to appreciate it! : ) We are offering an array of perks listed on this page. 

    The Impact:

    When you support the this campaign, you are supporting local small business people who give the money dierctly back to the communities we live in.  This book will not be printed in China, despite the fact it would cost less, this book will be printed right here in the good ol' USA!  And our graphics people live here too!  And by supporting this book you are not only helping us, you are actually helping to preserve the history of North Carolina! And we will do our best to represent the state in a way that would make most of our people proud too (we won't lie & say every single person will love it, but we hope we'd at least get a simple majority even though it's a non-political book). 
    By supporting this campaign you also help us to keep our social media going, it's not cheap, or easy getting new info to post ever single day ot the week!  And we have an amazing track record in statistics on facebook so far - we have a higher participation than 80+% of all websites in the state! 

      Risks & Challenges:

      Without the kind of support we actually need just means that we won't be able to have the book out immediately, but it does not mean we won't make the book!  If we could print 10,000 books on our first run we would! (in fact in the outside chance we do get enough funding we will print even more)! We are that confident that they will all sell! Our goal is to have the digital version of the book out by the first week of December, and the hard covered version of the book will be out in July.  Every person who buys a hard covered version of the book will also receive the digital version as well.  It's like a two for one because both books will be different! 

        Other Ways You Can Help:

        Some people just can't afford to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  

        • You can ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign if you want to see it happen!  And you can tell your own social media friends about it.  And Hey - we go by the trust system, if you tell us that you told all your friends even though you have no dinero yourself, we will still send you a signed postcard if you just let us know! : )
story_txt:
About the Book & Who We Are:
This book will be a gorgeous hardbound limited edition coffee table book that features photos from all over the great state of North Carolina from the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains and mountain towns like Asheville, Blowing Rock, & Cherokee to the breathtaking beaches & coastal areas of the Outer Banks where the wild horses roam free and the Wright Brothers took their first flight!  We will feature everything including pretty landscapes, skylines, businesses, distinctive architecture, unique facts, and photos of people from all over the state.  If you love North Carolina, you will love this book!  We will also have a digital book available for tablets.
The book will not be heavy on text, only a couple paragraphs on over thirty cities and towns throughout North Carolina, and it will feature hundreds of incredible full color pictures.  The idea is to give people an overall taste of what North Carolina is all about whether they are planning on visiting the area, or if they have lived here their whole lives.  It's really a tribute to the state and it's beauty and also its people!  In the future it will serve as an historical benchmark or what life may have been like in the approximate year of 2014 & 2015 because it will showcase the approximate populations of each area, and naturally fashions people wear will change, and businesses will come and go, so it will be a fun way to reflect back at how NC used to be.

We have been publishing high quality books and magazines for over twenty years.  The last two books we published were both sold in select Barnes & Noble book stores, on Amazon, & one was even sold at Costco.  We have interviewed & photographed notable people from around the world from reknown scientists to celebrities & musicians including Pierce Brosnan, Ted Danson, Yoko Ono, Jason Mraz, Jack Johnson, Daryl Hannah, and dozens of others, and our photography has been featured in magazines & newspapers from the LA Times to the New York Times, Golf Magazine, Coast Magazine & over forty others.  We tell you this only to explain that we take our jobs & reputations very seriously, and we are very proud of the way this book has been turning out. We are  passionate about the state we live in and that's why we're also commited to working on promoting North Carolina every single day on line, this is much more than just a book to us! 


What We Need & What You Get:


We are trying to raise $47,000 in order to get our book printed and to pay our hard working graphic artists! Our goal is to publish at least 5000 copies of the book and naturally the more editions we can afford to do the better! We have spent well over $50,000 already of our own hard earned money to get this project off the ground (basically all we had - that's how much we believe in this project).  We have travelled all over the state for the last year and have acquired more tax write-off than we need on gasoline, restaurants, exhibition tickets, and hotels! 
We started a Facebook page a few months ago which already has just reached 7000 likes! As proud of that number as we are, "likes" don't pay the bills! We feel like we should be working for the department of tourism to be honest but unfortunately we are not and that's why we need you!  If you support us we will reward you in many different ways, and no dollar amount is to low for us to appreciate it! : ) We are offering an array of perks listed on this page. 

  The Impact:
When you support the this campaign, you are supporting local small business people who give the money dierctly back to the communities we live in.  This book will not be printed in China, despite the fact it would cost less, this book will be printed right here in the good ol' USA!  And our graphics people live here too!  And by supporting this book you are not only helping us, you are actually helping to preserve the history of North Carolina! And we will do our best to represent the state in a way that would make most of our people proud too (we won't lie & say every single person will love it, but we hope we'd at least get a simple majority even though it's a non-political book). 
By supporting this campaign you also help us to keep our social media going, it's not cheap, or easy getting new info to post ever single day ot the week!  And we have an amazing track record in statistics on facebook so far - we have a higher participation than 80+% of all websites in the state! 

  Risks & Challenges:
Without the kind of support we actually need just means that we won't be able to have the book out immediately, but it does not mean we won't make the book!  If we could print 10,000 books on our first run we would! (in fact in the outside chance we do get enough funding we will print even more)! We are that confident that they will all sell! Our goal is to have the digital version of the book out by the first week of December, and the hard covered version of the book will be out in July.  Every person who buys a hard covered version of the book will also receive the digital version as well.  It's like a two for one because both books will be different! 

  Other Ways You Can Help: Some people just can't afford to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!   You can ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign if you want to see it happen!  And you can tell your own social media friends about it.  And Hey - we go by the trust system, if you tell us that you told all your friends even though you have no dinero yourself, we will still send you a signed postcard if you just let us know! : )

story:
Studio portraits at the MySQL Conference

(Please join the Facebook event if you're going, whether you're funding or not!)

The MySQL and surrounding community and the conference itself have gone through many changes in the past few years. It's important to continue documenting the incredible and diverse MySQL community as it evolves. You’ve no doubt seen Julian Cash’s photographs of the community through the years; they’re so great that people love to use them for profile images on Facebook, Twitter, and everywhere else.

However, it takes a lot of hard work to produce these images! Your contribution will directly fund the creation of sensational “white background” studio portraits of speakers and attendees at the Percona Live MySQL Conference and Expo in Santa Clara on April 22nd to 25th in 2013. The community only gets together at this scale for these few days, once a year, so we have to make it count!

Check out some of Julian’s prior work:

  • The MySQL Community, a book of photos from previous MySQL conferences (many of these images can be seen in the video above)
  • Photos from OSCON 2012
  • Many other examples of his work

Julian has self-funded most of the Open Source shoots that he's done, including all past MySQL conventions.

Why does this need funding?

A temporary “white background” studio will be set up at the Percona Live MySQL Conference (at a location to be announced). We plan to provide:

  • Full resolution images (with full image rights) to the people photographed.
  • A web gallery of all resulting images.
  • A video of the best images, put to music.
  • A Facebook gallery of the images.

Including preparation, shooting, picking images, polishing them, building various galleries, and other related work, it typically takes about 80 hours of effort for a shoot like this. In order to be as inclusive as possible, there is no direct cost to the people being photographed, so your funding is very important!

Thank you for being part of our wonderful community and helping to fund the glorious documentation of it!

And another way to help is to post or share the indiegogo campaign on facebook.

More about Julian Cash's photography

Since 2001, Julian Cash has been taking studio portraits at Open Source conventions such as MySQL, OSCON, and ApacheCon. Although this shoot is a “white background” one, Julian has also done “light painting” shoots at Open Source events.

In 2012, Julian formed a team of light painters who were on America's Got Talent, and received great feedback, such as:

  • "I've never seen anything like this. I loved it!" - Howard Stern
  • "This is what we look for" - Howie Mandel
  • "Spectacular" - Sharon Osbourne
  • "Amazing" - Nick Cannon

Julian has been taking photographs at Burning Man for many years, and is well known for his instant cult classic white background studio portrait book, The People of Burning Man.

How you can help

There's not much time, so we need to spread the word quickly. You can:

  • Help fund the project. Your funding is critical to ensuring the shoot can happen, to keeping it free and inclusive for the people photographed, and to make things happen smoothly.
  • Help spread the word. Tell other MySQL community members about this project. Share on Facebook, Twitter, your personal blogs, via email, and by word of mouth.
  • Come by at the conference and have your photograph taken. You're part of the community, too!

story:
Who is d3photo?

d3photo is a low-cost photography agency based in Minnesota that strives to provide low-cost, high-quality event photos for the member institutions of the NCAA's Division III. 

We, like others, believed that we could weather a year without income if we just hung on but with the cancellation of 2020's fall championships and the winter and spring championships looking less and less likely to occur we find ourselves at a crossroads... and a request for assistance from our fans that is difficult to make.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise enough funds to continue until we can cover championships again. 

Instead of having goodies and gifts for you we have three options as a thank you:

  • A thank you in our software, on the website.
  • 50-50 split of your gift between us and a school of your choosing. Half of your gift will be used to offset a school's championship coverage.
  • Purchasing an entire gallery's worth of proof-sized (2000px) photos from any regular-season event covered by our photographers that is currently available - or may be applied to any regular-season event in the future.

What this will do for us

If we are successful and able to keep our lights on throughout the pandemic we will be able to continue to bring memories and keepsakes to future student-athletes and help with the bottom line of many institutions.

We strive to bring quality, low cost photography to both schools and fans and we hope to continue to do so for many years to come.

If we raise more than we need to maintain operations our intention is to pay the donations forward. Gifts to scholarship programs for schools, conferences,  sponsorships of student newspapers, athletic departments, among other places -- all will be published on our website. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to help us keep the lights on and doors open but, if you can, please share this with anyone that you know who has enjoyed our coverage of championships and events over the last 18 years.

story:
How you can help!

We are hoping to raise £500.

We are crowdfunding to raise funds to enable us to install an exhibition to a high quality and professional standard to reflect the way we work, providing us with our initial opportunity to launch our work into a professional context.

On this page is the opportunity to purchase original work from up and coming new photographers and invitations to our private view attended by many leading industry professionals.

Money received will contribute to the production of the show; including our show catalogue, promotional materials and the purchase of installation materials. 

The Impact

We are all working hard to produce interesting and pertinent work, that will engage with the public. However we cannot do this alone and are grateful for any help you can give us. For many of us this will be our first show in London and thus this will be a very important platform with which to launch future and successful careers.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, you can still be a big help by spreading the word and telling other people about our upcoming show! Please share this page with your friends and family.

Thank you for your support and we hope you enjoy looking at our work in progress.

Facebook: www.facebook.com/MADPPPhoto

Instagram: @madpphoto

story:
Short Summary

We Are Lionhearted is a photo story supporting women's rights and to raise awareness about sexual assault and domestic violence.

My name is Brittney Thompson, the creator and photographer for We Are Lionhearted. I created this photo story to bring awareness to the community about issues that surround us every day. We have models and writers that are working extremely hard to make this come to reality!

What We Need & What You Get

  • To buy props, products and reimburse our volunteers as much as we can, we need at least $500 to last us the entire year! This will help with our current photo stories and future stories for 2017!
  • We would like to donate 10% of our entire earnings to Planned Parenthood!

The Impact

We want our photo story and our testimonials to stand out and grab people's attention. We need to teach people that these issues are not okay and that they are affecting men and women everywhere. Our volunteers are writing letters to our Senators about different issues happening in the United States. We want to get petitions, that stand for what we believe in, more notice and give the people a reason to want to make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for new models, 18+, writers and artists to support us! Even a simple word of mouth mention is appreciated! We Are Lionhearted wants to be heard! 

Follow us on Facebook @werlionhearted, Instagram and Twitter @lionhearted2017 to show support!

story:
Why I need your help

Your much needed contribution will help me to raise the funds to cover the printing and framing costs to make my first ever solo exhibition possible!

Having spent the last year testing out the best fine art printing and framing that most effectively showcases my work, I'll be printing on museum grade archival Hahnemühle Photo Rag. Each print will then be set in a handmade frame using raw wood and finished off with a museum grade non-reflective UV glass which creates the illusion of a real plant floating in the frame.

What You Get 

As part of my rewards I’ll be making an epic assortment of limited edition signed, framed prints available at cost price from my exhibition as a special once off only, exclusive to the supporters of my campaign :) This will in turn help me get all my artworks up on the wall - which I’m hugely excited about. 

My top rewards are next level AMAZING!!! I have curated 4 limited-release CheckMyPlants Smeg FAB28 retro fridges featuring my work. These incredibly special tribute pieces are literally the only ones of their kind in the world, and will be available in South Africa exclusively through this campaign only. Created as the ultimate way to say thank you to supporters of this campaign, these collectors’ items are guaranteed to be a striking feature and talking point in any space imaginable.  Read press release here.

T's & Cs Apply

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but want to help :)

  • please consider sharing my campaign on you social networks :) 
  • or you can tag a friend in the comments section
  • and you can follow me on Instagram and Facebook

From the bottom of my heart, Thank you  <3 :) 

More about me and my photography journey 

Almost  three years ago, I started an Instagram account called CheckMyPlants, photographing rare and unusual plants against a black background, using natural light only, I wait for the perfect light which only occurs on some days.  I called it CheckMyPlants because I have a large succulent collection that I like to stare at endlessly, "Come Check my Plants!", it's what I always say to anyone who comes to visit me..  I set up two basic rules for this account, I can’t post an image to Instagram until I’ve learned the name of the plant and I have to share my favourite information I discover.  It's my way of learning about my plants, it's been a fascinating journey and the more I learn the less I know - which is exciting. Plants are awesome! 

 

I’m lucky to live in South Africa where we have a wide diversity of the craziest, weirdest plants; from succulents to fynbos. As you can probably tell - I am ridiculously enthusiastic about these plants!! I enjoy trying to capture them in my photographs in the way they make me feel when I see them, and my hope is to share with others what I see in these miraculous plants. 

Since I started photographing my plants, I have been on an incredible journey; from doing a plant installation for Playtopia Gaming & Interactive Art festival at the Castle of Good Hope, to being a collaborating artist  in the All Woman group Installation ‘A Taste of Memories' with world renowned illustrator Ree Treweek and visual projection artist Inka Kendzia.

I've also travelled around southern Africa meeting fellow plant nuts, photographing rare plants in the wild and photographing private collections of rare plants. 

My work has been featured in Business Insider’s Top 10 iPhone photographers as well as Condé Nast House & Garden;  ‘7 Top Creatives to follow in 2018’. and numerous other magazines.

In proud association with Smeg, I have also had the opportunity to curate 4 limited-release CheckMyPlants SMEG FAB28 retro fridges featuring my work. These incredibly iconic collectors’ pieces will be exclusively available through this campaign, and in South Africa only.

We are so EXCITED for this project! We love all things girly and this location we are shooting at is a real life dollhouse! We can't wait to share our photos with you!

We came up with a super fun idea to make you a part of it!

With your contribution, we will be shooting these incredible photos with you as a producer! Who wouldn't want to help produce Taryn Terrell & May Valentine?!

story:
About me and my mission:

My name is Kimberly Chandler. I'd like to take my photography and artwork to the next level by opening a studio where I can work and hopefully sell prints. But before diving into the 'why I'm doing it' and, more importantly, the perks I'm offering, here's a little about myself.

Bio:
I'm a wife (its been an interesting 12 years with a Marine turned fiction/satire writer), mother (I've won several mom-of-the-year awards in my household, but I think the judging is rigged), ambitious college student working towards a PhD in psychology (I'm not sure if I can survive 4 more years of studying while raising 12-month-old twins, a diva 6-yr-old, and an unruly 35-yr-old Marine), computer artist (and I use the term artist very loosely since I don't really see myself as one), and an amateur photographer.  I work online for an art related site. I'm one of the lucky ones to be able to work in my underwear if I wish. I worked up from a volunteer position to a paid administration position. Its an enjoyable job that involves my art and working with people from all over the world. 

While I've already invested a lot of time and money in this endeavor, I could still use help raising money for equipment beyond the initial start-up costs.

So, why am I doing this? Well...
Your donations will help me make my studio possible, and provide a safe haven for my sanity every now and then since photography and art are my creative outlets. But beyond that, I'll be providing my community with a service that is affordable.

I'm originally from Jacksonville, Florida, but my husband relocated us to his hometown of Louisiana, Missouri, a town of less than 4,000 people. Culture shock was inevitable, but the town itself it picturesque and full of potential. In fact, Louisiana is working hard to revitalize its downtown and bring new businesses, jobs, and customers to the area. I want to be a part of that effort, and I hope that I can help improve our economy by providing affordable services to locals and bring new customers to town.

I plan to open in mid October for individual, couple, family, small business, and corporate clients, but I want to eventually do much more such as create photo books through my husbands indie press .

Okay, So Here's the Part You Probably Skipped to Anyway... What We Need & What You Get:

All funds contributed will be used to buy:

* Lighting
* Props (back drops & actual props)
* Camera lens
* Editing software (lightroom)
* A monitor to allow clients to view their proofs
* Extras: sync cables, power strips, office supplies, extra bulbs.

What YOU get:

$5: A thank you, and you'll have your name listed as a sponsor on my website.

$10: A really BIG thank you.
- Your name listed on my website and in the studio on an artistic display.

$20: Artistic Print (photo or personal art work collection).
- Choose your favorite from a selection of my works.

$50: Photo session or Artistic Print (photo or personal art work collection).
- A 30 minute portrait session.
- 5 edited photos.
- Special thank you and listed as a company sponsor on the website, an artistic display in the studio, and Facebook.

Or:

8 x 10  Artistic Print (any) from either my photo collection or personal art collection.
Choose your favorite from a selection.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

$100: Photo session or Artistic Print.
1 hour studio session or location (individual, couple, family, small business, corporate).
- 5-10 edited images. All images included digitally.
- A special thank you and you will be listed as a company sponsor on the website, an artistic display in the studio, and Facebook.

Or:

8 x 10  Artistic Print (any) from either my photo collection or personal art collection. Choose your favorite from a selection.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

$200+: Free Photo Session or Artistic Print:
2 hour studio or location (individual, couple, family, small business, corporate).
- All images and prints included. 1-2 hour location or studio session .
- A special thank you and you will be listed as a company sponsor on the website, an artistic display in the studio, and Facebook.

Or:

8 x 10  Artistic Print (any) from either my photo collection or personal art collection.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Additional Options:

$600+ - Small Wedding Session (Free).
- All images included. 5-10 prints.
- A special thank you and you will be listed as a company sponsor on the website, an artistic display in the studio, and Facebook.

$1, 000+ - Large Wedding Session (Free).
- All images included and unlimited prints.
- A special thank you and you will be listed as a company sponsor on the website, an artistic display in the studio, and Facebook.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out!!

Tell everyone, your friends, your relatives, your work colleagues, your business partners, and so on!!

Please like me on Facebook (it really does make a difference, because one day someone you know might desperately need a photographer, and you could be their hero by suggesting me :)
Kimberly Chandler Photography

Also, you can use the indieGogo Share tools to spread the word.


You can also donate tools or supplies to the space if you're in the area!

Have some furniture (chairs, displays, desks..etc), art equipment, a projector screen, printer or any other art equipment just collecting dust in a storage space? We’ll gladly take them as a free donation to the studio in exchange of our eternal gratitude and we will add your name to our artistic display of sponsors (It also gives my husband another creative renovation project).

THANK YOU!!! (REALLY, YOU'RE AMAZING IF YOU READ THIS FAR!)
story_txt:
About me and my mission:
 My name is Kimberly Chandler. I'd like to take my photography and artwork to the next level by opening a studio where I can work and hopefully sell prints. But before diving into the 'why I'm doing it' and, more importantly, the perks I'm offering, here's a little about myself. Bio:I'm a wife (its been an interesting 12 years with a Marine turned fiction/satire writer), mother (I've won several mom-of-the-year awards in my household, but I think the judging is rigged), ambitious college student working towards a PhD in psychology (I'm not sure if I can survive 4 more years of studying while raising 12-month-old twins, a diva 6-yr-old, and an unruly 35-yr-old Marine), computer artist (and I use the term artist very loosely since I don't really see myself as one), and an amateur photographer.  
I work online for an art related site. I'm one of the lucky ones to be able to work in my underwear if I wish. I worked up from a volunteer position to a paid administration position. Its an enjoyable job that involves my art and working with people from all over the world.  While I've already invested a lot of time and money in this endeavor, I could still use help raising money for equipment beyond the initial start-up costs. So, why am I doing this? Well...Your donations will help me make my studio possible, and provide a safe haven for my sanity every now and then since photography and art are my creative outlets. But beyond that, 
I'll be providing my community with a service that is affordable.I'm originally from Jacksonville, Florida, but my husband relocated us to his hometown of Louisiana, Missouri, a town of less than 4,000 people. Culture shock was inevitable, but the town itself it picturesque and full of potential. In fact, Louisiana is working hard to revitalize its downtown and bring new businesses, jobs, and 
customers to the area. I want to be a part of that effort, and I hope that I can help improve our economy by providing affordable services to locals and bring new customers to town.I plan to open in mid October for individual, couple, family, small business, and corporate clients, but I want to eventually do much more such as create photo books through my husbands indie press .   Okay, So Here's the Part You Probably Skipped to Anyway... What We Need & What You Get:All funds contributed will be used to buy:* Lighting* Props (back drops & actual props)* Camera lens* Editing software (lightroom) * A monitor to allow clients to view their proofs* Extras: sync cables, power strips, office supplies, extra bulbs.What YOU get:$5: A thank you, and you'll have your name listed as a sponsor on my website.$10: A really BIG thank you.- Your name listed on my website and in the studio on an artistic display.$20: Artistic Print (photo or personal art work collection).- Choose your favorite from a selection of my works.$50: Photo session
    or Artistic Print (photo or personal art work collection).- A 30 minute portrait session. - 5 edited photos.- Special thank you and listed as a company sponsor on the website, an artistic display in the studio, and Facebook. story:
ABOUT TODDLEWOOD

ToddleWood®, Toddlers in Hollywood, the brainchild of New York photographer Tricia Messeroux, transforms everyday kids into superstar celebrities, iconic figures and historic legends…all captured in breathtaking photographs. As Creative Director and Senior Photographer, Tricia leads a dynamic team of talented costume designers, gifted hair & makeup artists and a diligent production crew - all of whom play an important role in bringing these photographs to life.    Celebrity looks range from young to old and classic to contemporary. Over 100 celebrities are depicted in Toddlewood’s® diverse portfolio including Beyonce, Adele, Josephine Baker, Marilyn Monroe, Oprah Winfrey, Audrey Hepburn, P. Diddy, J Lo, Destiny’s Child and so many others!

Toddlewood began in 2008 with a simple yet unique idea and has now grown to be an international brand.  Toddlewood receives continuous calls from Dublin, Australia, London, Columbia, Japan, China, Mexico just to name a few.  Tricia and Toddlewood's media exposure has been and continues to be of the top A-list media outlets in Television, On-line, Magazine ad Newpapers.  Toddlewood is becoming a household name!  


WHAT'S HAPPENING NEXT?

Award season is an important time for the Toddlewood brand and entertainment media.  Parents of kids from everywhere send in their submissions and attend the casting call for an opportunity to be part of the world of Toddlewood.  

It's entertainment, it's fun, it's a party!  Toddlewood is a positive and celebratory experience for all those involved.  The photos will end up in a year end coffee table book where some of the proceeds will go to a children's charity.

2014 we will be recreating the following images:

- Golden Globes (red carpet)

- The Grammys (red carpet)

- The Oscars Movie Posters 

- The Oscars (red carpet)

- Iconic Images to commemorate Black History Month

- 2nd Annual Mother's Day Edition (Iconic celebrity mom role models)

- A Surprise project to be revealed!


Click on the "Gallery" tab at the top of this page for more videos and my Toddlewood PHOTOGRAPHS!


WHY WE NEED THE FUNDS:

- Casting call logistics

- Glam Squad products (hair, make up etc..)

- Studio rentals

- Special photography equipment (special lighting, specific lenses, camera accessories)

- Wardrobe (fabrics and embellishments to make each outfit)

- Marketing/PR

- The Staff

story:
*Scroll până jos pentru traducerea în limba română*

About the book 

It's been 4 years now since I've been constantly taking photos of my hometown, without being able to explain to myself why. I found out just recently, while working on this book. The answer is: I feel homesick. Obvious? Rather not... For me, the feeling of homesickness is not about the romantic image of a sunset at the hangout place, nor the smell of baked pies made by my grandmother.  My feeling of homesick lies beyond, floating somewhere around all those familiar places.

I've always felt the ghostly atmosphere of my town, but now, after years of being away and visiting only once in a while, I became aware of the impact that migration has had on small cities. I realize I've also contributed to it myself, the day I left my hometown. Therefore, this project became like an archive where I store the places that keep my memories, my identity.

There's a whole universe inside the photos, inside the book. It's the world of hometowns and that's why I believe that other people can relate to it as well. It is something that I can't explain through words and it should stay like that, like being homesick. You can't judge it; you can only embrace it. 

The project has already received some recognition

  • 60% of the book's budget is already financed by the Romanian Administration of the National Cultural Fund
  • 20 images from the series were exhibited in 2016 in Munich, Germany @ Die Faerberei Gallery
  • a second exhibition of the photos will take place in Bucharest on The White Night of the Art Galleries starting October 6 @ AP. 1 gallery.
  • photos published on VICE in multiple articles, both national and international

Meet the team 

  • Dragos Hanciu - photographer and the co-editor of the book. He started as a documentary film director, but now he is putting up together 4 years of documenting his hometown  http://dragoshanciu.com/
  • Fiorenza Pinna - the editor and curator of the book, who will help me put everything together. Since 2009, she has been producing and curating exhibitions, books, and photobook workshops all over the world – working with renowned photographers like Rinko Kawauchi, Anouk Kruithof, Rob Hornstra, Joachim Schmid, among the others. 
  • Jasmina Al-Qaisi - is a visual ethnographer currently working in Berlin's blooming art space, Savvy Contemporary. She will write a not-so-serious essay about the photos, migration and homesickness, which will be included in the book. The essay is written both in English and Romanian.
  • LOOT - is a the duo of Ana Grigoroiu and Ste Dobrescu. They work actively as graphic designers with a playful approach. They are the brains of JUG Magazine and their design doesn't stop here. LOOT is making a various collection of clothing and accessories. https://weareloot.com/
  • Fabrik - a premium Romanian printing house, who has been winning several awards for the books they've bound in the past years, will do the magical manufacture of the object, the book. http://www.fabrik.ro/
  • Bianca Oana - project manager
  • Petre - wood artist - responsible with the colored stripes https://www.facebook.com/stripeskateboards/
  • Black Horse Mansion - videographers https://www.facebook.com/blackhorsemansion/

Technical Facts  

Self-Published edition of 300 copies, 96 color pages, sewn binding, softcover with a photo on each side of the cover. The essay is written both in English and Romanian. The book will contain approx. 70 photos.

The Impact 

Starting from the premise that small cities can shrink to the verge of total abandonment, Hometown appears right before an abrupt change, standing out as the ambassador of the places we call home.

Hometown will say no to "update" and tell us how it used to be, before things start to fundamentally change, or even disappear. 

Risks and challenges

I have a tight deadline to finish the book, given by The Administration of the National Cultural Fund, which is the 15th of November 2017. If I don't finance the book by the deadline, the fund will take the money back.

Apart from losing the financing, the risks are minimal. I have a great creative & professional team around me who are doing this kind of stuff for a living.

What I Need & What You Get 

This campaign will part-fund the following expenses:

  • printing press (printing, binding, cover, finishing)

  • scanning the negatives and grading the photos
  • graphic design & DTP

All the film rolls, laboratory expenses, and travel costs have been already supported by the photographer, so the money raised here will not be used to refinance those expenses, they will go straight into the making of the book.

If you will help me reach beyond 4500$, this will enable a new feature for the book: a hardcover.

In exchange for your support, you will receive some treats as well.

The giveaways are manufactured by Petre, my childhood friend. Check them out.

The magical reading ring // Degetarul de carte

The 10x15cm photo frame // Rama foto de birou 10x15cm

Bookmarks // Semne de carte

Pencil Holder // Suportul de creioane

Book Stand // Suportul de cărţi

  • your name will be written at the end of the book
  • a signed copy of the photo book Hometown - edition of 300 only.
  • 10x15cm signed high quality prints of any picture you want from the project - you will be able to choose from never seen before pictures! 
  • 20x30cm Museum Print. Get one of the 20 Fine Art Prints exhibited @ Die Faerberei gallery in Munich last year + a certificate of authenticity. Each photo is limited to 12 copies and some of them are long gone! You can send a message to ask for more details, or drop by AP. 1 gallery in Bucharest to see them http://ap1.space/
  • unique objects made out of recycled skateboards by my childhood friend, Petre (this is not his real name). He is making special limited editions of the objects for the book. You can get a reading ring, a bookmark, a pencil holder, a 10x15cm desk photo frame, and a book stand. The objects covered in colored stripes, so you can't miss them. 
  • postcards: 7 postcards with 7 poems written by Jasmina Al-Qaisi. 

Postcards with poems by Jasmina Al-Qaisi

Shipping is included for all the goodies.

Outside EU backers, please contact me before buying prints to check customs costs.

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • If you can't support the book financially, you can always help by sharing the campaign. And ask friends and friends of friends to do it as well.

  • Visit your hometown. Let me know you did that via social media (fb or instagram @Dragos Hanciu, or simply hashtag #hometown, #dragoshanciu, #homesick).

Thanks for being here. 

 

// Despre carte

De 4 ani fac poze în oraşul meu natal fără să pot să-mi explic motivul. Mi-am dat seama doar recent în timp ce lucram la carte. Răspunsul este dorul de casă. Evident? Nu chiar... pentru că eu nu asociez dorul de casă cu imaginea romantică a unui apus de soare în locul în care stăteam cu prietenii și nici cu mirosul de plăcinte făcute de bunică-mea. Dorul de casă e dincolo de toate astea, răspândit undeva în banalul locurilor.

Mereu am simţit că oraşul are o atmosferă fantomatică, însă acum, după ani de absență, am devenit conştient de impactul pe care l-a avut migrarea asupra oraşelor mici şi mi-am dat seama că şi eu am contribuit la asta atunci când am plecat. Așa că proiectul Hometown a devenit un fel de arhivă unde depozitez locurile care îmi stochează amintirile şi identitatea.

Simt că e o lume în toate aceste fotografii, în carte. E lumea oraşelor natale şi de aceea cred că şi alţi oameni pot empatiza cu aceste locuri. E ceva ce nu pot explica în cuvinte şi cred că ar trebui să rămână aşa, ca dorul de casă. Nu trebuie să fie judecat, ci doar acceptat.

Materialitatea cărţii este decisivă. Hometown este o carte-obiect menită ca o experienţă, ce are scopul final de a te trimite cu mintea la tine acasă. Pentru a realiza asta, am făcut echipă cu:

  • Fiorenza Pinna, editorul şi curatorul cărţii care mă va ajuta să pun totul cap la cap. Începând din 2009, produce şi curatoriază expoziţii, cărţi şi workshop-uri de carte foto – colaborează cu Rinko Kawauchi, Anouk Kruithof, Rob Hornstra, Joachim Schmid, printre alţii.
  • Jasmina Al-Qaisi este etnograf vizual, iar în prezent lucrează în Berlin la Savvy Contemporary. Va scrie în carte un eseu degajat despre imagini, migrare şi dorul de casă. În română şi engleză
  • Fabrik, una dintre cele mai importante tipografii de la noi, câștigătoare de premii cu cărțile pe care le-a legat în trecut, implementează cu atenţie totul şi se asigură că ne iese o carte-obiect de cea mai bună calitate.

Proiectul a primit deja ceva recunoaştere

  • 60% din bugetul cărţii este finanţat de Administraţia Fondului Cultural Naţional.
  • 20 dintre fotografii au fost deja expuse în 2016 în galeria Die Faerberei în Munchen.
  • a doua expoziţie a fotografiilor în Bucureşti în cadrul Nopţii Albe a Galeriilor în 6 October la galeria AP. 1.
  • fotografii din proiect au apărut în mai multe articole pe VICE - atât național, cât și internaţional

// De ce am nevoie & Ce primești la schimb

  • numele tău scris la finalul cărţii
  • cartea Hometown semnată - ediție limitată de 300 de exemplare.
  • cărți poștale: 7 cărți poștale cu 7 pozii scrise de Jasmina Al-Qaisi
  • print 10x15cm pe hârtie fotografică de calitate, semnat. Poți să alegi ce poză vrei, chiar şi dintre cele nepublicate!
  • print Fine Art de 20x30cm în ediție limitată de 12, însoțit de certificat de autenticitate. Vei putea alege 1 din cele 20 expuse în 2016 la galeria Die Faerberei din Munchen. Fii atent, că unele s-au dat deja.  Trimite-mi un mesaj pentru imagini sau alte informații, sau vino să le vezi pe viu în galeria AP. 1 din București http://ap1.space/
  • obiecte unice din plăci de skate reciclate făcute de prietenul meu din copilărie, Petre (nu îl cheamă așa de fapt). El manufacturează o serie limitată de obiecte unice, special pentru carte. Pe listă avem: degetare de carte, semne de carte, suporturi de creioane, rame foto 10x15 pentru birou și suporturi de cărți. Obiectele sunt pline de linii colorate, ca să sară în ochii oricui. 

// Impact

Plecând de la premisa că oraşele mici se micşorează până la limita extincției, Hometown apare chiar înaintea unei schimbări abrupte, ca un ambasador al tuturor locurilor pe care le asociem cu acasă.

Hometown spune nu "update"-ului, scopul fiind să ne arate cum era înainte ca lucrurile să se schimbe fundamental sau chiar să dispară.

// Provocări şi riscuri

Am un termen-limită strâns pentru finalizarea cărţii, dat de către Administraţia Fondului Cultural Naţional şi anume, 15 Noiembrie 2017. Dacă nu reuşesc să finanţez cartea până atunci, fondul va lua banii înapoi.

În afară de pierderea finanţării, riscurile sunt minimale. Am o echipă creativă foarte bună în jurul meu care trăieşte din proiecte de genul acesta.

// Echipa

Scroll mai sus, la Meet the Team - poti vedea numele, rolul lor în proiect și website-uri.

// Alte feluri în care poţi ajuta

  • Dacă nu poţi susţine financiar proiectul, poţi oricând să ajuţi prin a da share campaniei. Roagă-ţi prietenii să facă la fel.
  • Mai treci prin hometown-ul tău..și arată-mi și mie că ai făcut asta pe unul din canalele de socializare (facebook sau instagram @Dragos Hanciu, sau pune ca hashtag #hometown, #dragoshanciu, #dordecasa). 

Și mersi că ești aici.

20x30cm Museum Print. Get one of the 20 Fine Art Prints exhibited @ Die Faerberei gallery in Munich last year + a certificate of authenticity. Each photo is limited to 12 copies and some of them are long gone! You can send a message to ask for more details, or drop by AP. 1 gallery in Bucharest to see them http://ap1.space/

unique objects made out of recycled skateboards by my childhood friend, Petre (this is not his real name). He is making special limited editions of the objects for the book. You can get a reading ring, a bookmark, a pencil holder, a 10x15cm desk photo frame, and a book stand. The objects covered in colored stripes, so you can't miss them. 
postcards: 7 postcards with 7 poems written by Jasmina Al-Qaisi. 

Postcards with poems by Jasmina Al-Qaisi

Shipping is included for all the goodies.
Outside EU backers, please contact me before buying prints to check customs costs.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't support the book financially, you can always help by sharing the campaign. And ask friends and friends of friends to do it as well.
Visit your hometown. Let me know you did that via social media (fb or instagram @Dragos Hanciu, or simply hashtag #hometown, #dragoshanciu, #homesick).

Thanks for being here. 
 
// Despre carte
De 4 ani fac poze în oraşul meu natal fără să pot să-mi explic motivul. Mi-am dat seama doar recent în timp ce lucram la carte. Răspunsul este dorul de casă. Evident? Nu chiar... pentru că eu nu asociez dorul de casă cu imaginea romantică a unui apus de soare în locul în care stăteam cu prietenii și nici cu mirosul de plăcinte făcute de bunică-mea. Dorul de casă e dincolo de toate astea, răspândit undeva în banalul locurilor.
Mereu am simţit că oraşul are o atmosferă fantomatică, însă acum, după ani de absență, am devenit conştient de impactul pe care l-a avut migrarea asupra oraşelor mici şi mi-am dat seama că şi eu am contribuit la asta atunci când am plecat. Așa că proiectul Hometown a devenit un fel de arhivă unde depozitez locurile care îmi stochează amintirile şi identitatea.
Simt că e o lume în toate aceste fotografii, în carte. E lumea oraşelor natale şi de aceea cred că şi alţi oameni pot empatiza cu aceste locuri. E ceva ce nu pot explica în cuvinte şi cred că ar trebui să rămână aşa, ca dorul de casă. Nu trebuie să fie judecat, ci doar acceptat.
Materialitatea cărţii este decisivă. Hometown este o carte-obiect menită ca o experienţă, ce are scopul final de a te trimite cu mintea la tine acasă. Pentru a realiza asta, am făcut echipă cu:

Fiorenza Pinna, editorul şi curatorul cărţii care mă va ajuta să pun totul cap la cap. Începând din 2009, produce şi curatoriază expoziţii, cărţi şi workshop-uri de carte foto – colaborează cu Rinko Kawauchi, Anouk Kruithof, Rob Hornstra, Joachim Schmid, printre alţii.
Jasmina Al-Qaisi este etnograf vizual, iar în prezent lucrează în Berlin la Savvy Contemporary. Va scrie în carte un eseu degajat despre imagini, migrare şi dorul de casă. În română şi engleză
Fabrik, una dintre cele mai importante tipografii de la noi, câștigătoare de premii cu cărțile pe care le-a legat în trecut, implementează cu atenţie totul şi se asigură că ne iese o carte-obiect de cea mai bună calitate.

Proiectul a primit deja ceva recunoaştere

60% din bugetul cărţii este finanţat de Administraţia Fondului Cultural Naţional.
20 dintre fotografii au fost deja expuse în 2016 în galeria Die Faerberei în Munchen.
a doua expoziţie a fotografiilor în Bucureşti în cadrul Nopţii Albe a Galeriilor în 6 October la galeria AP. 1.
fotografii din proiect au apărut în mai multe articole pe VICE - atât național, cât și internaţional

// De ce am nevoie & Ce primești la schimb

numele tău scris la finalul cărţii
cartea Hometown semnată - ediție limitată de 300 de exemplare.
cărți poștale: 7 cărți poștale cu 7 pozii scrise de Jasmina Al-Qaisi
print 10x15cm pe hârtie fotografică de calitate, semnat. Poți să alegi ce poză vrei, chiar şi dintre cele nepublicate!
print Fine Art de 20x30cm în ediție limitată de 12, însoțit de certificat de autenticitate. Vei putea alege 1 din cele 20 expuse în 2016 la galeria Die Faerberei din Munchen. Fii atent, că unele s-au dat deja.  Trimite-mi un mesaj pentru imagini sau alte informații, sau vino să le vezi pe viu în galeria AP. 1 din București http://ap1.space/

obiecte unice din plăci de skate reciclate făcute de prietenul meu din copilărie, Petre (nu îl cheamă așa de fapt). El manufacturează o serie limitată de obiecte unice, special pentru carte. Pe listă avem: degetare de carte, semne de carte, suporturi de creioane, rame foto 10x15 pentru birou și suporturi de cărți. Obiectele sunt pline de linii colorate, ca să sară în ochii oricui. 

// Impact
Plecând de la premisa că oraşele mici se micşorează până la limita extincției, Hometown apare chiar înaintea unei schimbări abrupte, ca un ambasador al tuturor locurilor pe care le asociem cu acasă.
Hometown spune nu "update"-ului, scopul fiind să ne arate cum era înainte ca lucrurile să se schimbe fundamental sau chiar să dispară.
// Provocări şi riscuri
Am un termen-limită strâns pentru finalizarea cărţii, dat de către Administraţia Fondului Cultural Naţional şi anume, 15 Noiembrie 2017. Dacă nu reuşesc să finanţez cartea până atunci, fondul va lua banii înapoi.
În afară de pierderea finanţării, riscurile sunt minimale. Am o echipă creativă foarte bună în jurul meu care trăieşte din proiecte de genul acesta.
// Echipa
Scroll mai sus, la Meet the Team - poti vedea numele, rolul lor în proiect și website-uri.
// Alte feluri în care poţi ajuta

Dacă nu poţi susţine financiar proiectul, poţi oricând să ajuţi prin a da share campaniei. Roagă-ţi prietenii să facă la fel.
Mai treci prin hometown-ul tău..și arată-mi și mie că ai făcut asta pe unul din canalele de socializare (facebook sau instagram @Dragos Hanciu, sau pune ca hashtag #hometown, #dragoshanciu, #dordecasa). 

Și mersi că ești aici.

story:
An Art Show Unlike Any Other

           Our story starts nearly a decade ago in the hills of Quantico, Virginia. Together we battled through sleep deprivation, physical exhaustion, and mind games to earn the title of United States Marines. We were stationed at nearby bases on the West Coast and used our weekends to develop our photography work alongside each other. On the beaches of San Diego, in the mountains of Yosemite, and through the rocky canyons of the Anza Borrego Desert, we kept pushing the envelope with our photography, but more importantly, our hunger for thrill seeking.

           We culminated our years of experience as photographers, outdoorsmen, and military planners when we embarked on a seventeen-day winter photography project in the unforgiving and alien landscape of Iceland. We planned for logistical factors, camped in the snow, hiked icy trails, tracked atmospheric conditions, made critical decisions on the fly, and created some of the most incredible images of our careers.

            We’re producing this gallery show because we want to share our artwork and insights about the methods behind our madness with you. Among our prints on display will be audience favorites from years past, as well as previously unpublished images from Iceland making their world debut at the show. We'll also tell you all about the planning process that sets us apart from other photographers.

Our show is free to attend, but here on this page you can reserve your VIP pass, or get the drop on special print deals if you won’t be able to attend. Attendees will be rewarded with complimentary wine, beer, and food.

VIP Passes

For your $50 contribution, you get:

  • A signed 5x7” print from one of the artists.
  • 5Bravo stickers
  • Exclusive champagne service during the show.
  • A complimentary cocktail from Blake’s on Poydras at the after party.

story:
PERSPEKTIVE.

Die Welt aus einem anderen Blickwinkel.

 

Wir sind der Meinung, dass einem leider die Zeit fehlt, um die gesamte Welt zu erkunden. Eine Lösung dazu wäre unser Bildband. Eine Möglichkeit sich zurückzuziehen und in der Ferne schweifen, um sich von einem unentdecktes Land verzaubern zu lassen. Zudem kann der Leser andere Blickwinkel auf eine bestimmte Situation erkunden und die eigene Sicht auf persönliche und Sachverhalte hinterfragen.

Wir sind zwei Journalismus Studentinnen aus Berlin und wollen mit unserem Bachelorprojekt zeigen, dass Journalismus viel mehr zu bieten hat, als nur (Fernsehen). Dafür nehmen wir Dich mit auf eine Reise nach Island. Gestartet wird in Deinem Wohnzimmer. Denn verlassen musst Du es für diese Reise auch nicht. Perspektivwechsel in DIN A4.

Wir benötigen Deine finanzielle Hilfe, um ein Bildband mit journalistischen Texten zu veröffentlichen. Das Geld wird zum einen für einen Teil der Reisekosten und die Equipment-Ausleihe sowie zum anderen für die Druckkosten verwendet.

 

Danke für Deine Hilfe!

Mariella & Runa 

_____________________________________________________________________________________ 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann.

 

Wenn Du uns unterstützen möchtest, auch wenn der Geldbeutel es nicht hergibt, begrüßen wir das natürlich auch herzlich! 

  • Sprich mit Deinen Freunden über unser Buch.
  • Nutze Indiegogo.com für die virale Verbreitung.
  • Kennst Du vielleicht einen Kontakt zu einem Verlag, der Interesse hätte unser Buch zu veröffentlichen?
 

Wir danken Dir für Deine Hilfe!

story:
To purchase Boundary's Prima System please visit:

www.boundarysupply.com

 

 

 

Featured In:

The Prima System's adaptable storage and dynamic features make life more comfortable by providing a simple carry solution for daily use and traveling.

The Prima Pack, Verge Case and Fieldspace provides unbeatable organization and adapts for unplanned stowage. Unique magnetic trims, YKK Stormguard® zippers and high performance fabrics let you store and access gear effortlessly while providing peace of mind. 

 

 

HOW THE PRIMA MODULAR SYSTEM FUNCTIONS:

The Prima System expands from 25 liters to 30 liters while the Verge case provides an additional 10 liters of storage - the perfect pack for daily use or extended weekend travels.

 

 

 

PRIMA SYSTEM FEATURES:

Boundary's Team understand that every step in the manufacturing process and facet of business has an environmental and human impact, so we pride ourselves as a brand that uses the bluesign® system throughout our supply chain to ensure fair labor practices, safe working conditions and sustainable fabric production. 

 EXTERIOR FEATURES: 

 

While designing the Prima System we thought about all the situations you go through daily and designed innovative feature to change the way gear is stored and accessed.

Magnetic buckles, YKK Stormguard® zippers, and water-resistant fabrics decrease access and stowage time while providing peace of mind.

 

 

Commuter friendly features make it the perfect pack for living a seamless lifestyle. 

The Magnetic Key Chain is perfect for metrocards, bike keys, and other essentials.

 

INTERIOR FEATURES:

The Prima Systems's interior fabrics use low impact durable coatings, brushed silicone and PU backings for unbeatable protection for easy cleaning. #10 YKK Stormguard®  center zip provides a "duffle bag like" intimate view and access to gear.

Interior stretch mesh pockets keep small items from bouncing around inside the pack and within reach. The interior fabrics are spun, woven, and treated to support a lifestyle that requires fabrics to kill odor, stays clean by repelling stains and dust.

STORMPROOF LAPTOP COMPARTMENT:

A water resistant compartment holds a 15” laptop, and our innovative Fieldspace. Is easily accessible when on the move or sitting in a coffee shop. Has a padded interior with our signature NYWOOL®  keeps electronics protected. 

The magnetic dock secures the Fieldspace keeping it in the center of your back - secure, comfortable, and effortlessly organized.

 

 

 PRIMA'S LFT® HARNESS:

The PRIMA’s innovative LFT® Harness is breathable, wicks sweat, anti-microbial and extremely comfortable for daily commuting or week long adventures.

The LFT® Harness regulates back temperature, wicks sweat, and evenly distributes pack load to comfortably fits women and men of all sizes.

Magnetic sternum strap allows you to effortlessly secure the harness to your body while walking or biking.

 

VERGE CASE FEATURES:

The Verge allows you to securely store camera equipment in the main compartment and converts to a shoulder bag so you can take your essentials with you. It stows 5 liters and can adapt to hold 10 liters by unzipping a YKK zipper at the base of the bag.

Unique features and pocketing keep camera gear organized and easily accessible.   

Padded sidewalls, flexible dividers and a base-zip triples the Verges capacity to simultaneously store travel gear and camera equipment. The Verge is the perfect shoulder bag for a hike or city detour.

 When traveling it gives you the option to leave your pack behind and get lost. Remove the Prima Pack's waist belt and attach it to the verge so you can travel with less bulk when out on the town or going for a hike.

 

 

 

FIELDSPACE FEATURES:

Fashion driven performance adapts the look of the Fieldspace to professional settings and brilliant organization keeps you focused while on the go. Elastic pockets and Hypalon dividers store any tool or charger helping you stay effortlessly organized while on the move.

 

A Magnetic Dock secures the Fieldspace inside the stormproof electronic compartment in the center of the LFT harness -  unbeatable comfort. 

 

 

BILL OF MATERIALS AND TRIMS:

 

 

 

ENVIRON MERINO SHIRT:

Boundary's Merino is sourced from sustainable small village farms. We incorporate these fibers in our products because they exceptionally soft and comfortable. Wool fiber has a mechanical stretch, meaning the fiber naturally can stretch, form and shape to the contours of your body and movements. Fabrics are also extremely breathable and regulate body temperature.

 

WHY BLUESIGN® :

Bluesign® cuts through the marketing noise by acting as a voice for the environment and the consumer by examining the supply chain from fiber to finished product. Stringent chemical standards, safe working conditions, and energy from renewable sources ensures consumers acquire a sustainable product. Boundary is committed to preserving the resources that we explore and draw inspiration and will never compromise our core values.

Boundary’s passion is making innovative products, while its love is being actively engaged in expanding and protecting our surroundings. Boundary’s team is supporting initiatives that will keep our Land, Water and Rock environments pristine. Our LWR Initiative aims to protect waterways, mountain bike trails, commuter bike paths, and climbing areas that serve as an outlet for our team to get back to what inspires our core philosophy.

THE BOUNDARY TEAM:

Boundary grew from an intention to make highly functioning products through technical innovation, curb the appetite for consumerism by making resilient goods, and support initiatives that directly benefit the environments we draw inspiration from. Through function driven design, we create essential products that suit the dynamism of everyday life, be it on or off the trail.

Our passion is making innovative products, while our love is being actively engaged in expanding and protecting our surroundings. Boundary’s team is supporting initiatives that will keep our Land, Water and Rock environments pristine. Boundary's LWR Initiative aims to protect waterways, mountain bike trails, commuter bike paths, and climbing areas that serve as an outlet for our team to get back to what inspires our core philosophy at Boundary.

 REWARDS:

 

PRODUCTION TIME LINE:
