story:
THE CAMPAIGN IS OVER, BUT YOU CAN BUY the new BLIPS on the Indiegogo Marketplace HERE!

---

 

A unique set of mini-objectives for smartphones and tablets that allows you to explore the micro-world.

White flowers / Forficula auricularia / skin with hair

4 different lenses for different purposes: Macro Plus, Macro, Micro and Ultra lenses!

Bee taken with Blips Macro Plus / Ultra LabKit / Full Kit Metal / Flea taken with Ultra

Fingerprint / Bee/ Eye taken using Macro Plus lens on smartphone

Passion fruit flower shot with Blips MACRO lens

Clover shot with Blips MICRO lens

  

Stem of Pumpkin shot with Blips ULTRA

A gateway to the microscopic world for everyone: BLIPS can be easily used for technical investigations or just for fun!

 

EXTREMELY THIN & LIGHT: the world's thinnest set of microscope lenses for smartphones and tablets 

VERY AFFORDABLE: for all budgets 

ULTRA PORTABLE: can easily fit in your pocket or wallet  

BLIPS is so slim that you can connect it to your device and keep it in your pocket without having to worry about losing it.

HIGH RESOLUTION: Distinguish details <4 microns

lice shot with BLIPS Micro

BETA TESTER'S COMMENT: 

“Having an easy to use microscope in the pocket of your jacket opens a world of possibilities to observe the deeper details of Nature inners working in everyday life. I have been carrying Blips with me for some times now and I ended up pulling it out in many occasions for a quick glance (and picture) at otherwise hidden and fascinating phenomena. With its ease of use, portability and performance such a small object expands so much our vision that it is even difficult to forecast in how many ingenious and artistic ways it can be used.” 

Dr. M. Stefancich, Institute of Materials for Electronics and Magnetism, Italian National Research Council

human eye shot with BLIPS Macro

Honey bee shot with BLIPS Macro

REPOSITIONABLE AND REUSABLE: It sticks again and again! 

No unwieldy spring clips pressing on your touch screen

HIGHLY ADJUSTABLE: to fit any devices  

You can cut the film using scissors, shaping BLIPS as you prefer. The two sticky bands are meant to enhance adherence onto non-polished surfaces; the lens will always stick on the glass when the surface is clean.

EASY TO CLEAN: dust free, non-sticky top surfaces 

 

(Do not touch the adhesive bands often. Grease and dust affect their adhesive strength.) 

SUPER COMPATIBLE: it works on all models of smartphones and tablets

From neuroscience labs to your pocket! 

BLIPS has been developed within the neuroscience labs of the Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia (IIT) exploiting the materials and the methods used for the manufacturing of micro devices for the investigation of neuronal networks. Although it was born in a research lab, it has been designed for mass production from the very beginning. 

REVIEW FROM BETA TESTERS AROUND THE WORLD:

"The blips lenses are awesome! They are so easy to use, you just stick the micro or macro lens on your phone's camera (they literally are stickers) and you are ready to blip away. They are small and lightweight which allows you to have them always available, hence you never have to say again: "Oh I wish I had my camera with me". I have them in the back of my phone I love taking pictures with an artistic flavor to them as a hobby. I especially like taking pictures of insects, flowers and skin. Blips allows you to take pictures with great zoom (micro mode) which otherwise would require a dslr with a special lens (if not a microscope). With blips, anyone can become an artist! It's so easy to take beautiful, artistic pictures!"

Vicky P. Phd Student, UC San Diego - USA
 

It allows you to take high definition macro pictures with optical magnification of about 10 times. It is extremely thin, about 1/50 inch (0.5mm), and very user friendly. It represents the first step from “standard” photography towards portable microscopy. Its working distance, i.e. the distance between the lens and the focal plane, is of about 1/2 inch (12mm). 

lemon flower / ladybug / passion fruit flower shot with Blips MACRO lens

Hence, it can be used like a high power magnification lens for precision works or for several other applications where an enhanced electronic eye is desired, from technical uses to sheer fun. For example, it can be used for quality control of soldering works, on cloth, seams, paints or other manufactured items. Needle and thread insertion, self-examination of moles, skin, or nails, children’s hair inspections for head lice/nits, insects or spiders observation, checking of parasites on leaves, etc.  

drop on a leaf / daisy / beetle on a flower / human eye

Japanese statue shot with Blips MACRO lens

Using BLIPS MICRO you are able to turn your smartphone into a real microscope in seconds! 

Honey bee antenna shot with BLIPS Micro

Blips Micro is able to detect details of about 1/7000 inch (≈1/300 mm), distinguishing single cells or other inhabitants of the micro-world. BLIPS Micro is less than 1/20 inch (≈1.2mm) high, and turns your phone into an actual digital microscope. You need to keep a distance of ¼ inch (6mm) between the lens and the sample under observation to discover tiny details at a high definition. With the use of the digital zoom it’s possible to achieve magnification of over 100x*. 

cerebellum / trachea / liver shot with BLIPS Micro

*Note: the magnification factor depends on the model of smartphone or tablet used. To measure the magnification factor we suggest to take a picture of two tick marks on a ruler and measure the captured image on the screen. Other products claimed magnification factors often prove lower than claimed when tested by using this method.

Sand shot with Blips Micro lens


In addition to the BLIPS Micro and Macro lenses, a new lens with the highest level of magnification, twice as powerful as the Micro Lens, has been developed. 

A flea and an ant head photographed with Blips ULTRA lens

Due to the high level of magnification, the ULTRA Lens should be used with Lab Kit pledges, which assure the needed level of stability for shooting photos and videos, thanks to the included Smartphone Stage included in every Lab Kit.

 

A package made of two lenses: 1 BLIPS MACRO & 1 BLIPS MICRO plus 2 small sponges which facilitate to stabilize the focus.

Note: each smartphone model is different; slightly press the sponge to find the correct distance for your device.

BLIPS LAB KIT can be used for scientific studies or even just for fun! A useful tool for technical discoveries or educational purposes, provided at an affordable price.  

A smartphone stage and a light source are included!

To use Micro to explore the realm of microscopy we also offer a selection of pre-prepared microscope slides plus an easy to assemble mechanical accessory with a sufficient light source for optimum observation of flat and thin samples. In our standard pack you will find glass slides of insect parts, parasites and human tissues.

The pack contains: 

• 2 BLIPS lenses: Micro & Macro

• 1 light source

• 2 sponges

• 1 smartphone stage

• 6 prepared slides

Using the smartphone stage (included in all LAB KIT perks!) you'll improve the performance of your BLIPS lenses.

The pack contains: 

•3 BLIPS lenses: Micro, Macro and ULTRA

• 1 light source

• 2 sponges

• 1 smartphone stage

• 6 prepared slides

Human kidney and Human blood shot with Blips ULTRA Lens

Whether it is for precise manufacturing, or you just need to handle tweezers or other tools, you often need your hands free. Using our smart stand desk holder, you can position your smartphone and use it like a high magnification optical lens.

• needle and thread 
• jewelry
• building tiny models 
• precise reparations

Blips is marketed as a tool for various industry professionals. The macro lens is perfect for detailed work such as model-making, intricate repairs, restoration works and self inspections for head lice, moles and skin dermatitis.

Jewellery-making

Restoration works

 

WHAT'S THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN MICRO, MACRO AND THE NEW ULTRA? 

MACRO: The best option to observe insects or objects in motion. Its deeper focus allows you to easily follow the subject you are examining. 

MICRO: For higher magnification; maximal resolution (ability to see small details) can be achieved by using transmitted light through the subject you are observing (for example using prepared slides and a light source from behind)

ULTRA: The brand new Blips Lens with the highest magnification. It requires a Lab Kit Pledge to work, as it provides the proper stand to guarantee the necessary stability to view and photograph slides and objects

 

1) Clean the glass of the camera with a piece of fabric or cloth to make sure dust and grease are properly removed  

2) Lift BLIPS by one end

3) Keep the two ends of the film facing upwards, align the lens on the camera and press it onto the glass window; it will adhere electrostatically, do not be afraid to touch and press the lens with your finger

4) Stick the rest of the film onto the smartphone body

5) Open the App (available freely for Android and IOS).

6) Move your device close to the subject under observation; the distance is 12mm for BLIPS Macro and 6mm for Micro. Put the lens as closer as possible to the sample and slowly move backwards until the image is focused, or use the sponge to easily find the correct distance. If light conditions are weak, activate the flashlight mode on your mobile (by activating the flash command in app)

LAB KIT INSTRUCTIONS 

NOTE: for smartphones that have the camera lens near the corner (for example iPhones), you can turn the extra film around the edge of the device or you can cut it away with scissors, as in the illustrated instructions. 

1) In order to achieve the best performance possible, make sure your Blips lens is aligned well on the camera.  

2) When sticking the lens onto the camera, try to reach the best optical contact between the two surfaces; make sure the surface between the film and the glass looks black and does not present any bubble. 

3) In order to improve adherence: 

• clean the glass from grease or dust 
• press the lens against the camera with your finger 
• warm the film up (best when > 20°C) and, whenever possible, the device, in order to improve the conformability of the film 
• gently clean the rear side of the lens from grease or dirt by using water or soapy water

BLIPS REQUIRES LITTLE MAINTENANCE

Keep BLIPS on the camera for as long as you need; you can stick the BLIPS lenses on your camera or nearby for a whole day or more. When you do not use BLIPS for long periods, place the lenses back on their original card. Keep them in your wallet, bag, or anywhere you want. 
Avoid to press on the lenses for extended periods. The adherence might be weak when applied below 15°C (50F).

THE APP PROVIDED IS IOS AND ANDROID COMPATIBLE  

The app adjusts your device’s settings in order to use it with Blips. 

USER FRIENDLY interface / LED TORCH command / AF Block / Easy sharing

If your device does not support Android or IOS you can easily use Blips with your favorite application, making sure the subject you are examining is exposed to enough light. If possible, lock the autofocus and visualize the captured images on full screen. 

BLIPS PROTECTS YOUR PRIVACY!

While playing around with BLIPS, we casually found out that when lenses are attached to a Mac / PC Camera, it also provides a strong privacy barrier, offering 2 different degrees of blurring. No more prying eyes on your devices! A cool extra perk to make good use of BLIPS.

BLIPS (patent pending technology) is made of composite multilayered structures. All the materials constituting BLIPS come from European and US suppliers. 

 

Each element is composed of a specifically designed objective lens, placed on a flexible film. The back side surface of the flexible film sticks on the glass of the mobile device (phone or tablet) covering the camera, by electrostatic forces. No glue is used behind the lenses, so there are no residues on the camera when the lens is removed. The film is long enough to ensure easy handling and correct lens alignment on the mobile device camera. Two sticky bands, made of specifically engineered material for multiple and clean use, help to keep the BLIPS firm on the device surface, on either glossy or matt device surface, without using unwieldy spring clips pressing against the touch screen of your device.

LENS:  

Extremely thin --> Macro Lens ≈ 0.5mm, Micro Lens<1.2mm 

Made of plastic resin of shore hardness D 80-90 --> not easily deformable

High refractive index material (n > 1.55) --> superior optical performance

Aspherical shape --> optimized optical design

Non-sticky top surface --> dust-free, extremely easy to clean 

Inert plastic, certified to meet the US Class VI USP protocol for use in medical applications in cases of skin contact --> harmless when in contact with skin 

High resolution --> Distinguishes details <4 microns (≈ 1/6500 inch) for Micro

SUPPORTING FILM: 

REACH compliant --> Safe 

Electrostatic adherence --> Adheres to clean, polished, smooth surfaces (like glass), re-usable without leaving adhesive residues 

Flexible and conformable --> adapts to the shape of your device 

Washable with soapy water --> Easy maintenance

SMO’s mission is to open the doors of microscopy to everyone, with different levels of uses and purposes. Since in every good microscope there is a carousel of related objectives, each one designed for different, specific purposes, SMO wants to provide a full set of objectives for portable devices, ready to use for everyone. BLIPS is its first product, providing two different magnification levels for a number of applications in daily life. 

Interested in writing about us? Please feel free to email us directly at blipspro@icloud.com and we will send it to you. 

 

TAKE INSPIRATION FROM OUR GALLERY ON INSTAGRAM AND FB AND USE #MAGNIFYTHEWORLD TO BE PART OF THE BLIPS COMMUNITY!

Risks & Challenges

BLIPS SmartMicroOptics Srl (SMO)’s first product and it’s the result of a technology transfer from the “Italian Institute of Technology”. Although it was born in a research lab, it has been designed for mass production from the very beginning. Even if extremely thin, BLIPS is a composite: part of it is made by using standard components and processes which were already largely available form a list of suppliers of SMO, while SMO is in charge of the rest of the fabrication process, setting the manufacturing facility for large production. The current manufacturing capability, in lab scale, is of 100 BLIPS per day, which will be scaled up during the next weeks, according to the success of the campaign. All the materials constituting BLIPS come from European and US suppliers. The accessories have been selected by testing a number of components available on the market, specifically designing new components and establishing relationships with reliable external manufacturers, aiming at the highest level of satisfaction of the backers. 
BLIPS is a brand new product; in order to test and improve it in the last months we have distributed many samples (approximately 100-150) to different people in terms of age, culture and education levels, collecting comments and suggestions for a proper development of the product. The feedbacks were usually enthusiastic, even for the first prototypes. The founder of SmartMicroOptics is experienced in start-up creation and rump-up production; nevertheless, since BLIPS is the first product of a new company, some unexpected issues might arise when changing facilities and when passing from the lab scale to mass production. In order to face some of these problems, we have designed a modular production facility for fast and easy scalability. 
Logistics and communication issues could arise, especially in case of a high number of backers. We have already established agreements with a company with previous experience in Kickstarter campaigns, in order to support our efforts throughout this adventure. We will do our best to stay on track and to reward our backers and fulfill their expectations. This would be the first step of a structured project, the first product out of a list we are planning for the near future, and we don’t want to fail this first milestone.
story_txt:
THE CAMPAIGN IS OVER, BUT YOU CAN BUY the new BLIPS on the Indiegogo Marketplace HERE!
---
 
A unique set of mini-objectives for smartphones and tablets that allows you to explore the micro-world.

White flowers / Forficula auricularia / skin with hair
4 different lenses for different purposes: Macro Plus, Macro, Micro and Ultra lenses!

Bee taken with Blips Macro Plus / Ultra LabKit / Full Kit Metal / Flea taken with Ultra

Fingerprint / Bee/ Eye taken using Macro Plus lens on smartphone


Passion fruit flower shot with Blips MACRO lens

Clover shot with Blips MICRO lens
   
Stem of Pumpkin shot with Blips ULTRA

A gateway to the microscopic world for everyone: BLIPS can be easily used for technical investigations or just for fun!
 


EXTREMELY THIN & LIGHT: the world's thinnest set of microscope lenses for smartphones and tablets 

VERY AFFORDABLE: for all budgets 

ULTRA PORTABLE: can easily fit in your pocket or wallet  
BLIPS is so slim that you can connect it to your device and keep it in your pocket without having to worry about losing it.

HIGH RESOLUTION: Distinguish details <4 microns

lice shot with BLIPS Micro

BETA TESTER'S COMMENT: 
“Having an easy to use microscope in the pocket of your jacket opens a world of possibilities to observe the deeper details of Nature inners working in everyday life. I have been carrying Blips with me for some times now and I ended up pulling it out in many occasions for a quick glance (and picture) at otherwise hidden and fascinating phenomena. With its ease of use, portability and performance such a small object expands so much our vision that it is even difficult to forecast in how many ingenious and artistic ways it can be used.” 
Dr. M. Stefancich, Institute of Materials for Electronics and Magnetism, Italian National Research Council

human eye shot with BLIPS Macro

Honey bee shot with BLIPS Macro
REPOSITIONABLE AND REUSABLE: It sticks again and again! 
No unwieldy spring clips pressing on your touch screen

HIGHLY ADJUSTABLE: to fit any devices  
You can cut the film using scissors, shaping BLIPS as you prefer. The two sticky bands are meant to enhance adherence onto non-polished surfaces; the lens will always stick on the glass when the surface is clean.

EASY TO CLEAN: dust free, non-sticky top surfaces 

 
(Do not touch the adhesive bands often. Grease and dust affect their adhesive strength.) 
SUPER COMPATIBLE: it works on all models of smartphones and tablets

From neuroscience labs to your pocket! 
BLIPS has been developed within the neuroscience labs of the Istituto Italiano di Tecnologia (IIT) exploiting the materials and the methods used for the manufacturing of micro devices for the investigation of neuronal networks. Although it was born in a research lab, it has been designed for mass production from the very beginning. 

REVIEW FROM BETA TESTERS AROUND THE WORLD:
"The blips lenses are awesome! They are so easy to use, you just stick the micro or macro lens on your phone's camera (they literally are stickers) and you are ready to blip away. They are small and lightweight which allows you to have them always available, hence you never have to say again: "Oh I wish I had my camera with me". I have them in the back of my phone I love taking pictures with an artistic flavor to them as a hobby. I especially like taking pictures of insects, flowers and skin. Blips allows you to take pictures with great zoom (micro mode) which otherwise would require a dslr with a special lens (if not a microscope). With blips, anyone can become an artist! It's so easy to take beautiful, artistic pictures!"
Vicky P. Phd Student, UC San Diego - USA 

It allows you to take high definition macro pictures with optical magnification of about 10 times. It is extremely thin, about 1/50 inch (0.5mm), and very user friendly. It represents the first step from “standard” photography towards portable microscopy. Its working distance, i.e. the distance between the lens and the focal plane, is of about 1/2 inch (12mm). 

lemon flower / ladybug / passion fruit flower shot with Blips MACRO lens
Hence, it can be used like a high power magnification lens for precision works or for several other applications where an enhanced electronic eye is desired, from technical uses to sheer fun. For example, it can be used for quality control of soldering works, on cloth, seams, paints or other manufactured items. Needle and thread insertion, self-examination of moles, skin, or nails, children’s hair inspections for head lice/nits, insects or spiders observation, checking of parasites on leaves, etc.  

drop on a leaf / daisy / beetle on a flower / human eye

Japanese statue shot with Blips MACRO lens

Using BLIPS MICRO you are able to turn your smartphone into a real microscope in seconds! 

Honey bee antenna shot with BLIPS Micro
Blips Micro is able to detect details of about 1/7000 inch (≈1/300 mm), distinguishing single cells or other inhabitants of the micro-world. BLIPS Micro is less than 1/20 inch (≈1.2mm) high, and turns your phone into an actual digital microscope. You need to keep a distance of ¼ inch (6mm) between the lens and the sample under observation to discover tiny details at a high definition. With the use of the digital zoom it’s possible to achieve magnification of over 100x*. 

cerebellum / trachea / liver shot with BLIPS Micro
*Note: the magnification factor depends on the model of smartphone or tablet used. To measure the magnification factor we suggest to take a picture of two tick marks on a ruler and measure the captured image on the screen. Other products claimed magnification factors often prove lower than claimed when tested by using this method.

Sand shot with Blips Micro lens
In addition to the BLIPS Micro and Macro lenses, a new lens with the highest level of magnification, twice as powerful as the Micro Lens, has been developed. 

A flea and an ant head photographed with Blips ULTRA lens
Due to the high level of magnification, the ULTRA Lens should be used with Lab Kit pledges, which assure the needed level of stability for shooting photos and videos, thanks to the included Smartphone Stage included in every Lab Kit.

 

A package made of two lenses: 1 BLIPS MACRO & 1 BLIPS MICRO plus 2 small sponges which facilitate to stabilize the focus. 

Note: each smartphone model is different; slightly press the sponge to find the correct distance for your device.

BLIPS LAB KIT can be used for scientific studies or even just for fun! A useful tool for technical discoveries or educational purposes, provided at an affordable price.  

A smartphone stage and a light source are included!

To use Micro to explore the realm of microscopy we also offer a selection of pre-prepared microscope slides plus an easy to assemble mechanical accessory with a sufficient light source for optimum observation of flat and thin samples. In our standard pack you will find glass slides of insect parts, parasites and human tissues.
The pack contains: 
• 2 BLIPS lenses: Micro & Macro
• 1 light source
• 2 sponges
• 1 smartphone stage
• 6 prepared slides
Using the smartphone stage (included in all LAB KIT perks!) you'll improve the performance of your BLIPS lenses.



The pack contains: 
•3 BLIPS lenses: Micro, Macro and ULTRA
• 1 light source
• 2 sponges
• 1 smartphone stage
• 6 prepared slides

Human kidney and Human blood shot with Blips ULTRA Lens

Whether it is for precise manufacturing, or you just need to handle tweezers or other tools, you often need your hands free. Using our smart stand desk holder, you can position your smartphone and use it like a high magnification optical lens.

• needle and thread • jewelry• building tiny models • precise reparations


Blips is marketed as a tool for various industry professionals. The macro lens is perfect for detailed work such as model-making, intricate repairs, restoration works and self inspections for head lice, moles and skin dermatitis.

Jewellery-making

Restoration works

story:
Hello!  My name is Kevin Frank and I’m a photographer from Guatemala. I’m running this campaign because I recently won an artistic residency inMarseille, France and I need your help. The residency will be a one month investigation and production lapse. I believe art is an universal language, that’s why I believe the cultural exchange is crucial in the career of every artist and I’m truly excited about the opportunity to learn and produce in such cultural landscape as it is Marseille. But unfortunely, the residency does not cover plane tickets and alimentation, so I’m asking for your support.  


Who am I?

I was born and raised in Guatemala City, which is as many others, chaotic and sublime at the same time. I look for the relationship between the apparent reality and the oniric, inquiring in the multiplicity of thoughts that constitute the city. My photography works as a visual journal, being the paradoxical nature of the human being what I’m most attracted to. My work has been exhibit in the past edition of Guatephoto, and international photography festival in Guatemala City, and the collective exposition 12 Exposición Colectiva in Gallery Sol Del Río. I graduated last year from La Fototeca, a contemporary photography school in Guatemala City and I have also received workshops with the italian photographer Nicol Vizioli and mexican photographer Yvonne Venegas. Last year I worked as an assistent of Byron Mármol, guatemalan photographer and co-founder of Proyectos Ultravioleta.  

Being accepted to Dos Mares, theinternational residency in France, is an amazing opportunity, it will give the chance to have another kind of aesthetic experience, of human experience, of site experience, since I will be in a city I don’t know. I believe my work is based in humanity and the love-hate relationships they held; would I find this in other places?


What do I need?

On April 15th , I’m heading to Marseille France to be a part of Dos Mares artistic residency. The residency includes accommodation at Marseille, a public transportation card, an equipped workshop and studio, photographic equipment and the guidance of professionals, but is up to the artists to get the tickets, food and insurance. In order to cover these expenses, I need at least $3,000. Which will be distributed this way:


*If the goal is not reach, the money will go to the most important thing: the plane tickets.

 


WHAT COULD YOU GET?

In exchange for your help you could get exclusive pieces and photographs, since I also explore with acrylic painting and ink drawings that are unedited till date. All the  rewards include a shoutout in La Fototeca's fanpage. La Fototeca is a contemporary photography school based in Guatemala in which I graduated last year from the Photography and Project Management diploma. 


$5

Get a shoutout of your company+proyect+art at my personal profile and at La Fototeca’s fanpage which has 109,222 followers.

$15

Get one of my original signed ink drawings and a shoutout of your company+proyect+art at my personal profile and at La Fototeca’s fanpage which has 109,222 followers.

$50

Get one of my acrylic paintings and a shoutout of your company+proyect+art at my personal profile and at La Fototeca’s fanpage which has 109,222 followers.

$150

You could get a signed original polaroid of my private collection. Also a shoutout of your company+proyect+art at my personal profile and at La Fototeca’s fanpage which has 109,222 followers.

$500

Get an original photography (15x10”), valued by the Gallery Sol del Río. The piece was part of my last exhibition at the gallery.  Also a shoutout of your company+proyect+art at my personal profile and at La Fototeca’s fanpage which has 109,222 followers.


*****

We know you might not be able to help me monetary, but we will truly appreciate if you could share this project in your social media. It’s really easy if you use the sharing tool. THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

story:
Hi, thanks for visiting my IndieGoGo and for watching my video! Man do I love being on camera! HARRR!

     My name is Nicole Mark and I am a Portland, Oregon native. I've been making photos since I was ten years old, when I acquired a little 110 camera. I started out taking grainy photographs of my friends at summer camp, and I haven't stopped taking photos since.   

     After taking a Doula workshop last spring I realized that I wanted to photograph births and expecting mamas. This part of a woman's life is so special and beautiful. It is an honor to be present for a birth, and to help preserve these precious memories. There is so much fear around birth in our culture, I am excited to be part of the movement to dispel those fears. If there is any way I can show women around the world how empowering birth can be, I'm there.

What I Need and What You'll Recieve

     Now that I have started a business I need a decent digital camera and lights. I need a camera that can shoot in low light conditions, for example, at a home birth. I also need studio lights for mama belly and family portraits.

     Help me earn the equipment I need by pledging to this IndieGoGo! You will be rewarded with something no matter how much you pledge. Do you need a photo print for yourself or to give as a gift? Do you want a photo shoot? Please see my list of rewards for pledges starting at ten dollars. Some examples of printable photos are at the bottom of this page. You can visit my WEBSITE or my Flickr Page to see more examples of my work and choose a photo for printing, should you decide to make a pledge. (Nudes and Mamabelly photos are not an option)

You do not have to choose a photo immediately, you can pledge now and choose later. Please include your contact information and address when you make a pledge!

The Impact

     If I can raise enough funds to get a decent digital camera and studio lights I will be able to take my business ten times further. At the moment I am unable to do much with indoor photogrpahy, which is really limiting when you're trying to photograph births! I need a full-frame digital camera that will allow me to take photos in low-light settings. For example, at a birth, or in the forest at dusk. Technology has done a lot for image quality in the last ten years. Newer digital cameras are capable of taking crisp clear photos in very low-light conditions. They can also photograph many images per second, so you can capture the most amazing moments. The bare minimum in studio lighting will allow me to photograph people in so many different ways. Lighting affects facial features, mood, depth of field and many other aspects of a photograph. Basically lighting is everything- and I need to be able to control it! Instead of waiting for the sun or the clouds to do what I want. Every little bit helps me earn this equiptment!

     If I go over the minimium amount needed to get a good camera and lights I will be able to buy a new/used computer! My current computer is 7-years old and will likely die soon. Not to mention I need something with adeqate processing power when working with large photo files.

                     Thanks again for visiting my IndieGoGo!

                                           Love Nicole

Other Ways You Can Help

     If you cannot make a pledge you can still spread the word! Do you know anyone who needs a photoshoot or some art for thier walls? All of the listed pledge amounts come with a reward of some form of art. Please share this with your communitiy and/or your network! Thank you!

     Thank you Lyle Walker for all your help with video production and for letting me borrow your camera! Thank you Talia Filipek for turning me onto Lynsey Stone, her work is hugely influential and important. Thank you Pam for all your technical knowledge and help. Thank you to my family, my community and Paul Wolda for all your support!

 

All of the above photos are color slide film aside from the top photo of the hotsprings.
story_txt:
Hi, thanks for visiting my IndieGoGo and for watching my video! Man do I love being on camera! HARRR!
     My name is Nicole Mark and I am a Portland, Oregon native. I've been making photos since I was ten years old, when I acquired a little 110 camera. I started out taking grainy photographs of my friends at summer camp, and I haven't stopped taking photos since.   
     After taking a  Doula workshop last spring I realized that I wanted to photograph births and expecting mamas. This part of a woman's life is so special and beautiful. It is an honor to be present for a birth, and to help preserve these precious memories. There is so much fear around birth in our culture, I am excited to be part of the movement to dispel those fears. If there is any way I can show women around the world how empowering birth can be, I'm there.

What I Need and What You'll Recieve
     Now that I have started a business I need a decent digital camera and lights. I need a camera that can shoot in low light conditions, for example, at a home birth. I also need studio lights for mama belly and family portraits.

They can also photograph many images per second, so you can capture the most amazing moments. The bare minimum in studio lighting will allow me to photograph people in so many different ways.      Thank you Lyle Walker for all your help with video production and for letting me borrow your camera! Thank you Talia Filipek for turning me onto Lynsey Stone, her work is hugely influential and important. Thank you Pam for all your technical knowledge and help. story:
My name is Hana Pesut, I am a Canadian photographer. Switcheroo is a self-funded portrait series that I started 2 years ago where accomplices are photographed twice: once in their own outfits and again wearing each others outfits against the same background.
 
I have photographed over 200 switcheroos all over the world (Spain, Japan, France, Austria, Mexico, Canada & US) and am very excited to publish a 64-page book of some of the favorites.
 
The money raised through this campaign would help to cover costs of the design, layout and printing of the book as well as film and developing- the whole project has been shot with medium format film. 
 
My goal is to have the book printed in January 2013 so posters, prints and books would be shipped in February 2013.
 
*International orders are estimated at 1 to 2 months shipping time.
 
Thank you for all of your support and generosity!
 
See new switcheroos posted on my blog at sincerelyhana.tumblr.com
 
 
Expenses

Book design, layout & printing: $10,600
 
Film & developing $2,400
 
Total: $13,000 (does not include cost of perks & personal expenses) 
 
 
Selected Online Press 
 
The Huffington Post
 
The Globe and Mail
 
Vice
 
Glamour
 
Booooooom
 
Esquire (Russia)
 
il Post (Italy)
 
Marie Claire (Italy)
 
Daily Life (Australia)
 
 
website: sincerelyhana.com

story:
Hi!

I’m Martha Jurksaitis (aka Cherry Kino!), an English analogue photographer and filmmaker, and in April and August 2013 I went to Finland on an artist residency at a place called Arteles, in the Finnish forest. It used to be a school, and my bedroom was an old classroom! While I was there, I became completely obsessed with exploring the place and the surprisingly raw and passionate feelings it gave rise to inside me, and I did this through taking hundreds of polaroids and writing poetry. After a year of fine-tuning and preparation, and some amazing help from my friend and Production Assistant Paisley Boyd, my project is now ready to take the form of a luscious, 160 page full colour artist's book, from me, to you!

'Woodshed'

I have taken over 130 polaroid images and written 14 poems in this wondrous place, and I really want to share them with you! Finland at the turn of spring is a total wonderland - the thick ice falling suddenly from the roof with a crash, the heavy, deep snow that is there one day and has virtually disappeared the next, as spring makes its intense, rapid entrance and flowers and butterflies suddenly appear. 

'Moth'

The lake was still frozen solid in April (there were a few scary moments when I heard some cracks while I was standing on it taking photographs!), and I saw fresh elk tracks in the snow, but in August it became a luscious lagoon for boat-rowing and swimming amongst the reeds. 

'Lady in the Lake'

'Vessel'

I used a variety of instant film, including expired large format (4x5) Polaroid film that I shot using a wooden pinhole camera. Developing these large images involved holding the precious image against my skin to warm it for 90 seconds or more, in the freezing Finnish weather, before peeling it open to reveal what the forest wanted to reveal, in an array of colours from pink to red, to blue and yellow. I also used a lot of 'Impossible Project' instant film stock, both black and white and colour, and spent many many hours knee deep in snow in wild forests.

'Rose Forest'

I am in some of the photographs myself, sometimes naked (I used a camera with a timer for these). It felt very instinctive to do that while I was there, even though I nearly froze! My poems are also extremely personal and exposed - in fact, some are so revealing that I thought twice about including them, but if you can’t be courageous with your art, all is lost :) 

'Flesh and Bone'

'Thighs and Sahti'

As well as images of people and place, nature and patterns, there are also some playful experiments, such as berries I picked which I physically mashed onto a milky polaroid, and even a rayogram - I laid translucent freshly picked red berries on the film and flashed it with a hand torch to expose it. The poetry is in both English and Finnish translation - brilliantly translated by Kirsi Kujala - so you can marvel at the mesmerising Finnish language. I warmly invite you to share this experience with me! 

But to make this book a reality, I need your help! All the creative work has been done, and now I need to pay for the printing of the book itself. The money raised will be used 100% for printing and publishing the book to the highest standard possible. Only a few hundred copies will ever be made so the book you receive will be numbered, and a limited edition.

Thank you SO much for supporting my project! I really can't wait to share this book with you!

With lots of love and gratitude, 

x Martha (Cherry Kino)  

Check out a few more images below...

'Blue Mist'

'Antelope' 

'Night Walk'

'Gretel' 

'Light Travel'

'Tree Burst' 

'Riding Pink, Little Hood Part 1'

'Riding Pink, Little Hood Part 2'

story:
“Every accomplishment starts with a decision to try”

I started this campaign weeks ago, because it was pressed on my heart to do so and give it a try. I admit, it was not an easy decision for me to make. In fact, I broke down in tears after it was done. However, I know in my heart that this is something that God wants me to do for one reason or another, so I do so obediently.

The power of an image is unexplainable. It can change the way you feel in a moment, the way you see the world, they way you see yourself, as well as the way others see you. I want to share with the world the beauty that I see in it everyday.

The first thing thought that came to me when I recognized that this was what I was to do with my life, was “how can I give back?”  You see, since I have been an adult, I have always struggled financially. I have always managed to make it through because of my faith in God and at times the amazing generosity of other people. The desire to “pay my blessings forward” has been ever present within me. So besides the benefit of being able to financially improve my family’s situation, I needed to seek out how I could also improve others lives.

I thought of the dreams, I had when I was young. I wanted to be an actress. Straight out of high school, I would go to auditions and the first thing I was told was “You need an 8X10 headshot”. I didn’t have headshots or the money for headshots. I tried working around it though. I would have people taken pictures of me and print them out on 8X10 paper. It was not the quality that was expected, but it was enough to get me through the door. I remember thinking, “It honestly cannot be THAT important…can it?” I soon found out it was. A talent agency that was interested in me refused to sign me until I had professional headshots taken. It was not something I could do, so I eventually gave up. I realized later that it was not the avenue I wanted to pursue with my life. However, the experience left a mark.

So that’s when the ideas hit me on how I could give back through this dream. I want to donate a portion of my talent and time to charity work. I want to be able to have a few days set aside where I can shoot professional headshots for amazingly talented young people who honestly cannot afford to have them done otherwise. I want to help give them what they need to pursue their dreams. 

So here I am, with this campaign that I was led to start. I can give you a long story, but quite simply, my family cannot afford to make any of this happen. The reality is, I can barely afford to feed my children or pay rent. I hope that I can use the equipment I am fundraising for to make a better future for my family. I hope that I can generate enough added income to help us breathe a bit easier each month. I hope I can use these tools to bring joy and promise to the lives of others and help answer a few prayers along the way.

This is the holiday season. I know we are all stressed and money is tight. I completely understand if you cannot offer any support to this campaign at this time. Prayers would be greatly appreciated. However, if you can afford to offer even the tiniest of bits, I would be forever grateful.

Blessings and love to each and every one of you.

story:
Travel not to see new places, but to see with new eyes

I’m traveling to Europe to study photography. I’d like to share the experience with you.

How is this different from every other photography project on the planet?

Rewards for everyone

Most projects just reward individuals, but I like all of you. I want to reward all of you, even if all you can do is donate $1 or even just share a link. Here’s how that works.

For the first $100 donated, I’ll release a full-resolution photo to be used for free

Starting at the first $300 donated, I’ll release a free full-res photo for the world

This lets me offer reward for any contribution, even if it’s just sharing the link. Because again, I like you.

Recap: Free images come at $100, $300, $600, $900, $1200, $1500… and they’re for *everyone.*

Voting’s fun!

Which photo will be free? You choose!

I’ll put up a group of photos and you’ll vote for your favorite. That one will be submitted to InterfaceLift. Interface Lift distributes images in all sorts of resolutions - Standard desktop, iPhone, iPad, dual-screen displays, and more.

Dots on the map

London • Brussels • Paris • Italy

About me • обо мне • sobre mí • à propos de moi • su di me

Я жил в России четыре года.

Estudié español en la escuela por 2 años. Muy mal hablo, sólo sé un poquito.

Je veux créme glacee – toujours.

La vita non è aspettare che passi la tempesta, è fare sonnellini e mangiare gelato.

*The full-resolution photo will be distributed via InterfaceLift.com, which will 

 

Just for fun, let's compare the "Rewards for everyone" deal to a photo I licensed last year to an advertising agency for $500. That license expired after one year and was only usable by that agency’s client.

The full-quality images I release will be available forever to everyone on the planet.

Crazy math: $1 from one person seems small, but it’s a meaningful contribution. $300 from 1-300 people will earn a photo for everybody on the internet (2.24 BILLION people). 

2.24 billion times @ 3/5 the normal price = Good deal? You bet your buns! That’s 3.73 billion times better than licensing the photo directly. ;)

Hyperbole? Perhaps, but you get the point.

Maths are fun.

story:
Featured On 


CLICKED, EDITED, SHARED! Shouldn’t the journey of your photos be as simple as that? But it never is. That masterpiece should have been flashing on some of the top social media sites but it is lying in some folder on your laptop. Why? Only because there are endless platforms and sharing your photos on them frustrates you like nothing else. Now is the time to reimagine your work.


What is Expojure?

Expojure is a Photo Management Solution for Social Media. It helps you save hundreds of precious hours which you waste on uploading same photos on multiple platforms.


How Expojure will benefit you?

  • Consistent Presence on Social Media - From Facebook to Twitter to 500px to Tumblr, there are endless platforms to connect and share. Expojure makes sure that you will get a consistent presence on all of them. Just upload your photos on Expojure and choose when and where to publish the photos. Expojure will take care of the rest.

  • Grow Your Audience - There are many platforms such as Facebook, Flickr, 500px, SmugMug, Google+, Twitter, Tumblr, Wordpress, and even Instagram. Every such platform has its own benefits. With Expojure you can try all these platforms to bring growth in your audience and business.


  • Spend More Time Doing What You Love - Save hundreds of precious hours to do what you are good at, Photography. Don’t upload the same photos repeatedly across different social media sites. Our powerful servers will publish your photos anywhere, anytime in seconds, literally.


  • Made for Your Photos - We have designed the interface with only two things in mind - ‘Your Photos’ and ‘Sharing Them with Ease’. With the clean and distraction free interface of Expojure, you can take a deep breath and feel proud about your work.


  • Inspire and Influence Others - If not just attracting clients, your special photos have the power to melt away the whole day’s stress and rejuvenate others. They can make a huge difference to one’s thoughts, behavior, perspective and emotions or can even inspire them to capture and share some of their own mesmerizing photos. All you have to do is share your photos with the world.

I am not a photographer by profession but the only reason why I am building Expojure is because whenever I see those beautiful photos taken by the photographers it inspires me to do something creative - Hitesh Soni, Founder

Where are We Now?

We have already worked on it full-time for the last 9 months and there are over a thousand photographers using Expojure. As of now, we support sites like Facebook, Flickr, 500px, SmugMug and Google+. You try it by creating a new account on - http://expojure.com.

We have also finished the prototype of the new Expojure which we have uploaded on InVision.


Testimonials and Feedback

Our existing users shared lots of valuable suggestions with us which indeed helped us design the new Expojure with only one thing in mind - ‘Making Photo Sharing Simpler’.

Seems like a solid idea, kind of like Buffer App for pictures. - Nick Brosnahan

I was hoping for a scheduler so that when I am away in the field with no access to internet I can still post the images on a certain day and time. - Kevin McNeal

I will pay whatever to use your service and there are thousands of wedding photographers just like me that will do the same I assure you - Josh Green

I don't like to have all my photos uploaded at the same time to all my social networks. I always delay the uploading on a couple of days, and sometimes I only upload on FB only. So every time post a shot it's quite specific. - Daniel Cheong

Many photographers will publish content at different times on social media to take advantage of their demographic. E.g. For Facebook, the majority of my followers are from Asia Pacific, whereas for Google+ it’s North America. - Peter Stewart

I must say I like the looks of Expojure. Keep up the good work! - Pieter Pretorious


Roadmap

Whole process of the development may take upto 6 months. But we have divided the workflow 4 segments. Completion of every segment varies as per the complexity. 


Stretch Goals



Risks and Challenges

  • Time - Our biggest challenge is to ship the new Expojure as soon as possible. So that, you can spend more time on taking photos rather than uploading them. With your financial contribution, it will help us hire more people who can help us meet the deadline.

  • Infrastructure - This kind of product needs a very scalable and reliable infrastructure which can, not only communicate with multiple social networks but also gracefully upload tons of photos without any glitches, so that you can publish photos anywhere, anytime, automatically.

  • Mobile Apps - Our existing team member’s expertise include web development but when it comes to mobile development, we are novices. In order to develop mobile apps we need to hire mobile developer, so that Expojure is accessible to you anywhere and anytime.

Your contribution will help us tackle these issues and will help us deliver the product as soon as possible. So that you can spend more time taking photos rather than uploading them.


The People Behind Expojure

Nihar Sawant, Founder - Nihar is responsible for the look and feel of the site, to make sure that you get the best user experience. He has previously worked in startups like 3DTin and Lagoa as a developer before starting Expojure.

Hitesh Soni, Founder - Hitesh makes sure that your photos are delivered where they belong, so that you can rely on Expojure to take care of your photo publishing. He has 3 years of experience in developing enterprise softwares.

Ashish Gaikwad, Awesome Intern - Energetic Ashish makes sure that all of his energy is reflected in the product by making it more reliable than ever.


Other Ways to Contribute

If you have any ideas which you would want to share with us to make Expojure better, Great. Simply go to our Feedback Page or drop an email to us on support@expojure.com. We would love to hear from you.
story_txt:
Featured On CLICKED, EDITED, SHARED! Shouldn’t the journey of your photos be as simple as that? But it never is. That masterpiece should have been flashing on some of the top social media sites but it is lying in some folder on your laptop. Why? Only because there are endless platforms and sharing your photos on them frustrates you like nothing else. Now is the time to reimagine your work.What is Expojure?Expojure is a Photo Management Solution for Social Media. It helps you save hundreds of precious hours which you waste on uploading same photos on multiple platforms.How Expojure will benefit you?

Consistent Presence on Social Media - From Facebook to Twitter to 500px to Tumblr, there are endless platforms to connect and share. Expojure makes sure that you will get a consistent presence on all of them. Just upload your photos on Expojure and choose when and where to publish the photos. Expojure will take care of the rest.



Grow Your Audience - There are many platforms such as Facebook, Flickr, 500px, SmugMug, Google+, Twitter, Tumblr, Wordpress, and even Instagram. Every such platform has its own benefits. With Expojure you can try all these platforms to bring growth in your audience and business.




Spend More Time Doing What You Love - Save hundreds of precious hours to do what you are good at, Photography. Don’t upload the same photos repeatedly across different social media sites. Our powerful servers will publish your photos anywhere, anytime in seconds, literally.




Made for Your Photos - We have designed the interface with only two things in mind - ‘Your Photos’ and ‘Sharing Them with Ease’. With the clean and distraction free interface of Expojure, you can take a deep breath and feel proud about your work.




Inspire and Influence Others - If not just attracting clients, your special photos have the power to melt away the whole day’s stress and rejuvenate others. They can make a huge difference to one’s thoughts, behavior, perspective and emotions or can even inspire them to capture and share some of their own mesmerizing photos. All you have to do is share your photos with the world.
I am not a photographer by profession but the only reason why I am building Expojure is because whenever I see those beautiful photos taken by the photographers it inspires me to do something creative - Hitesh Soni, FounderWhere are We Now?We have already worked on it full-time for the last 9 months and there are over a thousand photographers using Expojure. As of now, we support sites like Facebook, Flickr, 500px, SmugMug and Google+. You try it by creating a new account on - http://expojure.com.We have also finished the prototype of the new Expojure which we have uploaded on InVision.Testimonials and FeedbackOur existing users shared lots of valuable suggestions with us which indeed helped us design the new Expojure with only one thing in mind - ‘Making Photo Sharing Simpler’.Seems like a solid idea, kind of like Buffer App for pictures. - Nick Brosnahan
I was hoping for a scheduler so that when I am away in the field with no access to internet I can still post the images on a certain day and time. - Kevin McNeal

I will pay whatever to use your service and there are thousands of wedding photographers just like me that will do the same I assure you - Josh Green

I don't like to have all my photos uploaded at the same time to all my social networks. I always delay the uploading on a couple of days, and sometimes I only upload on FB only. So every time post a shot it's quite specific. - Daniel Cheong

Many photographers will publish content at different times on social media to take advantage of their demographic. E.g. For Facebook, the majority of my followers are from Asia Pacific, whereas for Google+ it’s North America. - Peter Stewart

I must say I like the looks of Expojure. Keep up the good work! - Pieter Pretorious
RoadmapWhole process of the development may take upto 6 months. But we have divided the workflow 4 segments. Completion of every segment varies as per the complexity. 


Stretch Goals



Risks and Challenges
Time - Our biggest challenge is to ship the new Expojure as soon as possible. So that, you can spend more time on taking photos rather than uploading them. With your financial contribution, it will help us hire more people who can help us meet the deadline.
Infrastructure - This kind of product needs a very scalable and reliable infrastructure which can, not only communicate with multiple social networks but also gracefully upload tons of photos without any glitches, so that you can publish photos anywhere, anytime, automatically.
Mobile Apps - Our existing team member’s expertise include web development but when it comes to mobile development, we are novices. In order to develop mobile apps we need to hire mobile developer, so that Expojure is accessible to you anywhere and anytime.
Your contribution will help us tackle these issues and will help us deliver the product as soon as possible. So that you can spend more time taking photos rather than uploading them.


The People Behind Expojure
Nihar Sawant, Founder - Nihar is responsible for the look and feel of the site, to make sure that you get the best user experience. He has previously worked in startups like 3DTin and Lagoa as a developer before starting Expojure.
Hitesh Soni, Founder - Hitesh makes sure that your photos are delivered where they belong, so that you can rely on Expojure to take care of your photo publishing. He has 3 years of experience in developing enterprise softwares.
Ashish Gaikwad, Awesome Intern - Energetic Ashish makes sure that all of his energy is reflected in the product by making it more reliable than ever.

Other Ways to ContributeIf you have any ideas which you would want to share with us to make Expojure better, Great. Simply go to our Feedback Page or drop an email to us on support@expojure.com. We would love to hear from you.

story:
My name is Amanda, I'm 19 years old and I'm a student. I was born and raised in Brazil until November of 2015 when I moved to the USA. I live in California with an L2 visa, which does not allow me to work, so I depend on my parents for everything. I found out I was moving about 1 year ago and I was preparing a “goodbye Brazil” photo shoot but things didn't go quite well and I ended up leaving my country without giving anything to my followers.

Since I arrived I have been planning another photo shoot because I LOVE making them, when I see my followers liking and sharing my work I feel extremely special and loved.

I started looking for studios and photographers around my area, the best deal I found would cost me $350 ($100 for the studio rent, $200 for the photographer and $50 for extra taxes). Indiegogo only allows me to ask for $500 or higher, so I might make some kind of raffle with the money left. Stay tuned on my Facebook page (Cyberlady) for further information!

If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with your friends and family and support an independent model.


Those pictures are from my previous photo shoot. If you wanna see more cool pictures, contribute to the campaign and like my page Cyberlady :D

story:
Earlier this year I was fortunate enough to receive the Odyssey Travel Grant through SAIC. While incredible, the ideas that started swirling in my head got more and more ambitious.  I decided to follow in the tradition of some of the pinnacles of American photography and explore the Southwestern United States.  From Ansel Adams to the FSA (click links to learn more) the varied and often barren landscape of the southwest have been an inspiration for photographers for decades. 

To further those traditions my work has been and will continue to be shot on both black & white and color film. I currently have one 35mm Minolta SLR, one 35mm Fujifilm point-and-shoot, and a 6x9 medium format Fujifilm GW690ii.  The medium format camera will likely be my primary focus on the trip, however it only takes 8 shots per roll of film so it is going to get pricey.

The end goal of this is to make and (hopefully) publish a book, or several books, depicting the southwest. I create books as a way to slow down the reading of my images. Most of my work is shot in a way that brings up more questions than answers: Why does someone have windows on their garage when they drive a beaten-up Honda from the 90s like in my series The Midwestern Suburbs? What is obscured in the bleached-out segments of film in my Homesick series? The answers the viewer comes up with can fill in the blanks and create their own narratives. 

While the grant money was a boon, it all went to getting my car up to the point that it will survive the trip. I've been saving up, but art supplies and lodging are expensive.  I am fully prepared (and excited) to sleep in my car and hammock for most of the trip in order to purchase enough film to make this book. However, I'd love to sleep in a bed every now and then. My route takes me through a number of cities, big and small, and a number of national and state parks. But this isn't me begging you for money or anything, I just know the more I have the cooler things I'll be able to see- which also means the cooler print you'll get in return! I am not expecting 500 but that is the minimum goal amount- the nice thing about this site is that I'll still get it if it's below the goal unlike Kickstarter.

 

My Work:

Books:

  • Fences
  • Anywhere But Home 
  • Nostalgia Zine
  • The Midwest (In Progress)
  • Nostalgia/Forgetting
  • Hourly Motels (In Progress)

Other:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/sethwphoto/

Site: https://www.sethw.photography/

Preview my current route! 

If you're unable to help please share this with a friend! If you have any questions email me! swheel2@saic.edu

story:
Here's the story...

My name is Jason Speer and I am a professional photographer currently based in Greensboro, North Carolina.  I earned my Bachelor's and Master's degrees in Photography from the Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD).  Over the last eight years, my wife Erin and I have moved around the United States living in California, Wyoming, Florida, Pennsylvania, New York and North Carolina.  Erin and I are both artists, and our creative work has been the impetus for each of these moves.   

For many years, I've been photographing and editing content for companies and individuals.  As I approach my 35th birthday in March, I am finding myself drawn back to shooting work that represents my own voice.  It is a lifetime dream of mine to shoot the Aurora Borealis: the Northern Lights.  With a few weeks of free time on my hands, my wife has encouraged me to grasp the opportunity and check this item off of my bucket list.  In order to do it right, I will need to be in Iceland for two weeks car camping and photographing 24/7.  This is a solo trip, my Jack Kerouac moment.

My previous trip to Iceland was incredible.  It opened my eyes to the vast beauty, wild spaces and diversity of the Icelandic landscape.   Between the timing of that visit, which was in the height of summer (so no Aurora Borealis) and my responsibilities, I left Iceland feeling ready to return.  That 2016  visit was an incredible opportunity, but I still feel that the island has more to say to me.

While we are self-funding most of this trip, I am seeking financial support to help cover the cost of my transportation/mobile housing and a special tour of ice caves.  My rental van is outfitted for car camping with a sleeping space that we hope will accommodate my 6'5" frame.  Your financial support will also help to book a safe tour of the Ice Caves, and buy me the occasional shower.  No one wants to sit next to that on the plane.

I plan on driving the entire island, weather permitting.  The drive should take ten days to do it right, and I'm leaving myself a cushion of two extra days in case I fall in love with a particular location and want to stick around for a while.  I depart the United States on October 22 and arrive in Iceland on October 23. 

I will posting to my Instagram account daily while in Iceland, so you can follow along with my trip. @jasonspeerphoto. Please be sure to pop up and say hi.

What I Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown:

  • What I need: $800 to help offset the cost of my rental van.  
  • Donations up to $49 will receive my eternal gratitude and a thank you shout-out on social media.
  • Donations greater than $50 will receive an 8x10 photographic print of my choosing from the trip - hopefully of the Aurora Borealis I'm chasing.
  • Donations of $100 and up will receive a 16x20 photographic print of my choosing from the trip - hopefully of the Aurora Borealis I'm chasing.
  • Fund the entire amount - $800 - and I will frame and sign that 16x20 print for you.
  • *All Prints will be mailed by the end of November, making them a great idea for Christmas Presents!*

Your Impact

Your support will help me create a dynamic series of images that I plan to pitch to various photography magazines and journals.  

The Challenge

The end goal of this trip is to come away with twenty photos that I can pitch to outdoor photography magazines in hopes of receiving a featured spread or offers for future work.  I've spent so many years helping others get published, now it's time to bet on myself!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone has the means to help monetarily, so here are a few other ways you can help!

  • Spread the news on your Social Media accounts using the Indiegogo sharing tools.
  • Follow me on Instagram: @jasonspeerphoto while I'm on the trip!
  • Pray for great weather, good driving conditions and Aurora Borealis sightings!

Thanks for reading.  Erin and I appreciate your help and support!

story:
What is Seenthesis: Visual Literacy through Singapore Photography?

Seenthesis: Visual Literacy through Singapore Photography is an attempt to put together a resource book that provides educators and general public on the fundamental overview on photography and the contemporary approaches illustrated by over 100 works by 32 Singaporean/Singapore-based Artists. Providing context to the works are concise essays on the history and theory of photography as well as a timeline on the social history of photography in Singapore.

Different ideas and approaches to photography outlined in this publication: Documentary, Typologies, Staging and the Art of Mise En Scenes, Found and Archival Materials and Multidisciplinary.

Each sub-chapter is accompanied by a concise writeup on the approach, theory and technique. Different bodies of work by Singapore photographers provide vivid example to each chapter. 

Suggested Classroom Activities 
At the end of each chapter are suggested classroom activities which school educators could carry out to inspire and to encourage photographic creation by students. 

Context & Information 
A timeline table on the photography culture in Singapore between 50s to 90s. 
Suggested reading materials, glossary page and a list of photographic works for more reference. 

Photographic works are kindly contributed by the following artists: Abednego Trianto, Alecia Neo, Ang Song Nian, Benjamin “Ziggy” Lee, Charmaine Poh, Chia Aik Beng, Chow and Lin, Chua Chye Teck, Darren Soh, Geraldine Kang, Hu Qiren, Jing Quek, John Clang, Kamarulzaman Bin Mohamed Sapiee, Kevin WY Lee, Lavender Chang, Liana Yang, Liu Ying, Marvin Tang, Mintio, Nguan, Robert Zhao Renhui, Sarah Choo Jing, Sean Lee, Sebastian Mary Tay, Sim Chi Yin, Tan Peiling, Tristan Cai, Wilfred Lim, Woong Soak Teng, Zakaria Zainal, and Zen Teh Shi Wei.

A Sneak Preview by Do Not Design (Tentative)


What We Need: Every Dollar Counts

Cost of Production

  • Design Fees = SGD 5000
  • Printing Fees = SGD 18000
  • Writer & Editor Fees = SGD 5000
  • Artist Token Fees and Image Rights = SGD 3700
  • Educator Fees for Activities = SGD 2500
  • Misc (Shipping/Materials) = SGD 800

Total Cost of Production = SGD 35000

All funds will be directed solely to the creation of this publication.

Production Timeline

  1. Fundraising & Online Crowdsourcing  — April – July 2019
  2. Printing — Mid June 2018 
  3. Exhibition & School Programmes —27th June to 27th July at DECK Gallery 
    - "Reading Photographs"  is the accompanying exhibition for the Seenthesis publication, featuring an educational display of the methods of photography and the ways to read the photographs.
  4. Book Launch & Public Dialogue — 28 – 30 June at Singapore Art Book Fair, at NTU Centre for Contemporary Art. 
  5. Public Dialogue with Guo Yi Xiu (writer), Ang Song Nian (Artist) and Gwen Lee (DECK Director) at The Single Screen, NTU Centre for Contemporary Art, 2pm - 3pm, 30 June 2019. 

The Importance of Education in Visual Literacy 

The greatest barrier that hinders the entry to photography lies in the lack of material to help understand it. This 230-page is not an exhaustive record of photography in Singapore nor is it the only source for educators to tap on, but it is a first step towards a more accessible education in photography. 

Tokens of Appreciation for your Support

As tokens of appreciation for your support on the publication, you will receive, (depending on the tier you pledge):

  1. The physical copy of the fully printed and design book, Seenthesis: Visual Literacy through Singapore Photography
     
  2. An invitation to the opening reception of "Reading Photographs" exhibition at DECK on the 20th of June 2019. Reading Photographs is an extension of the publication to bring contents to wider audience. 
     
  3. Thank-You Credit, with your name in the Page of Supporters in the Book.
     
  4. A DECK Totebag, to bring everywhere with you.
     
  5. One Photographic print (A3size) via LUCKY DIP-  featured selection from 32 artists who have contributed to the publication. (The artist's work you will receive will be determined via a live lucky dip at the exclusive preview of the book on the 20th of June)

    Thank you AVS Printing Pte Ltd for support of artist prints for this publication fundraising.
    ​Find out more about our supporting partner at https://avs.com.sg/printing/
     
  6. A set of 3 Photographic print (A5size) featuring the works of Aik Beng Chia, Hu Qi Ren, and Chow & Lin. 

 

Thank you for your donations and your support of DECK's initiatives towards a more accessible photography education and practice! 

For any enquiries, doubts, actions of support, feel free to email us at meet@deck.sg!

story:
Introducing simple and tailored solution for photography buyers & creators from all around the world.



Nonstock Photography is a private community of hand-picked photographers created by an alternative advertising agency WTF Factory.



After having worked with many freelance photographers from around the world, we decided to help also others to save their time, money and visual originality. To make this  possible, we have already developed the website's beta version and we have a database hundreds of professional photographers strong. 


Photographers - JOIN US

Now we need you to help us to develop the community! We want to recruit photographers from as many parts of the world as possible. More places mean more possibilities for solving the customer needs. If you are a commercial or artistic photographer, or you know some, we are interested in looking at your portfolio and supplying you with job offers. Becoming a member is free of charge.

Photography buyers - GIVE US FEEDBACK

The service we want to offer is going to help you to create original and compelling websites, presentations, advertisements, articles, ... whatever you need. By claiming our perks you will be our pioneer clients and we will design the service according to your needs and feedback. You will help us to create a start-up with win-win model that will help many others. 

The Money 



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody can contribute with money, but we are sure you know at least one or more good photographers. You can help us by inviting them to our community. Any feedback from you will be very helpful, please share your opinions, ideas or hints with us on hello@nonstock.photography

FAQ

Check out the answers to specific questions that might pop into your head HERE.
If you don't find your answer please write us on info@nonstock.photography

story:
Hello.

My name is Kasey Dungjen. I am a photographer, preserving moments and making pictures that will help families relive their favorite memories indefinitely.

I found photography when I was a freshman in high school, starting with basic skills classes and progressing to more advanced lessons. I have won several local photography awards and one of my images was selected for display in the Gov. John Kasich's office.

Earlier this year, my best friend Caitlyn and I started a small photography business. Our plans were derailed when, yesterday, I found my camera was fried. I cannot afford a new camera right now, but I'm hoping that, with the help of friends and family, I'll be able to get a new camera sooner rather than later.

My birthday is July 27. I'll be 22 years old. It would mean the world to me if my friends and family, instead of buying any gifts or other celebratory items for my birthday, would chip in toward a new camera.

I'm aching for a Nikon D5300. The body and lens is on sale for $950. Not knowing how much I'll need to pay in tax and warranties, I'm asking for $1,500. That should cover the cost of everything (and probably even provide a small cushion).

It's a lot of money, I know. Anything you can donate, even if it's only $1, helps. I am so grateful to my friends and family for their continuous support of my hobby turned business.

What I need & What you get

I need monetary support to purchase a new camera. My heart is set on a Nikon D5300. All of the money I raise will go toward purchasing the camera and a warranty. Any additional funds will directly benefit my photography. If I don't reach my full-funding goal, I will save the money until I am able to add enough of my own to purchase the camera and warranty.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, it's OK. Please share my page with your friends and family, or others who might be interested in donating toward a new camera. Share it on social media, in emails, in any way you can.

Thank you, everyone, very much.

story:
Hi! Deanna here, author/photographer of Crabcakes and Quidditch!

My goal is to attend the Quidditch World Cup in Kissimmee, FL this April as an official IQA photographer. I am a noted photographer in the quidditch community and have photographed quidditch events for 3 years. My photos are frequently featured in Quidditch Quarterly, The Eighth Man, the official IQA website, and various other publications. You can check out my quidditch pictures for yourself right here.

My photographs reflect the athleticism, diversity, and spirit of the entire quidditch experience. Teams from across the country value and use the images. 

"Deanna has an incredible knack for capturing not just the main action of a game, but all its incredible moments - I love using her photos to see all the amazing moments from a tournament! Her photos are technically beautiful and show so much personality." Clare Hutchinson, University of Ottawa

Here’s where you, dear reader, come in. My estimates are totaling the trip around $800 for the flight, hotel room, and transportation to and from the fields.

So here are the donation perks:

  • Any donation gets a shout-out here or on facebook and an IRL hug the next time I see you
  • $10: a drawing from me
  • $20: an athletic or business headshot
  • $30: 5x7 print of your favorite World Cup photo
  • $40: 8x10 team photo print
  • above $50 you can pretty much request any kind of picture and I’ll see what I can do.

Quidditch World Cup VI is my last chance to attend a Quidditch World Cup until 2016. It would mean lot to me, both personally and professionally, to have this opportunity.

I really hope that we can make this happen! And if you can't donate, then please share this link with others.

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT:

“The skateboard itself holds no power. It is a simple lifeless scrap of wood with a piece of metal and wheels strapped to it. The magic happens when a human controls it. Then it becomes a form of entertainment, a piece of sporting equipment, and a membership to a worldwide brotherhood.” – Amigo Skate Cuba

I have been traveling to Cuba with Amigo Skate since April 2015. Amigo Skate is not part of a big corporation or a nonprofit. They are a movement dedicated to peace and unity through action sports, music, and art. Founded in 2009, their movement is led by a group of likeminded friends who decided that if they wanted the world to change, they would have to do it themselves. To eliminate the red tape that usually slows down most charity missions, they are 100% volunteer-based and self-funded.

Amigo Skate collects unwanted or broken skateboard equipment, and then refurbishes, rebuilds, and recycles it back to skaters in need in Cuba. Amigo averages around ONE TON of donated product per trip, including skateboards, music gear, and art supplies, and have impacted the lives of hundreds of kids over the past five years. Pro-skaters and action sports celebrities like CJ Ramone, Chris Casey from the Fuel TV Captain & Casey Show, and Chris Pontius from Wild Boys and Jackass have also traveled to Cuba with Amigo Skate.  

On my travels with Amigo Skate, I not only document the organization in action, but I also document the human lives they touch: the kids who don’t have access to skateboarding gear or clothing, or who don’t have an outlet to express themselves creatively. It’s an amazing portrait of a country coming into its own, and of kids finding their place amongst this country. 

For Amigo Skate Cuba 2015, my photographs were featured in all press coverage (for details and links, see “About Me” below), and presented in a solo show on August 4-27, 2015 at Slope Gallery in Tokyo, Japan. 

Amigo Skate’s next mission to Cuba takes place on Jan 6 – 13, 2016 and pro-skater Manny Santiago will be in attendance. I’d like to not only repeat what I did in 2015, but also expand Amigo Skate’s message and mission. 

My plans:

* Extend my travel dates to stay for a longer period of time, so I can shoot more solo with the kids, without a film crew or other photographers. This often results in even better portraits. My target dates are Jan 6 – 29, 2016.

* Ideally, I would like to take a few of the kids to other parts of the city and/or outside of Havana and shoot.

* Photo Exhibition in Tokyo, Japan


ABOUT ME:

I’m a NYC-based fashion, portrait & pet photographer. My images have been featured in numerous international publications, including Vogue, Nylon, Elle and Casa Brutus. In recent years, I’ve developed edgy private portraits of pets and their owners, with clients including professional models, actors and musicians.

Works:

* Vogue Japan

* Concrete Wave Magazine, Fall 2015 Issue

* The Garment District Journal, Issue No 2

* Solo Photo Exhibition: Slope Gallery, Tokyo, Japan August 4 - 27, 2015

Press for the show included:

  • HypeBeast Japan
  • VHS Mag
  • Warp Magazine
  • Vogue Japan
  • ELLE Japan


ABOUT AMIGO SKATE:

Imagine if Joey Ramone and Mother Teresa had a love child....that’s who Amigo Skate is.

Amigo Skate is not part of a big corporation or a nonprofit. They are a movement dedicated to peace and unity through action sports, music, and art. Founded in 2009, their movement is led by a group of likeminded friends who decided that if they wanted the world to change, they would have to do it themselves. In order to eliminate the red tape that usually slows down most charity missions, they have been 100% volunteer-based and self-funded.

A big part of what Amigo Skate does is collect unwanted or broken skateboard equipment, and then refurbish, rebuild, and recycle it back to skaters in need. Besides supplying new and used decks, wheels, hardware, grip and trucks, they have gathered a wide variety of action sports gear, music equipment, and art supplies. After collecting and refurbishing everything, they redistribute the goods to kids wherever and whenever they see a need. The main mission to provide kids with an outlet to express themselves.

Amigo Skate has worked within local communities, offering scholarships to skateboard camps, organizes canned food drives, fundraisers for breast cancer research and several children's causes. The Amigo Skate Team raises awareness by providing skate demos, safety clinics and entertainment to events like the Miami Dade County Youth Fair and the Skateboard Rodeo. They also plan on launching a free summer program to teach skateboarding to children with special needs and have recently formed a partnership with Longboards for Peace to teach children living in group homes how to skate.

For more info: http://www.amigoskate.com


WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES:

FLIGHTS: approx. $1000

HOTEL: $805 for 23 nights (approx. $35/day)

TRANSPORTATION within Cuba: $500

FOOD: $480 (approx. $20/day)

EQUIPMENT: $750 (costs may vary) 

ON SITE EXPENSES (i.e., traveling with photo subjects, etc.): dependent upon if my financial goal is met 

Any funds remaining from this trip will be funded for the next trip and/or the making of the Amigo photo journal.
