story:
*** Don't forget to add shipping costs when contributing! £7.50 UK+EUROPE / £15.00 REST OF THE WORLD*** THANK YOU ALL!

INDIEGOGO – BOOK CAMPAIGN

What is the project about?

Dream sequence is a long-term photographic project, which has taken over 3 years to complete. It oscillates around the portraiture of unconventional fictional figures seen “at the crossroads between fashion, photography, performance and art” (Sharon D. Lloyd). In doing so, the main inspiration has evolved from surrealism and film, specifically referencing Alfred Hitchcock's - “Spellbound” dream scenes; while considering the philosophical concept of the beautiful and sublime.

All the protagonists were shot in-camera with minimal (that is, only essential) retouching involved. As part of this in camera process, body painting, prosthetics, wigs, unusual 3D make-up techniques as well as real flowers were used in order to enhance and distort the bodies of the models.

The series was initiated in Germany and originally styled and conceptualized as a solo project. I continued the project in London, where I have worked and developed its visual nuances with a regular team who have constituted the core of the project – stylist Stella Gosteva, and make-up artist Marina Keri. In addition, I have collaborated with a variety of eminent up-and-coming designers from the leading Fashion and Art Schools in Europe. It is the involvement and donation of these unusual and beautifully crafted pieces that have crucially contributed to the creation of the final images.

The series won The seltmann+söhne Advertising Award in Germany, the Double Gold at PX3 in Paris, and recently they received an honourable mention at the International Photography Awards in NY. It has exhibited across Europe and recently showcased at the National Arts Club in Manhattan, New York, which has provided a wide exposure in many established international publications within fashion, photography and the arts

The book is addressed to anyone who is interested in the topic of character design (both in fashion and performativity), make-up / hair design, body hybridisation, aesthetics, and the philosophical approach to beauty and sublime within photography as a “documentation tool”, as well as a record of the extensive creative process.

Why support the project?

Your support of this project will aid the completion of the book, permitting the publication to be viewed in a creative arena, as well as contribute to showcasing the work of a range talented artists and designers, including myself as Madame Peripetie, to a broader and creatively informed audience.

You will be a part of a unique book that focuses on originality, imagination and a visually strong, beautifully crafted set of portraits.


What happens to the contributions?

The funds raised in this campaign will cover: proof-printing, printing, book-binding, font licensing, professional text editing, perks, shipping costs and the indiegogo / credit card / PayPal fees.

Book details:

  • Text: “The Beauty of Sublime” – Sharon D. Lloyd
  • Interview questions: multiple contributors
  • Book design: Gunee (Eugen Laitenberger) / hardcover 
  • Photographs: 69 in colour
  • Retail price: ca. £33.00 / ca. 39.90€
  • Publication date: early 2014
  • Distribution worldwide: seltmann+söhne Kunst- und Fotobuchverlag / Germany


What is the production plan?

The production plan includes:

  • A printing production including colour proofing, binding will proceed through January with final shipping through mid-February.
  • The book will be officially available in bookstores worldwide in around February 2014 thanks to the seltmann+söhne Publishing House that will provide support in its final distribution.

Who are the people behind the project?

Madame Peripetie

My name is Sylwana Zybura and I am a Polish-German linguist and photographer based in London.
The creation of my visual work under the pseudonym of Madame Peripetie has provided fashion editorials for international magazines and commercial clients such as Swarovski, Maison Martin Margiela, Cutler&Gross and Moody&Farrell.

My images have featured in several international books on character design and have received favourable reviews in publications ranging from Vogue.it, The British Journal of Photography, Trendland to the Huffington Post.

The main focus my the work lies within the creation of character design infused with surreal and abstract elements, the contemporary hybridised body, its sublime beauty and its study in connection to fashion and design.
www.madameperipetie.com

Sharon D. Lloyd

Sharon Lloyd is British academic and writer whose research interests centre on issues relating to the body, identity, fashion and cosmetic delineation.

Gunee

Gunee (Eugen Laitenberger) is a German graphic designer who works within the fields of Illustration, Photography and Design.
www.gunee.de

seltmann+söhne

Established in 2004 seltmann+söhne is a print company based in Lüdenscheid /Germany.
www.seltmannundsoehne.de/en/


Risks and challenges

The layout / design of the book is finalised and ready to go as soon as the funds are available so there won't be any risk involved there.

The challenges when publishing the photo book include the possibility of delay, but seltmann+söhne is highly experienced in dealing with the production and printing challenges involved in making great photo books. If this campaign is successful, we would do everything possible to make sure the book is published / available end of January and distributed mid-February!


Perks

Poster Motive A1

Kaleidoscopic wrapping paper

Limited edition signed print 40cmx40cm

Limited edition signed print 80cmx80cm


"Faceless" OR "Wired"


Special thanks

I would like to thank Sharon D. Lloyd, Stella Gosteva, Marina Keri, Gunee and Marc for not only coming on board to collaborate on this project in the last few months, but also never giving up, being inspirational, motivated and putting countless hours of work and dedication into this project. And thank you Andrew Markham for your support and academic input!


LET'S MAKE SOME NOISE!!!

I hope that this project will engage you and and thanks so much for your contribution!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help: Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this project.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!
Help us make some NOISE!

Thank you so much for your support!

Risks and challenges

The layout / design of the book is finalised and ready to go as soon as the funds are available so there won't be any risk involved there.


The challenges when publishing the photo book include the possibility of delay, but seltmann+söhne is highly experienced in dealing with the production and printing challenges involved in making great photo books. If this campaign is successful, we would do everything possible to make sure the book is published / available end of January and distributed mid-February!


Perks
Poster Motive A1


Kaleidoscopic wrapping paper


Limited edition signed print 40cmx40cm


Limited edition signed print 80cmx80cm"Faceless" OR "Wired"


Special thanks

I would like to thank Sharon D. Lloyd, Stella Gosteva, Marina Keri, Gunee and Marc for not only coming on board to collaborate on this project in the last few months, but also never giving up, being inspirational, motivated and putting countless hours of work and dedication into this project.  And thank you Andrew Markham for your support and academic input!


LET'S MAKE SOME NOISE!!!

I hope that this project will engage you and and thanks so much for your contribution!

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help: Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this project.


The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!
Help us make some NOISE!


Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Mi historia

En el 2007 llegué por primera vez al Llano por 2 semanas a hacer un registro de fauna y flora para una reserva natural llamada Palmarito, en el Casanare. Cerca de esta tierra conocí a un viejo llanero, caporal del Hato San Pablo llamado Ricardo Daza (Peluso) quien me enseñó a montar y transmitió la esencia de su cultura y sus trabajos en una primera jornada de 4 am a 7 pm, junto a otros 40 llaneros. Enseñándome a montar me enseñaba a vivir, a quedarme.

My story

I arrived in 2007 for the first time to the “Llano” (savannah) for 2 weeks in order to make a registry of the fauna and flora of a natural reserve called Palmarito, in the Casanare region. Near this land I met an old “Llanero, chief of cowboys at the “Hato San Pablo”, called Ricardo Daza (Peluso) who taught me how to ride and conveyed to me the essence of their culture and their work in one first journey from 4 am to 7 pm together with 40 llaneros. By teaching me how to ride he was teaching me how to live, and to stay there.

 

             

Sentir una cultura de casi 5 siglos a través del ritmo del caballo me ancló a esta tierra y me quedé por 10 años. Yo tenía 20, 15 días de universidad y las ganas de hacer de este territorio mi escuela de vida.

To feel a culture which is almost 5 centuries old, through the rhythm of the horse, anchored me to this land and I stayed for ten years. I was 20, with two weeks of college and with the wish of making this land the school for my life. 

             

El caballo se impone como eje y fundamento en este ensayo porque desde el primer momento fue quien me inyectó el alma de los llaneros, me hizo sentir que quería aferrarme a su misterio, a ese estilo semi-nómada en que esta gente vive y trabaja.

The horse imposes itself as the main axis and the base for this essay because from the first moment it was the one who injected the soul of the Llaneros into me, and made me feel that I wanted to hold onto his mystery, to that semi-nomad style in which these people live and work.

               

El caballo me hizo vivir la tierra, me transformó como ser humano, como mujer. Mi manera de pensar la vida empezó a tejerse con la idea de lo errante, de la distancia, de las pocas pertenencias. El caballo aquí se vuelve el símbolo de las relaciones entre llanera y llanero, de sus encuentros y despedidas, de historias de amor que terminaron siendo también las mías.

The horse made me live the land, transformed me as a human being, as a woman. My way of thinking about life began to weave with the idea of the errant, of the distance, of the few belongings. The horse here becomes the symbol of the relationships between the “llanera” (cowgirl) and the “llanero” (cowboy), of their meetings and farewells, love stories that also became mine.

                                                

Uno de los primeros caballos que conocí en el Hato llevaba por nombre ‘’Volví por verte’’, ¿No era acaso lo mismo que yo buscaba? Y ese otro de color bayo al que nombré ‘’Adiós que me voy’’ que tanto me acompañó en los trabajos. Un llanero cuenta su vida por los caballos que ha tenido, yo hasta ahora tengo dos caballos que me dieron en los Hatos ; Chemerejure y el Secreto, hoy en día viven en Matabrava. El primero que me dieron, el de la foto arriba de este texto, es la imagen que abre este libro, irrumpiendo con la fuerza visceral que a ambos nos caracteriza.

Se ve todo de mi en su noche. En el llano dicen que uno se parece a sus caballos o ellos a uno, este es un retrato de lo que juntos vivimos. 

One of the first horses that I met in the “Hato”  was named “I came back to see you again”.  Wasn’t this the same I was looking for? And that other one with a golden color which I named “Adios because I am leaving” and who accompanied me so many times in the works. A “llanero” tells his life by the horses he has had, and so far I have two horses that they gave me at the “Hatos”: Chemerejure and The Secret … today the live at “Matabrava”.- The first one they gave to me, Chemerejure, is the image which opens the book, bursting with the visceral force that characterizes both of us. 

Everything about me can be seen in his night, at the “llano” they say that we resemble our horses or they resemble us, it is a picture of what we have lived together, of what we became together.

             

Llano es un viaje épico a través de los caminos de los Llaneros, gente que habita y recorre las sabanas de la cuenca del Orinoco en Colombia. El relato se construye entre invierno y  verano que es a su vez el escenario físico y psicológico donde transcurren las historias más íntimas de hombres y mujeres que siguen soñando con una tierra de caballos salvajes y distancias sin cerca.

“Llano”  is an epical journey through the paths of the Llaneros (cowboys), people who inhabit and roam the savannahs of the Orinoco River basin in Colombia. The story is built during winter and summer, in the physical and psychological scenery where the more intimate stories take place, of the men and women who continue dreaming about a land of wild horses and distances without fences.

 

              

 

El libro

Musuk Nolte, editor del libro, se unió a este proyecto de vida. Desde la convivencia,  la amistad  y su silencio tan oportuno construyó un escenario donde yo pudiera  enfrentarme a todo lo vivido, a darle un lugar a los sentimientos y un tono que contuviera el misterio de este viaje.  Lo más importante para mi del proceso es sentir que ese otro, Musuk, se apropia de mi memoria o de un tramo de mi vida y hacemos una voz, una voz que se pregunta: ¿Cómo escuchar el Llano en las imágenes?  ¿ Cómo prescindir de los textos y testimonios para construir un lenguaje visual que represente la voz de la gente y  tenga la atmósfera de todo lo vivido? ¿Cómo dejar un rastro de la ausencia, del amor, del ahogo, de la fuerza? ¿Cómo nombrar todo lo que me conmovió y estremeció en esta tierra? ¿Por su nombre? Llano.

The book

Musuk Nolte, editor of the book joined this life project. From sharing time and friendship together, and with his so timely silence, he built a scenery where I could face everything I had lived, where I could give a place to my feelings and a tone that could contain the mystery of this journey. The most important part for me of the process was to feel that the other one, Musuk, takes hold of my memory, or of a stretch of my life, and we generate a voice, a voice that asks “How to listen to the “Llano” through the images?, How to do away with text and testimonies to construct a visual language that represents the voice of their people and containing the atmosphere of all that was lived? How to leave a trace of the absence, of the love, of the lack of breath, of the strength? How to tell about everything that had moved and shaken me in this land? By its name?: LLANO 

 

Llano será impreso en España con los mejores estándares de producción, el diseño ha estado a cargo de Juanjo Justicia del Estudio Underbau en Madrid y su producción esta programada para el mes de junio.  En este momento la edición esta terminada y estamos afinando algunos detalles de la portada.

LLANO will be printed in Spain with the highest standards of production, the design has been under the leadership of Juanjo Justicia of the Underbau Studio in Madrid and production is scheduled for the month of June. At this stage, the edition is finished and we are working on some details of the cover.

 

 

                                         

                      

Caracteristicas:

Formato: 17x22 cm

88 páginas impresas a 3/3 tintas

Tapa dura cosida a hilo

Edicion de 750 ejemplares

KWY Ediciones

Estamos haciendo esta preventa para poder cubrir el otro 50% que nos falta para poder costear su producción.  Gracias por tu aporte!

Recompensas:

Con motivo de la publicación, hemos producido una edición especial de 4 imágenes firmadas por Juanita. 

  • Formato 60x40cm
  • Impresión por inyección de tinta sobre papel de algodón Baryta
  • Edición de 8+2 Prueba de Artista
  • Envio certificado a todo el mundo en tubo de cartón. 

                            

          

                 

                 

Juanita Escobar (Colombia,1985)

Fotógrafa autodidacta, ganadora del Premio Colombo-Suizo de Fotografía 2009 con su obra Gente – Tierra y exposición de la misma en el museo Santa Clara de Bogotá, co-autora del libro Silencios. Un llano de mujeres publicado con la editorial Número en el 2009.

Ganadora de la beca Crea Digital otorgada por el Ministerio de Cultura y Tecnologías de Colombia para el desarrollo del e-book El Llano aras de cielo, 2012.

El año 2015, fué Seleccionada para el MasterClass del World Press Photo en Latinoamerica y el 2016 gano el “Portafolio Review Prize” de National Geographic Society, durante San Jose Foto (Uruguay).

Actriz del film EPIFANIA, seleccionado para el BIFF Festival Internacional de Cine de Busan 2016 (Premiere Mundial).

 

Por favor, ayúdanos a pasar la voz sobre este proyecto compartiendo el link con tus amigos y colegas. Gracias por hacer posible este proyecto!

story:
Representation matters

Although I'm new to writing fiction, I've been a sports photographer for the last decade at the regional and national level. Among other sports, I've covered Roller Derby in Canada from local leagues to being Lead Photographer for the 2013 Nationals. So when I started hearing from other authors that it's hard to get cover photos that aren't 'look, another buff white dude', I thought maybe I could do something about it.

Digging deeper, I talked with more authors and designers and found that there is a very real challenge finding diversity in an industry where 'diversity' usually means 'Can I get another buff white guy with different hair?'. Believe it or not, more than a few designers are forced to start carving up stock images to mix and match pieces together in order to create new people from almost scratch.

That poses quite the problem when they are trying to build covers for novels that feature 'not a buff white dude' as their characters. That also means it's harder for authors to feature women and people of colour as heroes if they can't get something that looks like their hero on the cover.

So the reader gets fewer people that look 'like them'.

We want to address this issue for both groups. The end result will be both more real diversity in the images available, and also easier workflow for the authors and designers who use the images.

Because representation matters.


Here's the solution...

We're going to do an ongoing series of photo shoots that will include true diversity.

People of ethnicity and gender that reach beyond 'buff white dude'.

Black men. Asian women. Indian men. White women. Indigenous men. Black women. Asian men. Indian women. Indigenous women. Yes, some white men...but not as many as you might normally see.

They're going to be holding hands. They're going to be hugging. They're going to look into each other's eyes. They might kiss. They might growl at each other. They'll look out of frame. They'll break the fourth wall. They'll have their shirts off. They'll wear tuxes and dresses. They'll look like they stepped out of a special forces movie poster. They'll look like they're at a family holiday feast.

They'll give the authors and designers the versatility they need to create the covers that represent their heroes.


What's in it for me?

Deeply discounted images that feature more diversity than previously available.

The ability to request specific outcomes of a photo shoot. Whether it's genre, or a certain ethnicity, we will work with the sponsor to dial in what they want in the images.

How about being a model for a day with a professional team of photographers and makeup artists? You'll get photos of you with the rest of the models in actual shoots, and if you choose, you can release the images for authors and designers to use in their works.


Why are we crowd funding?

We're going to pay these people what they are worth. The photographers, the makeup artists, the models, and editors. They are all vital to a professional photo shoot. We aren't going to ask these professionals to work for free any more than we would a plumber or dentist.

But that's a good thing. Professionals show up on time, ready to get to work. Professionals make our lives smooth and easy, so we can concentrate on the business of making amazing photos.

That's where the money goes. Straight into paying the people who will make this possible.


Why should anyone help out?

Authors and designers:

Authors and designers are going to get significantly more diverse images than they have ever had access to, all in one place. Through Project: Uncovered, they are also going to get them at greatly reduced prices to get this show going. Afterwards, as the Project: Uncovered images go live to the public, it will evolve into a searchable database that will greatly speed up searching for specific images.

Everyone else:

People who aren't well represented are going to see their people a lot more often once the authors and designers have these options. Through Project: Uncovered, they are going to be able to see it happening right in front of them. Some of them might even decide to be come a permanent part of the journey and sponsor a role in a photo shoot.


Challenges

Yes, there are real challenges. We have real solutions.

Sometimes people don't show up. We have backups. Our bench is going to be as deep as we need it.

Sometimes technology fails us. We have backups. We have backups to our backups, from extra equipment in the studio to off-site storage of data.

The goal is to have the images up on the site by the end of September 2017. Worst case, our backup plan is for October 2017, and that will only be necessary if everything burns to the ground on the day of the shoot...because our equipment will record to multiple locations and we backup offsite.


How can I help?

The most important thing is...tell everyone. Seriously. Tell your author friends that we're hard at work for them. Tell your non-author friends that what we're doing is going to help people get represented. Use your social media savvy and Indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the word.

The next most important step is...sponsor Project: Uncovered. If you're an author or designer, you have a vested interest in checking the couch for some spare change. The images through Project: Uncovered start at 33% off and go up to 77% off...if you think you'll need that many...and the image credits don't expire.

If you don't think you'll need images, but think we're on the right track, we have options for you to leave something in the proverbial tip jar.

...and if you really want to get involved, you can splurge for yourself or someone else to take part in a Project: Uncovered photo shoot.

We have backups to our backups, from extra equipment in the studio to off-site storage of data.The goal is to have the images up on the site by the end of September 2017. Worst case, our backup plan is for October 2017, and that will only be necessary if everything burns to the ground on the day of the shoot...because our equipment will record to multiple locations and we backup offsite.How can I help?The most important thing is...tell everyone. Seriously. Tell your author friends that we're hard at work for them. Tell your non-author friends that what we're doing is going to help people get represented. Use your social media savvy and Indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the word.The next most important step is...sponsor Project: Uncovered. If you're an author or designer, you have a vested interest in checking the couch for some spare change. The images through Project: Uncovered start at 33% off and go up to 77% off...if you think you'll need that many...and the image credits don't expire.If you don't think you'll need images, but think we're on the right track, we have options for you to leave something in the proverbial tip jar....and if you really want to get involved, you can splurge for yourself or someone else to take part in a Project: Uncovered photo shoot.

story:
2018 AVIATION ART calendar

by Rastislav MARGUS

Hey guys. It's that time of the year again. It's time for the 2018 Aviation Art Calendar. This year it's going to be better than ever and I am so excited to share with you all the improvements that I am working on.

 

The Past

For those who don’t know me I am an airline pilot and professional photographer at the same time. I've got a lot of responsibilities and I love both of my passions. In 2016 I have published my first wall calendar in a limited edition run and sold it out in about a month.

For the great success I have published the 2017 calendar as well and now it's time to create the 2018 calendar. There are a lot of aviation wall calendars out there so what makes this one different? Aviation Art Calendar is created with photography art in mind in the first place and only then taking its subject "airplanes" as a secondary objective.  By doing so I have gained respect and firm place in the aviation photography field which was confirmed by the Federation of European Photographers (FEP) and numerous customers.

 

The Present

This time the 2018 calendar will be printed by industry standard full-color offset printing for great color reproduction and double the size than previous years for greater impact which will make it 60 x 42 cm big. It will have laminated front and back cover pages and same as previous years no one will be cut short of his favorite airplane type or photography style. Fans of civil, military or old, new or even fast vs. slow airplanes all will be pleased to have their plane included in this year's issue. Regarding photography style you can expect full color and duotone photographs, close-ups or more environmental looking images, but still carrying my signature style making it eye-catching, minimalistic, calm and bold at the same time. Simply the calendar is perfect for anyone who loves good photography and airplanes. What I love the most about the photography is the freedom of expression and the ability to tell the story and so if you buy the Aviation Art Calendar you are not just buying a calendar that you can get in any office or book store, you are becoming a person with taste, you are gaining the access and  opportunity to decorate your living space with a valuable art where these eye-catching photographs are presenting the world of aviation in a calm yet majestic way where simple shapes and colors are left to speak for themselves.

 

The Future

To make it affordable I have to print in large quantities and this year I have set modest goal to publish 100 piece limited edition. But my goal for the year 2019 is to bring it to even more crowd, to make it even cheaper by maintaining or even increasing the quality. To reach this goal I will have to print some, say, 300 pieces. This is not impossible, however to achieve this goal I will really need your help. If you show me your support, it will allow me to cut the price by half and it will give me so much needed momentum to publish my long time project the Aviation Art Book which is currently in the prototype stage but will need a print run of 1000 piece to make it affordable.

 

Afterword

None of my calendar or book projects is something profitable, it cannot be, there is just too many items on the market, but I see this as my life journey, my way of leaving something behind, my will to push myself and the art of photography to the new heights.

One of the ways how to find the funds for my projects is to run a Crowd Funding campaign on the IndieGoGo website.

Please follow the link and you can pre-order now and if you have any friends who love aviation and photography too please share with them and let them know this product is out there and together we can help others to nicely decorate our homes and offices in 2018.

In advance I would like to say big THANK YOU to all my previous and future supporters, thanks to You I am where I am now and as you can see, I was already able to increase the size and print quality while maintaining almost the same price. For sure together we can create something even bigger and memorable.

Please feel free to visit my websites to learn more about me and my work. Thank you for your time and support.

Yours

Rastislav Margus

www.FlyArt.Pub
www.AviationArt.Photo
www.Airplane.Gallery
www.fb.com/FlyArt.Publishing
www.fb.com/AviationArtPhotography
www.instagram.com/AviationArt

 

 

Funds Use, Risks & Challenges

The calendar is to be self published and Since this is my first Crowd Funding campaign I will take it easy and will try to rise just 1/3 of the funds required for the project with rest of the funds to be sourced elsewhere. This campaign acts as a pre-order strategy to raise the funds for printing. Printing, publishing and launching of the calendar is estimated to be completed by October 2017. I don’t foresee any challenges since I am very determined to do this project.

story:
Our Story

Jamie was an extremely talented photographer. His work ranged from beautiful landscapes of the North East surroundings to delicate and eye catching portraiture. Being overly modest about his talent resulted in Jamie never exhibiting any of his pieces, so we are going to do it for him!


The Impact

On the 20th of November we will be hosting a day in memory of Jamie at The Knack Club, Seaham. 
At 4pm we will start the day off with the exhibition of Jamie's photography. The photographs will then be auctioned at 7pm at a starting price of £40. All proceeds will be donated to The Huntingtons Disease Association. In order to be able to auction the photography to raise money for this charity. We need to get as much money together to be able to print the photos and frame them. This is where you come in!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least £200 in order to print and frame the photographs.

(Please note that the goal on this website says £500 as this is the least amount you can campaign for using this service, however we only need £200. Just to save confusement). 

We are thinking 40 people donated a fiver this is easily done. It will only take a short amount of time to do so on this website, it's for a great cause in memory of a great friend. Everyone who donates are welcome to come to the event where not only will we be hosting the exhibition and auction but we will be having entertainment. From 8pm we will kick off the party with some excellent entertainment booked so far we have an acoustic set from the amazingly talented Kate Gormley, and one of the best local bands of late, The Karma Heart with much more to be confirmed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Claire Milford is also collecting donations, contact her on 07983 400 525. Also contact her if you have a prize you could donate to the raffle.

story:
Transform

My walk starts in 2010, as a former Network Technician at such a young age I've had it all. Two years after graduating High School I landed a double degree and landed a real job in the industry. I'm going somewhere in life, I'm going to make it and make it good. 2010, the same year my little brother revolutionised my perspective as a whole on life. He brought home a bass guitar.

A magical bass? I wish. What was magical though was his constant attempts just to get it right. Everyday he would be at this; everyday. Couple months ahead lead to an acoustic guitar and everyday he would practice without reason, only just to get it right. My curse for curiousity was born.

This is my first step within my project where my life begins. Curiosity allured me to pick up the guitar and play. I sucked at it. It was a full sized guitar which made my hands cramp, my strums were uncoordinated and messy, it wasn't me. Next thing you know, he brings home a ukulele which I fell in love with.

It was small, light, had two lesser strings and it was the first contact I made with anything I can relate passion with. Fast forward to a couple months down the road and I am already teaching my friends how to play ukulele. Fast forward a couple months and my Youtube account is created and I've begun to learn something else. I sing. Fast forward two more years and you'll find me sitting in my home studio writing to the world about something new that I have learnt and have absolutely gone insane about. To be a person who is able to capture a snippet of life and present it to the world as his own vision and show his audience what it means to be a photographer.

If you can smell the street by looking at the photo, it's a street photograph - Bruce Gilden

I've broken through doors of all sorts of hobbies. I've danced for a crowd, drawn as a child, sang to an audience, maintained networks of business firms, driven fast cars, ran charity events, made friends across the world and partied with celebrities; my bucket list is labelled spontaneous and is never destined to finish. What I have paused it all for is photography.

Bokeh is what got me first, how on earth are these photographers achieving such great photos?! It was killing me that I couldn't get the same quality of bokeh on my old camera phone at the time. Early 2012 I decided to give photography a go. With an expert tech background operating a camera should be child's play.

Saved up about $600 dollars and grabbed myself a Canon Kiss X5 and the 18-55mm kit lens after countless hours of DigitalRev and whatever else I could learn on Youtube. The first minutes spent shooting my first DSLR was on toys. I could not get over the fact that if I let the shutter run for longer I'd be able to get great lighting even though my room is pitch black after the lights go out. Curiousity kicks in, what else can I do? Couple days later, I went outside to shoot. I was amazed by what I could do in low light in my room, my amazement once again established when my camera saw daylight. Metering shot through the roof, I now have the power to capture any moment from now on in my life at 1/400th of a second. I've always wanted to have a super power as a kid, this cuts close enough.

At this point in time I am fighting for my exemptions at university. It was impossible for me to not resit several exams I have done in the prior years even though I have proof of identical exams and a grade book to prove it. It killed me to stay and redo everything I've done for another two years so I got a job at a bar and left university to take time and consider where I am going next.

I'm currently almost two months out since I've left the bar after working there 9 months and within these two months I have dedicated myself to photography. I took photos for events that came up at the bar, I went to car meets and took photos of modified cars and I also went overseas and brought my camera this time round and made sure I kept and brought back all my digitized memories.

The seed has begun to sprout. I started to make up excuses to bring my camera out. I'd always be late to my singing lessons because the trains always delayed me so I'd take the train that got me there half an hour earlier. I used this time to shoot street.

Street shots are complex. The gist wasn't enough, I've learnt all the fundamentals of photography but it wasn't enough. I wanted to know more.


Discover

The curse of curiousity has taught me the value of wisdom, as the value of wisdom has taught me the gift of intelligence. These attributes have redefined my life as a whole and I now for once can comfortably say that I have a direction. I have a five year plan, I have a life long plan. My name will be remembered, I now know what I want to do and god damn it I am going to be great.

I started from the roots, bought my first book that I intentionally wanted to seriously read front to back. "Understanding Exposure" by Bryan Peterson. This book solidified what I already understood with the fundamentals of photography. The second book, "The Birth of Photography" by Brian Coe gave me the knowledge of how far photography has come till today. What i still didn't know was how to take a great photo and consistently take photos in great manner.

Curiosity had given birth to what I claim as seriousness and commitment to what I have dedicated myself to do for the rest of my entire life. Everything I didn't know about photography I studied. Wake up, stream videos online about anything that I could find about photography and learn it. Brush my teeth, back to my desk and I continue to study through other resources. I'd only leave my desk to eat, shower or go to the loo. Insanity for knowledge had begun. If I didn't know something about photography, I will know by the end of the day.


Take flight

It's 3AM in the morning and I am quite pleased with my short draft of reflection. I've done street, I've shot models, cars have been snapped, interviews have been smashed, my status as a photographer is on the rise. I write this today because I've currently hit a wall.

I've thrown out my queen sized bed and replaced it for a futon couch. Add two extra desks and a bunch of old junk that I deem magical because it comes from a time where I don't have much photos from. What I have now is a 3m wide steel frame my Dad help me weld up standing about 2.4m tall and a giant piece of white fabric I bought for $18 attached to the steel frame via coat hangers and a super bright living room lamp that gives off a burning smell when I put it on blast.

I've spent about two months under constant study and had regular shooting sessions whether it be street, model, car or chasing the damn sunset in traffic. I learn and apply what I learn immediately. Insanity for knowledge increases my satisfaction for improvement.

The fundamentals are all in memory movement. With one more step mastering pre focus techniques I will be content with my skills as a proclaimed professional.

All professionals have specific tools to aid in their performance to portray what they've learnt. I am an artist and a professional seeking a hand from anyone who is willing to help me.

If you've read this far into my story I admire your commitment and thank your curiosity for accepting time out of your life to indulge in what is running through mine. This is how I want people to feel when they see my photos. There should be a connection established and an understanding of what is going in within that moment of life.

Finally I shall conclude my little story with why I began it in the first place. I am limited to a crop sensor camera and I am yearning for a full frame. I can't fully utilise my lenses as they are intended to and it really makes a difference with the 1.6x conversion.

Camera: Canon 5D Mark II/III (depending on how well this goes)

I was looking at Hasselblad cameras with a digital backing but I can't afford to buy Hasselblad lenses either, damn.


Project: Shoot for the Stars

Now that you have a taste of my life and what I want to do with it. I have to prove it to you once again that I am this charmingly described person. From the 1st of September till the 9th of November I will be undergoing a project called "Shoot for the Stars". It entails a ten week process of me shooting something for everyone to see in response to how well the funding goes. If I can make this project work and receive great feedback and response from you all, I can safely say that I haven't gotten too crazy.

If I miraculously get the full support I have requested for I will muster up a great photography project to say thanks.

That's all for today guys, once again I thank you so much for reading. If you are interested you can find my tumblr, pinterest or instagram.

Tumblr (Photography Journal): www.wantowalks.tumblr.com

Pinterest (Street/Studio): www.pinterest.com/wantodome

Facebook (Automotive): www.facebook.com/wantowalks

Instagram: @wantowalks


Checklist:

Week 1: Give Me A Challenge! *POSTED ON TUMBLR*

story:
Cultura in Pilsen and La Catrina Cafe are excited to announce that we will be collaborating with photographer Akito Tsuda, to bring his photographs and new book Pilsen Days back to where it all started—our beautiful neighborhood of Pilsen!

After more than 20 years, Akito wishes to return to Pilsen to share with the community a new book of photography and an exhibit. In a time of cultural erasure and displacement, highlighting the history and beauty of the neighborhood and its people is as important as ever.

 

AKITO TSUDA

 

Born in Hamamatsu, Japan, Akito Tsuda first arrived to Chicago in 1990 while a student at Columbia College. As a newcomer in a foreign place, he felt at home with and was particularly fascinated by the Pilsen community. Through his street and portrait photography, he came to be welcomed by the people living here, in an extraordinary and moving illustration of intercultural understanding.

​"Taking a photo of people on the street has influenced my awareness in many ways . I've learned people's culture, history and various ways of living through taking photographs; however, my primarily interest has not been about finding out distinctiveness between people and me, but rather finding similarity among us. While spending a time to be interested in people and place I met, I photographed people when I've felt being alive." - Akito Tsuda

 

 

From 1991 to his departure from the city in 1994, Akito regularly visited Pilsen, taking photos of everyday life out in the neighborhood and being invited into people’s homes to capture more intimate portraits. For over two decades these photos remained relatively unseen until last year, when some of them began surfacing on social media. After an overwhelming positive response and connection to the historical photos, Akito decided to print a book of this photography as a tribute to his wonderful experiences with people in the neighborhood.

 

 

THE PILSEN DAYS BOOK RELEASE, ART EXHIBIT AND PERFORMANCE

For our campaign, we wish to continue the legacy that Akito's Pilsen experience and work in the 1990s, which has been an inspiration to many. Our fundraiser will support two projects that will see their first light during his visit from October 27 to November 4, 2017:

  • Cultura in Pilsen will feature the photography of Akito Tsuda in a special book release and photo exhibit opening event at La Catrina Café on Friday, October 27, 2017.  The exhibit will stay up for two weeks.

 

 

 

  • Clinard Dance will partner with Cultura in Pilsen by presenting a new interdisciplinary dance piece inspired by Akito's photos of Pilsen and featuring original music by guitarist Pedro Cortés on Friday, November 4, 2017.

 

Akito will be in attendance for both events . Stay tuned for his artist talks as well!

 

FUNDRAISING GOAL

Our fundraising goal for this multi-faceted project is $7,500. With that money, we hope to fund the following:

  • Round trip travel from Japan to Chicago, housing and honorarium for Akito's 10-day stay in the neighborhood.
  • Printing and shipping the centerpiece of this project, the Pilsen Days book. The book will be produced and printed by Akito's longtime printer in Japan, an essential request by the artist. Books will be shipped from Japan in time for the October 27th exhibit/book release celebration.
  • Local printing of high quality postcards and poster prints for fundraiser perks and sale after the fundraising campaign.
  • Various costs of organizing and mounting the photo exhibit/book release, as well as for related marketing and event production and materials.

As of now, all of our work is volunteer-based. If we surpass our initial campaign goal amount, we will be able to print additional books and prints for inventory to sell at La Catrina Cafe in the subsequent months after the book release, and pay for production work by Cultura in Pilsen, curators and exhibit installers, marketing, sound and lighting elements to highlight the photos and the dance presentation. DONATE SOON, so we can begin the production of this beautiful book ASAP!

PERKS FOR DONATING TO OUR FUNDRAISER INCLUDE

  • Early release copy of the Pilsen Days book - 184 pages, 175 B/W and 4 color images, size: 9.8x8.6" / 250x220mm softcover (no jacket), laser print, and shipped from a small printer in Japan.  ALL BOOK PERKS WILL BE AVAILABLE AT LA CATRINA FOR PICK UP. IF YOU NEED THE BOOK SHIPPED, PLEASE CONTACT THE ORGANIZER.
  • Pilsen Days  poster prints - Black & white, size: 7x11"  
  • Pilsen Days postcards - Black & white, size: 4x7", matte.
  • Exclusive sponsor reception access, handwritten thank you notes, social media shout-outs and more!
  • Availability for all Perk items to be signed by Akito himself at our events on October 27 and November 4, 2017.

Let's bring Akito to Pilsen! Thank you all in advance for supporting this project!

story:
My Story

Hello everyone Slim here from baliwaves.com, Bali's original surf report website since back in 1999. The site provides regular free reports, pictures and news from the Island of Bali in Indonesia.

It all started in 1996. I was completely broke but I had a strong passion for surf and everything revolving around it. A friend of mine, Geoff Crane, invited me for a couple of beers and he also made me put my last 5 dollars into a slot machine. Five minutes later we had a few thousand dollars in our pockets and tickets to Bali booked.

I have come a long way since then and made so many good friends along the way. I have been crafting surf reports on a regular basis with the aim of providing surfers with reports, images, videos and general information on surfing in Bali. I have been living and surfing in Bali for many years and provide a unique perspective on the waves and general surfing scene. 

The Equipment

I have burned out 2 old camera bodies this year and down to my last camera body. This campaign is all about trying to secure enough funds to up date my camera equipment that keeps baliwaves delivering the best possible views out of Bali to you. The goal is to raise at least AU$6,000.

A good equipment is vital to keep Baliwaves.com running. The site not only gives you plenty of Bali, it also helps me to support my family and helping others along the way. The new basic equipment will also allow me to get back to shooting our own video material for baliwaves, which I think that will be a big plus for everyone.

How will the funds be used?

I’m hoping to raise at least AU$6,000 that will be invested into the following:

  • New camera body and a new lens: a more high-speed camera that will nail just that right moment! 
  • New tripod: I have been using my old one for the past 18 years!
  • Battery grip and batteries for the new camera.
  • Flights to Singapore where the best priced and biggest range of camera equipment is found close to Bali, to get the most value for our dollars.

 

Perks:

I have put together a few packages and items for sale so that you can help this fundraise the money needed to buy the equipment:

- 6'5 brand new Diverse surfboard: Custom made surfboards based on the Gold Coast of Australia, extremely well made and finished surfboards by David Veral, and made to perform.
Note: This board is to be picked up from Bali or can be delivered to your accommodation in Bali.

- 6'0" brand new Diverse surfboard: Custom made surfboards based on the Gold Coast of Australia, extremely well made and finished surfboards by David Veral, and made to perform.
Note: This board is to be picked up from Bali or can be delivered to your accommodation in Bali.

- 7 day surfing accommodation packages in Bali:  This package is your ticket to a hassle free surfing holiday in Bali. All you need to do is surf and have fun. Stay in our surfer friendly guest house 450m from the beach in Tuban. Wake up, get fed, and then get taken to best waves possible to suit your level of experience. Big private air conditioned rooms close to lots of café’s restaurants in a safe and friendly part of town. You will get to surf some hidden locations in Bali

- 5 day surfing accommodation packages in Bali:  This package is your ticket to a hassle free surfing holiday in Bali. All you need to do is surf and have fun. Stay in our surfer friendly guest house 450m from the beach in Tuban. Wake up, get fed, and then get taken to best waves possible to suit your level of experience. Big private air conditioned rooms close to lots of café’s restaurants in a safe and friendly part of town. You will get to surf some hidden locations in Bali

- 3 day surfing accommodation packages in Bali:  This package is your ticket to a hassle free surfing holiday in Bali. All you need to do is surf and have fun. Stay in our surfer friendly guest house 450m from the beach in Tuban. Wake up, get fed, and then get taken to best waves possible to suit your level of experience. Big private air conditioned rooms close to lots of café’s restaurants in a safe and friendly part of town. You will get to surf some hidden locations in Bali

- 3hr photo sessions in Bali for 2 surfers: Our speciality here at baliwaves, Putting you into the best waves and then nailing the shots of you on those special waves, memories that live on forever. The surf photo session can be used by 2 persons or just one. We will work out the best time, tide and location to make it all come together.

- Acommodation on a wonderful Beach House in Balian, Bali: This is a private owned 2 storey house than can sleep up to 3 people. This gorgeous house is fully furnished and has cleaning service. Located only 100m from the beach at Balian, West Bali. Here you can wake up and check the surf from bed. Balian has an A Frame left and right hand peak that produces some long rides. It also has its own friendly little ex pat community with waves all year round.

-1 day surf trip in Bali for 2 surfers pick up from hotel: Just let us know when you will be in Bali and where you will be staying (West Coast Bali) and we will do the rest to make sure you get some perfect waves to suit your level and have a fun day out with us, we will also include some photos of you surfing in the deal.

- Baliwaves.com trucker caps and sticker packs: Our baliwaves trucker caps are well made from quality material here in Bali (NOT IN CHINA). The caps feature an embroidered baliwaves logo. with meshing on the back. We also include a handful of baliwaves stickers, also made from quality materials here in Bali.

*To be picked in Bali

 

Extra Reward! Every person who makes a purchase or gives a donation of 50 dollars or more will go into a draw for a brand new 6'9" 39L Diverse surfboard.

 

Every little help counts!

The reason why I have not enough money of my own to purchase the camera equipment is due to having 2 operations in Australia. The last one consisted on having some cancer removed from my back last August.  It got me financially stretched to the limit. Seeing as though I am not a resident of Australia I have to pay everything in cash / check.

Some of you undoubtedly would not like to, or are not able to contribute financially. That's fine! If you like what I'm doing here, perhaps you can help in other ways?

  1. Email people you think would find this interesting!
  2. Share this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share buttons!

story:
Hello! My name is Leah Marie and I have been on a yearlong journey thru a project I call the 52 Week Photo Challenge. My 2014 news year’s resolution was to expand my knowledge of photography, build a kick ass portfolio and to reflect on my own photographic process! Since then I have made my best attempt at one personal creative photo project every week for 12 months.

Share House Photography was born out of a creative living space. What all started as a simple loft has now become a photo studio, a gallery, an artist’s workspace and so much more. The Share House has gathered quite a following and has built a community of ambitious, likeminded individuals.

The 52 Week Photo Challenge was my own endeavor to expand my knowledge and skills as a photographer. The challenges came from a variety of places and morphed into something completely unexpected each time. Every week I would blog about my photo challenges and was thrilled to receive so much positive feedback. The best was when my friends would tell me how my challenges inspired them to challenge themselves. I noticed that I was invoking creativity in my community and that just makes me want to do even more.

As the year comes to an end my challenge is almost over but I can assure you that it won’t stop there. In 2015 my goal is to challenge myself on a monthly basis. I will be doing a 12 Month Photo Challenge but my ideas are bigger and better then ever before and will require more planning and collaboration between a crew of creative minds. I have already begun to put a team together to help inspire each project and to cultivate big concepts in artistic ways.

This project is a means of expression and communication and aims to send compelling messages along side imagination and artistry. Photography inspires us to see things in a way we would have never seen them before. Photos have begun to replace words and have given us a universal language. With this global dialog we tell stories with images all over the world.

So far my Challenges have been operating on a small scale with shared equipment that is no longer available to me. This is where you come in! With your donations I will be able to have my own camera and equipment allowing this project to evolve. If I reach my goal I plan to buy a Canon 5d MarkIII, a 70mm-200mm lens and two Photogenic studio strobe lights. That my friends basically totals $6,000 right there, can you believe it. Your gifts will help make the 12 Month Photo Challenge a reality and will give me the opportunity to continue my work.

In the New Year I will be showing The 52 Week Photo Challenge in my private gallery. If you donate now to this campaign you will get a special invitation to join me for some wine at this event. If you donate even more I am offering myself and my services, to create with you, for you!

Each and every Challenge this year has taught me something unexpected. Creativity is a process and inspiration comes from the most unpredictable places. I learned that practice gets you one step closer to perfect and that a little challenge can go a long way. I have realized that things don’t always go according to plan but the possibility of something more beautiful may just come of it. Pushing myself this year has increased my expertise as a photographer. Stepping out of my comfort zone and trying new things made me realize that that is where the magic happens.

I challenge you to challenge yourself this year. What will you do?

I know that sometimes it is difficult to find the funds to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't still help out. Spread the word about my campaign by posting it on social media. Maybe one of your friends will see it and want to help out, and that connection would have never happened if it was not for you. I am also looking for help with my Challenges. This year I am going to need a big crew and we still have some holes to fill in. For example I am in need of a make up artist and a couple of interns!

story:
Who I am and where I live

I have lived in recent years on an agricultural farm located in the large Southern Agricultural Park of Milan (Italy), and I like taking shots in this environment.

I have been a computer scientist for many years, and I have always loved photography .

1)     

Now I would like, starting from illustrating the beauty of the aspects of country life, (which can be a good alternative for everyone in the use of free time, on weekends and perhaps even during the holidays), and by making known natural products and organic grown in the park,

start a new business as Social Media Manager , using


more professional tools (a DSLR camera, for example) and a small site to manage SMM activities.  I am attending a great online course on this topic .

( The local public administration, as well as various companies and shops (as well as private individuals) , may be very interested in original multimedia promotions )  

2)       

At the same time I would like to raise funds for AVSI.ORG, an Association of Volunteers for International Development.   I have known the association for years.

 

Help in the emergency  /  Social goal

''On the frontline in the fight against COVID-19''

At least 50 per cent of the funds raised will be donated to

 AVSI 

AVSI, created in 1972, is a non-profit organization which carries out development cooperation and humanitarian aid projects throughout the world.

www.AVSI.ORG/en

Help in the emergency  /  Social goal

 

A new activity with multimedia tools 

 

First goal ! 

My first personal goal is to create multimedia videos and photos (in HD / 4K): to help discover, for example, the ancient restored farmhouse where I live and work, and other realities present in the large South Park of Milan (Italy): here you can find protected animal species, rare vegetation, monuments and places of historical interest.

This can be a good starting point for a Social Media Manager activity.

 

​


I have already started a initial business with videos and photos

 I started publishing some of my productions  on the Italian countryside  on

SHUTTERSTOCK  and  ADOBE STOCK  

 

Personal goal

  I would like to give this activity a better professional form  

So I would need funding for more professional photographic equipment; for advertising campaigns; and also for a small site that spreads my multimedia productions and that supports my social media marketing (SMM) activity.

I will start on May 18, 2020 a Social Media Marketing course with Marketing Genius   

   https://Besupergenius.com/smm/

 

 

Professional project
perspectives

 

SMM 's activity has a great possibility of expansion, due to the need to directly connect the various work activities with the huge audience registered with Social Media,         

The multimedia project moreover could help find alternative excursions and trips ( on foot , also by bicycle or on horseback ) to people who in this period cannot spend too much on their free time. 

 

Pictures from the park South Park Milano

( More information on  this recent article ( italian )  Zigo', la ciclabile sul Naviglio ( click ) )

( the official link:   Parco Agricolo Sud Milano   )

 

There are many interesting subjects in this area, as you can see.

 

An interesting challenge

     I think he has to invest something ( in time and money), but that the SMM sector may have exceptional developments. There may be competition, but the market is really large.

Speaking of the South Park : there are already sites and information on this area,   but I think that living in the park I can better grasp some characteristics, and get  good and original photographic results . 

 

 

 You can contribute to my project by  clicking on the  'BACK IT' button - (red)   from the pc , or using  the box 'MAKE a CONTRIBUTION' from the smartphone.   Any amount is fine.

 

Other ways you can help 

 

To help the AVSI Association you can directly go to the official website www.avsi.org

Who I am and where I live
I have lived in recent years on an agricultural farm located in the large Southern Agricultural Park of Milan (Italy), and I like taking shots in this environment.
I have been a computer scientist for many years, and I have always loved photography .
1)     
Now I would like, starting from illustrating the beauty of the aspects of country life, (which can be a good alternative for everyone in the use of free time, on weekends and perhaps even during the holidays), and by making known natural products and organic grown in the park,
start a new business as Social Media Manager , using
more professional tools (a DSLR camera, for example) and a small site to manage SMM activities.  I am attending a great online course on this topic .
( The local public administration, as well as various companies and shops (as well as private individuals) , may be very interested in original multimedia promotions )  
2)       
At the same time I would like to raise funds for AVSI.ORG, an Association of Volunteers for International Development.   I have known the association for years.
 
Help in the emergency  /  Social goal
''On the frontline in the fight against COVID-19''
At least 50 per cent of the funds raised will be donated to

 AVSI 
AVSI, created in 1972, is a non-profit organization which carries out development cooperation and humanitarian aid projects throughout the world.


www.AVSI.ORG/en

Help in the emergency  /  Social goal
 

A new activity with multimedia tools 
 

First goal ! 

My first personal goal is to create multimedia videos and photos (in HD / 4K): to help discover, for example, the ancient restored farmhouse where I live and work, and other realities present in the large South Park of Milan (Italy): here you can find protected animal species, rare vegetation, monuments and places of historical interest.
This can be a good starting point for a Social Media Manager activity.
 
​
I have already started a initial business with videos and photos
 I started publishing some of my productions  on the Italian countryside  on
SHUTTERSTOCK  and  ADOBE STOCK  
 
Personal goal

  I would like to give this activity a better professional form  
So I would need funding for more professional photographic equipment; for advertising campaigns; and also for a small site that spreads my multimedia productions and that supports my social media marketing (SMM) activity.
I will start on May 18, 2020 a Social Media Marketing course with Marketing Genius   
   https://Besupergenius.com/smm/
 

 
Professional projectperspectives
 
SMM 's activity has a great possibility of expansion, due to the need to directly connect the various work activities with the huge audience registered with Social Media,         
The multimedia project moreover could help find alternative excursions and trips ( on foot , also by bicycle or on horseback ) to people who in this period cannot spend too much on their free time. 

 

Pictures from the park South Park Milano 
( More information on  this recent article ( italian )  Zigo', la ciclabile sul Naviglio ( click ) )
( the official link:   Parco Agricolo Sud Milano   )
 
There are many interesting subjects in this area, as you can see.
 


An interesting challenge
     I think he has to invest something ( in time and money), but that the SMM sector may have exceptional developments. There may be competition, but the market is really large.
Speaking of the South Park : there are already sites and information on this area,   but I think that living in the park I can better grasp some characteristics, and get  good and original photographic results . 
 

 
 You can contribute to my project by  clicking on the  'BACK IT' button - (red)   from the pc , or using  the box 'MAKE a CONTRIBUTION' from the smartphone.   Any amount is fine.
 

Other ways you can help 
 
To help the AVSI Association you can directly go to the official website www.avsi.org

story:
Books sales campaign ending on October 15! No further copies will be made available to the public.

This photobook #NotMyPresident: Five Years of Resisting Trump documents five years of protests against Donald J. Trump and his administration.

A Story About Heroes

Trump’s presidency was a minority rule Administration with a majority of Americans voting against him (twice) and disapproving of his actions in the Oval Office. Those actions inspired thousands of people from all walks of life to stand up against authoritarianism and cruelty.

These nonviolent protestors are the heroes who stood up and demanded change throughout the years. This book highlights them and their actions. 

Though I do not know these protestors, I spent entire days through several years documenting their actions. Then I shared their photos on Facebook, Flickr, and Instagram so my networks, the media, and in some cases the world could see their opposition.

The courage these millions of protestors demonstrated is admirable. At first, these protests were met with sneers, online hazing, and taunts. As time progressed and Trump continued to corrupt the government, protestors and press alike had their economic and physical well being threatened by Trump supporters, and through veiled politicized Justice Department actions and arrests.

These heroes exercised their First Amendment rights with protests for five long years, beginning during the 2016 GOP primary and Trump's inauguration. They continued from the beginning of Trump's presidency through the massive BlackLivesMatter protests of 2020, and the successful election of Joe Biden and his inauguration in 2021 (knock on wood). In the end, the protestors won a collective victory against an entrenched authoritarian.

The photos show a consistent heroic resistance against draconian measures. You can see how the often hateful policies produced pain and division that ruptured American society.

 

What Topics Are Covered

From basic civil rights to democratic principles, the same themes kept appearing over and over again in the protests. They included, but were not limited to:

  • Racism
  • Immigration
  • Women’s rights
  • LGBTQ rights
  • Science and facts
  • Election interference
  • The right to earn

Each chapter focuses on a topic of sorts, showing the impact created by Trump’s policies. Consistent themes rise to the fore. You can see the same issues happening in 2016 and 2017 that are still happening today during the Trump presidency’s last days. There are no coincidences.

Photographing these events (primarily in Washington, DC) felt like an assault on every moral sense of value and normality. For the better part of five years, like a majority of Americans, I witnessed an affront on every sense of decency I can imagine, and at times it felt completely hopeless. In the end, civil rights and democracy itself won out.

Buy #NotMyPresident to see the great struggle and eventual triumph against Trump. And of course, help me preserve and protect the memories of these brave people in their efforts to protect civil rights, and the health and well-being of all Americans.

 

Full Chapter List

  • Trump Election Protest (2016)
  • Preface: The 2016 GOP Primaries
  • The 2016 Election
  • Inauguration 2017
  • Muslim Ban
  • Women and Feminism
  • The GLBTQ Community
  • The Science Marches
  • Charlottesville
  • Government Shutdown
  • A Kitchen Sink of Protests
  • COVID
  • Black Lives Matter 2020
  • Election Night 2020
  • The Long Bitter End
  • Inauguration 2021

About the Team

Geoff Livingston, Author and Photographer

Geoff Livingston is an award-winning professional photographer and author specializing in photojournalism, portraits, event photography, engagement shoots, and fine art photography. But really he likes to take pictures every day, and is happiest behind the lens.

Originally from Philadelphia, Geoff now lives outside Washington, D.C. with his wife, daughter, two cats, and a dog. You can learn more about Geoff’s photography at geofflivingston.com.

Amanda Jose, Creative Director

Amanda Jose is an artist and designer, born and raised in the DMV area. With a diverse background in a variety of mediums such as fine art, typography and graphic design, coupled with working in both the government and private sectors, #NotMyPresident is a rare opportunity to bring those worlds together.

story:
My Story, My Life, My Dream . . .

My name is Erica Lowry, I'm 24 years old an aspiring freelance photographer from New Jersey. I started doing photography when I was around 14 years old. As I've grown older I've started to realized that I want to become a professional photographer. I spealize mostly in nature photography, constantly trying to capture on camera those moments in life most people never get a chance to stop and enjoy. Over the years I have managed to suprise people with photos that most would not have expected to be taken with the inexpensive point and shoot camera's I've owned, but I know if I want my dream to come true I will need professional equipment. This is where I'm going to need all the help I can get. Any little bit is appreciated, and will go a long way to reaching my goals.

Thank you, and for an idea of my photography please visit my website Art Of My Eye Photography

Making My Dream Come True . . . 

The camera I want to buy is a Nikon D300s. I'm looking for it at a reasonable price, so that I can get some accessories to go along with it, such as extra lens, flashes, etc.

My Wish List , Or At least A Start . . .

Nikon D300s camera body - $1600

18-55mm lens - $85

55-300mm lens - $200

A Gift For You, For Helping Me . . .

$20 - 1 5x7 print of your choice

$30 - 1 8x10 print of your choice

$50 - 1mouse pad & 1 5x7 print of your choice

$80 - 1 8x10 puzzle

$100 - 1 desktop calander featuring my photos & 1 8x10 print of your choice

$150 - 1 framed 8x10 canvas photo of your choice

* prints can be signed and numbered on the back of the photo

** all photos for perks can be veiwed on my website

story:
"Happening Right Then!  Photographs 1983-85"

"Happening Right Then!" is a 150+ page hardback book featuring over 200 colour and black & white photographs taken at  iconic venues such as The Living Room, Room At The Top and The Big Twang between 1983-1985.

The bands featured include TV Personalities, The Pastels, The Times, Shop Assistants, Nikki Sudden, The Nightingales, Jasmine Minks, Primal Scream, Go Service, Direct Hits, The Legend, 12 Cubic Feet, Patrick Fitzgerald, Khartomb, Doctor & The Medics, Strawberry Switchblade and many more.

In addition ,the photos will be accompanied by comments and recollections from many of the bands and people featured, some revisiting this period in print for the very first time.

(David from the Shop Assistants drums for The Pastels-The Living Room Oct 1983)

I started taking photos for use in my fanzine, Groovy Black Shades, and as favour for some of the bands. They ended up appearing in other fanzines and on record releases of the time.This year some have appeared in the NME, and in the booklet for the Cherry Red deluxe reissue of the legendary C86 cassette.In 2015 some will be used in Neil Taylor's new book "C86 & All That (with one of the Shop Assistants being used as the front cover).as well as in the planned documentary film version  of Samuel Knee's book "A Scene In Between".

(Daniel Treacy & Jowe Head of TV Personalities-The Living Room Feb 1983)

 The idea for "Happening Right Then!" came about after conversations with Neil Taylor whilst being interviewed for his C86 book, and, after further chats with , and encouragement from,Alan McGee (Creation Records founder) & Joe Foster (Creation artist & Producer of a number  of the bands in the book), I decided to go ahead. I am going down the self-publishing route,rather than approaching a traditional publisher , for the simple reason that the photos were taken at a time when indie meant independent,when the attitude was to Do It Yourself. It seems appropriate somehow.

To ensure a quality finish I am pleased that the cover design will be provided by renowned graphic designer SIMON WILLIAMS. To assist and advise on content editing and layout, I have great back  up in NEIL TAYLOR(former NME journalist and author of "Rough Trade: Document & Eyewitness" & "C86 And All That"),PAT GILBERT(former editor at Mojo & Record Collector, and author of The Clash biography "Passion Is A Fashion", and SAMUEL KNEE, editor of "A Scene In Between".

                          (Nikki Sudden at The 100 Club Sept 1983)

I have created a number of "perks" to assist in raising the funds, ranging from a postcard set to a bumper bundle of a ltd edion book,postcards,prints and an invite to the launch of Neil Taylor's C86 book. This will take place at the original home of The Living Room in London, and will include an exhibition of photos from the book enititled "Return To The Living Room".Any money raised over the target will go towards financing the exhibition. I also plan to take the exhibition to other locations around the UK in 2015.

"Paul Groovy is the living room era archive guy he has everything he is also as sharp and as bright as the day i first met him/a totally honest man and absolute legend"-Alan McGee

 With any project there are risks, but I believe that I have taken all possible steps to ensure this project reaches a successful conclusion. There are no copyright issues as I own copyright in all photographs to be used in the book. I have lined up reputable and reliable printers for both the book itself, and the associated perks (postcards and prints).

 Of course I understand that not everyone reading this will be able to contribute , but you can help in another way by sharing this project via your Facebook page, Twitter, or blog .The more people who know about it,the more successful this campaign will be.

Thank you 

Paul Groovy

Portsmouth Oct 2014

Portsmouth Oct 2014

story:
My goal is to publish Feminine Transitions for Women's History Month, March 2013.

 

Our Story

For women, aging brings with it an inner grace and beauty that is more than skin deep. From birth to old age, women transition through many physical, psychological, and emotional phases that are recorded on their faces.

Never before has a book so vividly projected the images of women in all stages of life in a way that reveals who they really are as women.  Feminine Transitions: A Photographic Celebration of Natural Beauty is a refreshing and inspiring, full-color book of photography. Its pages present a series of portraits that reveal the elegance and subtly honest beauty of female faces between the ages of 7 weeks and 105 years.

Author and photographer Alyscia Cunningham has truly unmasked the natural beauty of aging. “In a world filled with ‘Photoshopped’ images of women who are heavily made up, this book is a breath of fresh air,” says Trista Hendren, author of The Girl God and writer at the blog Elephant Journal.

The process of photographing the portraits for the book turned out to be a transition for Alyscia. “I simply wanted to put together a body of work that fosters a woman’s love for herself and encourages women to believe in their own beauty, despite the signs of aging,” says Alyscia.  “But as I looked through my lens, I couldn’t see the women. All I could see was their makeup.  Their masks.”

Alyscia then made the decision that all of her subjects remove their makeup for their portraits. That was when the book project really took shape. The importance of a woman’s “natural” beauty took center stage.

Feminine Transitions unmasks women and exquisitely demonstrates that young is beautiful, old is beautiful, and natural is beautiful.

Read Alyscia's bio. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am so proud and excited to produce my first photography book that is scheduled for release in March 2013, Women's History Month. I am also coordinating traveling exhibitions showcasing the images from my book. With your help and contributions, I hope to be able to raise the money for my shows and book production. The funds will be used for printing the first 500 copies of my book, rental space, framing, invitations, marketing, installation and all of the other things that go along with launching major solo exhibitions. 

If I do not reach my entire goal on this round, I will purchase 100 copies using Blurb to publish. However, Blurb's prices are far higher than going to a traditional printer. Nonetheless, have a few copies in hand will be beneficial as people would rather see a product in hand.  From there, I will continue to collect the funds until I reach my goal by holding future funding campaigns. I've also submitted applications via my local arts organizations for grants and currently awaiting the status. 

For your generous contribution, you will receive signed and personalized copies of Feminine Transitions along with recognition in the book’s marketing materials, which will be distributed to hundreds of media outlets. Higher-level sponsors can take advantage of tickets to the Feminine Transitions book launch party, prominent logo placements and even a full photography session from Alyscia Cunningham Photography.

In order to spread this important message of self-confidence to communities around the country, this project relies on support from individuals and organizations like yours. Please help make an impact and be part of this global movement by supporting Feminine Transitions at one of the perk levels. To contribute or to find out more information, please don’t hesitate to contact me directly at AlysciaC@aol.com. Thank you for your consideration and your generosity.

 

The Impact

As a valued contributor of Feminine Transitions, you can play an essential role in helping thousands of girls and women love what they see in the mirror and feel more comfortable in their skin. Your donation will directly fund the book’s production and the Feminine Transitions exhibition, which is currently slated to appear in ten U.S. cities, including DC, CA, OH, IL, NY, NC, SC, TN, GA, AL and UT.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth goes such a long way.  Now a days, social media is the way of the future. In other words, you can really help to make this campaign successful by spreading the word.  Do you have Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, LinkedIn...or even an email?  The biggest help you can give, other than making a financial contribution, is telling others.  Post it on any or your social media sites and send info for my campaign via email.

I sincerely thank you for coming to my page to take a look at my project. I want to share the beauty of Feminine Transitions with the world. Your contribution is helping to make this happen.

story:

I think we've all taken a lot of joy and happiness from his pictures over the years.  Luke would never ask us for help but I wanted to start a campaign to replace this trusty steed of a camera and ensure  his photo journals keep going.  Nea pressure Luke;)
