I think we've all taken a lot of joy and happiness from his pictures over the years.  Luke would never ask us for help but I wanted to start a campaign to replace this trusty steed of a camera and ensure  his photo journals keep going.  Nea pressure Luke;)Pip

story:
About the Project

This project aims to celebrate those involved in the rich fabric that makes up London’s coffee community. From green buyers to baristas, it’s the people that make this scene such an accessible and friendly space. I’ve had the pleasure of meeting, hanging out with, and photographing London’s movers and shakers in the coffee sphere - what a buzz it has been!

Having moved to London in 2012 and working in the industry myself for about 5 years, I’ve had the pleasure of seeing the evolution in the city’s cafés. The global coffee community is still very small and you can be guaranteed to find a friend or two working on bar in almost every major city. Coffee has such a varied collection of people involved in it who are glad to welcome you into their spaces, which is what has kept me going back to many cafés.

 


In this series, I’ve been able to photograph fine folks from places such as Rosslyn Coffee, Omotesando, and Kiss the Hippo to name just a few. The individual contributions these people give are what makes the coffee experience such a delight. These little interactions are so powerful and invite outsiders to tap into the coffee world, one cup at a time.

 

Caffenol

This project was photographed on medium format black and white film, then developed at home with an alternative process called caffenol, which uses coffee as one of its active ingredients.

How does coffee develop film? Caffeic acid is the essential part, but the pH in coffee is too acidic to be useful as a developer. The mixture is made alkaline by adding sodium carbonate, which is a much stronger modifier than baking soda. 

 

 

It's important that the temperature of the developer is kept stable during the process, otherwise the chemicals can react unpredictably - one degree can make a huge difference in the quality of the development, so it needs to be monitored closely. The addition of vitamin C powder helps to reduce clouding on the film.

Just mix it up, let it steep, and the film is ready to serve in no time.

 

Information

The book 48 pages, perfect bound, with measurements 197mm x 132mm.

story:
Deutsche Fotografische Akademie - "1000 Wirklichkeiten"

 

Das Event

Die Veranstaltung 1000 Wirklichkleiten zum 100-jährigen Jubiläum der GDL/DFA im Haus der Photographie, Deichtorhallen Hamburg, vom 9.-13. Oktober 2019 wird einen Einblick in den Reichtum der Bilder und Ideen geben, die im Laufe eines Jahrhunderts auf dem Feld der künstlerischen Fotografie entwickelt wurden. Visionen für die Zukunft werden den Vorstellungen historischer fotografischer Positionen direkt gegenübergestellt. Es geht nicht um einen allumfassenden musealen Überblick auf die Werke von mehr als 150 Fotograf/Innen, sondern um die Sensibilisierung für die Ausdrucksformen des Mediums Fotografie zwischen Authentizität und Inszenierung, Abbild und Abstraktion, Dokument und Fiktion, Intuition und Konzept.


Andreas Gefeller,  Supervisions

Das breite Spektrum der fotografischen Positionen innerhalb der GDL/DFA wird mit mehreren pointierten Thesen strukturiert und behandelt die Sujets: Portraitfotografie, Dokumentation, Journalismus, Street Photography, subjektive und generative Fotografie, Abstraktion, inszenierte, konzeptuelle und experimentelle Fotografie.


Erasmus Schröter, Komparsen

Mit verschiedenen Präsentationsformen vom großflächigen Plakat, Faksimiles von Publikationen der DFA, über gerahmte Vintageprints bis hin zu Videoprojektionen und Bildschirmdarstellungen wird eine lebendige Ausstellungsarchitektur geschaffen, die Fotografie als ein Experiment des Sehens mit all seinen inhaltlichen und formalen Herausforderungen an den Betrachter begreift.
Zahlreiche DFA-Mitglieder präsentieren ihre Bilder in Vorträgen und diskutieren mit dem Publikum über ihre Positionen und Arbeitsweisen. In Podiumsgesprächen geben Teilnehmer Einblicke in die Entwicklung der Fotografie und des Kunstmarkts.


Regina Schmeken, Skyline
 

Special Edition Prints

Sie können ein aktiver Teil dieses besonderen Events werden, indem Sie im Rahmen dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne einen Beitrag leisten. Die Deutsche Fotografische Akademie bietet Ihnen hierfür als Dankeschöm für Ihre Spenden Editionsprints von bekannten deutschen Fotograf/Innen an. Für eine Spende von 100.- Euro bekommen Sie einen hochwertigen FineArt Inkjet Print auf Hahnemühle-Papier "PhotoRag 308" in der Größe 24x30 cm. Von jedem Motiv gibt es nur 10 Exemplare.

In den nächsten Wochen werden wir über 100 Fotografien in 3 Staffeln im Rahmen dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne vorstellen.

 

Die beteiligten Fotograf/Innen an der Sonderedition zur Ausstellung:

Staffel 1 (23.07. - 09.08.2019)

Andreas Gefeller • Andreas Herzau • Andreas Mader • Annegret Soltau • Axel Beyer • Bianca Patricia Isensee • Birte Kaufmann • Boris Becker • Boris Eldagsen • Claudia Fährenkemper • Claudio Hils • Daniel Schumann • Dirk Gebhardt • Dörte Eißfeldt • Erasmus Schröter • Eva Schmeckenbecher • Ferit Kuyas • Gisoo Kim • Göran Gnaudschun • Gudrun Kemsa • Harald Fuchs • Henning Maier-Jantzen • Joachim Hildebrand • Karen Irmer • Kurt Buchwald • Meinrad Schade • Nadine Preiß • Olaf Otto Becker • Petra Böttcher • Ralf Meyer • Ruth Stoltenberg • Sabine Schründer • Simone Demandt • Tania Reinicke • Thekla Ehling • Torsten Schumann • Ute Behrend • Wolfgang Zurborn
 

Staffel 2 (10.08.-27.08.2019)

Achim Mohné • Amin El Dib • Anastasia Khoroshilova • Andreas Langen/Kai Loges • Andreas Trogisch • Andreas Weinand • Axel Grünewald • Bernd Arnold • Bertram Kober • Burkhard Schittny • Claus Bach • David Klammer • Delia Keller • Dieter Seitz • Emanuel Raab • Esther Hagenmaier • Florian Beckers • Haubitz-Zoche • Ingo Taubhorn • Isadora Tast • Jackie Baier • Jürgen Scriba • Katharina Bosse • Katharina Mayer • Knut Wolfgang Maron • Kris Scholz • Lois Hechenblaikner • Lukas Roth • Marc Volk • Martin Brockhoff • Matthias Jung • Matthias Leupold • Michael Jochum • Nikita Teryoshin • Peter Jacobi • Peter Loewy • Peter Thomann • Ralf Cohen • Robert Harding Pittman • Roman Bezjak • Silke Helmerdig • Thomas Brenner • Ulrich Mertens • Wolfgang Bellwinkel • Wolfgang Gscheidle
 

Staffel 3 (28,08. - 14.09.2019)

Neu vertretene Fotograf/Innen bei den Editionsprints
Elke Seeger • Hans-Chrsitian Schink • Karina-Sirkku Kurz • Klaus Elle • Linn Schröder • Loredana Nemes • Michael Schnabel • Regina Schmeken • Wiebke Leister

Zwei Motive als Heliogravüren von Hendrik Faure

Zweite Editionsprints von den Fotograf/Innen:
Achim Mohné • Amin El Dib • Anastasia Khoroshilova • Andreas Herzau • Andreas Langen/Kai Loges • Andreas Trogisch • Andreas Weinand • Axel Beyer • Axel Grünewald • Bernd Arnold • Bianca Patricia Isensee • Boris Becker • Boris Eldagsen • Burkhard Schittny • Claudia Fährenkemper • Claudio Hils • Claus Bach • Daniel Schumann • Dieter Seitz • Dirk Gebhardt • Dörte Eißfeldt • Emanuel Raab • Erasmus Schröter • Esther Hagenmaier • Florian Beckers • Göran Gnaudschun • Henning Maier-Jantzen • Jackie Baier • Joachim Hildebrand • Jürgen Scriba • Karen Irmer • Katharina Mayer • Kris Scholz • Kurt Buchwald • Lois Hechenblaikner • Lukas Roth • Marc Volk • Martin Brockhoff • Matthias Jung • Matthias Leupold • Meinrad Schade • Michael Jochum • Nadine Preiß • Nikita Teryoshin • Olaf Otto Becker • Peter Thomann • Petra Böttcher • Ralf Cohen • Ralf Meyer • Robert Harding Pittman • Ruth Stoltenberg • Sabine Schründer • Silke Helmerdig • Simone Demandt • Tania Reinicke • Thekla Ehling • Thomas Brenner • Torsten Schumann • Ulrich Mertens • Ute Behrend • Wolfgang Bellwinkel • Wolfgang Gscheidle • Wolfgang Zurborn

 

Wofür werden die Einnahmen verwendet?


Das Ziel dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne ist es, 25000.- Euro für die Realisierung der Veranstaltung 1000 Wirklichkeiten im Haus der Photographie, Deichtorhallen Hamburg, vom 9.-13. Oktober 2019 einzunehmen. Alle Gelder, die durch Ihre Spenden eingehen, werden ausschließlich zu diesem Zweck verwendet.

Planung der Ausstellung im Haus der Photographie, Deichtorhallen Hamburg

In der ungewöhnlichen Ausstellung mit Großplakaten, gerahmten Originalfotografien, Videoinstallationen, Fotoskulpturen und Beamerprojektionen sind über 100 Künstler/Innen beteiligt. Für Produktion und Durchführung der einmaligen Präsentation historischer und zeitgenössischer deutscher Fotografie, für die Tagung und die Publikationen hierzu entstehen hohe Kosten.

Die Deutsche Fotografische Akademie ist ein gemeinnütziger Verein und alle an der Planung beteilgten Mitglieder arbeiten ehrenamtlich. Ihre Spenden fließen deswegen allein in die Kosten für Produktion und Durchführung von Ausstellung, Tagung und Publikationen (zum Beispiel Herstellungskosten, Logistik und Technik).

Wir würden uns sehr über Ihre Unterstützung freuen, damit die Veranstaltung 1000 Wirklichkeiten zur Zelebrierung der Vielfalt in der deutschen Fotografie der letzten 100 Jahre perfekt realisiert werden kann.

Planung der Ausstellung im Haus der Photographie, Deichtorhallen Hamburg

story:
Më quajnë Fation Plaku, i apasionuar pas sportit të alpinizmit, eksplorimit, aventurës dhe fotografisë, prej më shumë se 20 vjetësh. Jam krenar me arritjet e mia, ku vlen të përmenden ngjitja në majën e Everestit, në Himalajë në 2012, në kuadrin e Jubileut të 100 vjetorit të Shpalljes së Pavarësisë. Ëndrra ime është të ngjis 7 majat e kontinenteve, ku deri tani kam ngjitur 4 prej tyre.

Në Shqipëri jam ngjitur jo vetëm në shumicën e majave më të larta, por kam zbuluar në këtë rrugëtim vende të një bukurie natyrore të rrallë të tokës, detit, ajrit dhe të trashëgimisë kulturore, të cilat jam përpjekur t'i pasqyroj tek ky album fotografish.

 


Për ta bërë të prekshme këtë ëndërr, në harkun e rreth gjashtë viteve kam investuar në kohë, në punë, në pajisje, në mendim estetik, në emocion dhe në krijimin e një marrëdhënie të veçantë të dashur dhe të ngrohtë me natyrën dhe trashëgiminë kulturore.

Me anë të albumit dëshiroj të ndërtoj një urë për të kaluar këtë emocion tek ju, për ta ndarë dhe ndjerë së bashku.

 

* * *

"Me fotot e tij, Fation Plaku na ka bërë një dhuratë të rrallë. Ai nuk ka dashur kurrsesi t’i mbajë për vete përjetimet e tij, por na merr për dore dhe na çon në një Shqipëri tjetër, të dëlirë, vezulluese, të pastër, ndryshe nga ajo që përjetojmë përditë në qytete, qyteza e fshatra të mbushura me zhurma e ndotje, klithma politike, shikime të inatosura e rrëmujë urbane.

Nganjëherë, ajo duket fort e ashpër, por gjithherë e bukur dhe e drejtë - njësoj si një zonjë hijerëndë e maleve ku ka shkelur këmba e Fationit dhe e shokëve të tij.”

Fatos Baxhaku.

story:
Who Am I?

For sixteen years now I've been a photographer, working with everyone from undiscovered models to stay-at-home moms to A-list celebrities and musicians. I am a mother, a writer, and above all, a creator.

 

My Grand Plan and What It'll Cost

This photoshoot would be one of the most beautiful and ambitious things I've attempted to date. I have found my dream location and want to rent it out for a long enough time that I'm not rushing around; I want to spend the entire day gathering quality, unique and fun content that is a celebration both of my own vision and the collaboration of those I hire to work alongside me.

 

I have worked out the budget for the shoot I'm envisioning and while I can pay for some of it, having others help me offset the cost would be a huge relief and would also allow me more creative freedom and the potential to do a few more interesting things than I could manage with my own stretched-thin, threadbare wallet. :)

 

  • .I'm looking into renting the venue for 6-8 hours to ensure we get the maximum amount of shoot time. This location is such that the changing daylight/temperature conditions will allow for a large margin of shooting, and there are so many aspects of the place to shoot that a shorter period of time would not truly do it justice and would leave us rushed.

 

  • The shoot is 3.5 hours from my home, requiring gas money and a hotel room for the evening to house me and the traveling crew.

 

  • I want to hire a glam squad; a hair and makeup person, possibly two, to bring their skill and vision to the shoot and help me get the most impact out of the subjects.

 

  • I am looking into the potential of bringing in one of my dearest friends from Los Angeles as a subject for some of the photos; this person is incredibly talented and would bring a level of professional knowledge and skill to the shoot that would be HUGE. Your donations could help offset the cost of a plane ticket to bring this person out here to Texas soil.

 

The Impact

I have several magazines interested in publishing content from this shoot as well as the potential to exhibit many of the prints in art shows and upcoming gallery exhibits. I will also have prints for sale and the shoot will provide fresh, high-quality, ambitious content for the portfolios of all involved.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially I completely understand. I just much prefer this to the idea of a party this year; I want to make art surrounded by people who inspire me.

 

If you're someone who has enjoyed my photography, if you're someone who has worked with me and knows who I am, if you're someone who would've said "Where's your Amazon wishlist?" or "I'll buy you a drink!" for my birthday, please consider putting a few dollars in the hat here instead. I don't drink anymore and I don't need much in the way of material goods, but making art would be the gift that would keep giving all year round for me. This shoot would invigorate me and help me recharge my creative juices for many months to come, and who knows what the ripple effect of these photos being published would be?

 

If you cannot donate, please consider sharing the link and spreading the love. My work can be found on Instagram at @darkroomlament and I appreciate any support you can give; it's hard out there for indie artists and I love my community and fellow weirdos so much, it means the world to me to work and create with you all.

I have worked out the budget for the shoot I'm envisioning and while I can pay for some of it, having others help me offset the cost would be a huge relief and would also allow me more creative freedom and the potential to do a few more interesting things than I could manage with my own stretched-thin, threadbare wallet. :)
 
.I'm looking into renting the venue for 6-8 hours to ensure we get the maximum amount of shoot time. This location is such that the changing daylight/temperature conditions will allow for a large margin of shooting, and there are so many aspects of the place to shoot that a shorter period of time would not truly do it justice and would leave us rushed.
 
The shoot is 3.5 hours from my home, requiring gas money and a hotel room for the evening to house me and the traveling crew.
 
I want to hire a glam squad; a hair and makeup person, possibly two, to bring their skill and vision to the shoot and help me get the most impact out of the subjects.
 
I am looking into the potential of bringing in one of my dearest friends from Los Angeles as a subject for some of the photos; this person is incredibly talented and would bring a level of professional knowledge and skill to the shoot that would be HUGE. Your donations could help offset the cost of a plane ticket to bring this person out here to Texas soil.
 

The Impact
I have several magazines interested in publishing content from this shoot as well as the potential to exhibit many of the prints in art shows and upcoming gallery exhibits. I will also have prints for sale and the shoot will provide fresh, high-quality, ambitious content for the portfolios of all involved.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially I completely understand. I just much prefer this to the idea of a party this year; I want to make art surrounded by people who inspire me.
 
If you're someone who has enjoyed my photography, if you're someone who has worked with me and knows who I am, if you're someone who would've said "Where's your Amazon wishlist?" or "I'll buy you a drink!" for my birthday, please consider putting a few dollars in the hat here instead. I don't drink anymore and I don't need much in the way of material goods, but making art would be the gift that would keep giving all year round for me. This shoot would invigorate me and help me recharge my creative juices for many months to come, and who knows what the ripple effect of these photos being published would be?
 
If you cannot donate, please consider sharing the link and spreading the love. My work can be found on Instagram at @darkroomlament and I appreciate any support you can give; it's hard out there for indie artists and I love my community and fellow weirdos so much, it means the world to me to work and create with you all.

story:
Who are we?

The main point which would the best describe us is a Family endlessly traveling the world driven by Art and Discovery.
Even if raised in a kind of classical way, we rapidly turned our interest outside of the beaten path to explore what unusual, odd and unknown situations could bring and teach us.

Stunned by our very first steps, going deeper and deeper in Discovery of Life has become a drug to us and now addicted to it we are. How excited we have been by leaving our lands of birth (France) to the other side of the Earth into very new Cultures, encountering a great Character made of Steel, Pylade, a sailing boat "who" became our floating home, sailing and crossing seas, swimming and fishing in Wild Life amongst Sharks, Dolphins and Rays, battling storms and angry waters, living in many countries trying to make people's way of life part of ours.
https://www.instagram.com/drakkarts/?hl=en

The 4 of us are completely passionate with Art. All of them!
We marvel at them, they give us so much vibrations.
Our own creativity goes through Landscape Photography, Poetry, Literature, Drawing, Music, Acting but we also do like meeting Artists to understand and share their own creations. It helps us to open our minds and grow inspiration.

Regarding Photography, do not hesitate to visit our profiles on links below, you will see a short selection of our work (you can even chose the platform you usually use):
https://www.flickr.com/photos/150835808@N06/
http://yourshot.nationalgeographic.com/profile/1438084/
https://youpic.com/photographer/drakkArts/
https://500px.com/drakkartsadventures

Our Family Life is made of steps built on unusual Challenges. It helps us to feel all the intensity of being alive and fulfill our thirst of Discovery.

 

What's the next Discovery step?

So the New Challenge is about joining Photography and Travel under the sole banner of the Travel Photographers.
Travel will be shaped into a journey across our roots countries (Italy then Greece ... as a beginning!) riding bikes, stops for wild camping, hikes on spots. That very basic and rough travel mode will also help us to dig deeper in Philosophy and self-understanding.
Photography will report well-known vistas but captured through our own Creativity, as well as previously unseen ones intended to amaze people's stares with magic light and colours. We also wish to report local high intensity scenes and Natives' uncommon portraits.

If you wish to get a better idea of what is the whole project about and how we daily think and prepare it, just have a look at our YouTube Channel. Through short videos you will follow us into major topics related to our coming soon lifestyle: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8QJw3hwnW9ER6oaCRhf4yg

 

Why this campaign?

Across its whole History, Photography has always been tightly bound to Post-processing.

Indeed, the Eye of the photographer is more than important. It precisely scans the scene, measures its whole intensity and places the difficult boundaries of the frame of interest.
Then, come the photographer's skills regarding how to tune the camera to give the very first steps of creativity to the still-not-born photograph.
Naturally, the shooting session begins and it is time for the Artist, sometimes surrounded by cold, wind, frost but very often magic ambiances, to refine tuning and slowly render the wanted (sometimes astonishing unwanted) picture.

Now with their work stored in the can, it is time for Photographers to transform their work taken in the Field to a Piece of Art. It is when Post-processing takes place.

Before the digital photography era, Artists would express their essence, imagination, creativity, dreams in Dark rooms, expertly manipulating their printings in developing bath until they would find the scene they were looking for.

With the digital process, nothing has changed but the tools. Adobe calls one of its major photographer's tools Lightroom as an opposition, but also recognition, of the so dear Dark rooms. Obviously, tools as Photoshop-like software are also more than requested.

Those heavy, useful and unavoidable applications need a strong and efficient platform in term of computer. It is at last the reason of our Campaign.

 

What your contribution would bring?

Today, because we are in an in between period and are not on our Nomad way, we use a big and heavy desktop platform to let us take off in our creativity voyages and render our Pieces of Art. This piece of equipment is obviously not part of our coming endeavour. There is no point to give you explanations about why, we guess you would have already get it.

To suit and complete our Photography process while we are on our way to Adventure, we do need a computer powerful enough to handle heavy applications but shaped to be packed in within our stuff on bikes.

Because we do rely on Apple system, our choice has been made on the very good Mac Book Pro 15".

We used a 13" in our Photographers past experience, but we came to the conclusion that even if the image display and the system are great, those computers lack place on their desktops to manipulate easily big resolution sharp and high quality pictures. To give you an idea, one of our camera is the formidable Nikon D800. It has a 36 Mpx digital sensor, shoots a minimum of 40MB RAW files with a full resolution of 7360 x 4912 pixels.
When you have to work on those kind of files with a 13" computer, it is most of the time just impossible if you want to create and render a Professional Arty Picture.

After trying it, it appeared that 15" will give us the perfect compromise.

17" screen would have been greater in term of image display but two problems rise. First, such a computer would not easily fit in our packing set. Second, Apple has discontinued those computers for a few years now. It means that support is difficult on that product because it is today a very tiny part of the market and so not a major point suppliers wish to carry on.

As you have now understood, we will send us most of the time into the wild and that means  we will not find access to power very easily and commonly. Because of that, electronic devices we will be bringing with us must show a battery life as long as possible. It is why relying on very last technology and brand-new product gives us the best luck to meet our goal using  IT system far from the power.

 

What about computer cost?

First, here are listed as per below the main computer features we evaluated as the minimal requirement:
2.6GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 processor, Turbo Boost up to 3.5GHz
16GB 2133MHz memory
512GB PCIe-based SSD
Radeon Pro 460 with 4GB memory

2.3GHz are enough to run software we use, so the minimum offered 2.6 would suit.
At the moment, we work with 8GB memory and we noticed that some applications, like After Effects, are slowed by a slight lack of memory amount, it is why we opted to 16GB.
Our actual Hard Drive is a 1TB. This is very comfortable but expensive as an option. So as we have 3 External Hard Drives, we thought we could remain on the 512GB option and organise at best our storage space. If we should find ourselves stuck with this feature in the future, we can get round it by acquiring a fourth External HD for a far better deal.
At last, the graphic card is important as we work on images and videos. So the better we get it, the faster will be the computer on tasks.

The quote priced by Apple at the moment for that configuration is €3179.00

As a philosophy, we like to follow, we think it is always important to take an active part in the process when asking people for help. It is why through that campaign we are trying to raise funds for a fraction of the total amount.
Our goal is roughly above the half of the global computer price. Then we would close the investment with the remaining part of the amount and feel we would have worked as a Team with the Contributors to finally own that very useful tool in our following works.

We would be grateful towards contributors for the huge help given but also very proud that we took our part in the purchase.

 

What can you get from us?

We are Photographers and what we have to offer is the benefit of our Creativity, our Art, we mean Photographs.

It is why, we would like to thank contributors with the Signed Fine Art Print of One Picture of us picked amongst our selection.

To do so it will be very easy, you:
- pay a visit to our Flickr Profile: https://www.flickr.com/photos/150835808@N06/ ;
- have a look at the Photographs ;
- write down the Name of the image (each of them has one) ;
- send us an email at elpipinouchko@gmail.com with the subject: Indiegogo reward ;
- let us know in the text the image's name you picked, your name and postal address ;

Once we will have the message, we will send, worldwide, to the Contributor the Print of the Selected Picture. It will be unique with Signature and Number.
Please note it will be Fine Art Prints with High definition printing and very nice Matt Paper with specific Texture for Fine Art works.

About the format:

From a €100 or equivalent contribution, you will be receiving a 18x12" (45x30cm) Print ;
From a €50 to €99 or equivalent contribution, you will be receiving a 12x10" (30x25cm) Print ;

We already want to thank very much contributions under €50, they will be appreciate as a big effort to help us in our Campaign. Actually, we know that the intention is everything, giving something, whatever the value, is the beauty of someone's mind.

 

Thank you!

It is now time to thank all of you who took time to read our text above. We do hope it has given you a good appreciation of what is our current endeavour, our main motivation and the very high desire to start this personal Adventure.
Maybe will you complete that appreciation with a contribution, in advance thank you, we wish you all the Best!

 

Stefan, Delfine, Marion and Celia alias "El Pipinouchko".

story:
Short Summary

100 years after the Armistice, the Vimy Foundation is actively working to ensure that the stories of the First World War live on for generations.

One part of our work is our First World War in Colour project, aimed at re-engaging young Canadians in a defining moment in our history. The First World War was a transformative experience for Canada and while the memory of the conflict and its impacts on our collective consciousness are slowly vanishing, these photos capture our attention. They provide us with a clearer understanding of what the First World War would have looked like to the people who lived it.

We have so far been able to colourize 150 photographs from the First World War, which feature in our travelling exhibition The Great War in Colour and our new book They Fought in Colour.

We are ready to begin the second phase of the project: "Canada at Peace." This next phase will allow us to colourize a new selection of photos, highlighting lives of Canadians in the post-war years and helping us share their stories.

An old soldier (73 years) bidding goodbye at the station, prior to sailing for Canada. Dept. of National Defence / Library and Archives Canada / PA-005134 (modified from the original)

 

What We Need & What You Get

Colourized photographs offer a new perspective on a moment in time, and reaching our goal of $5,000 will allow us to colourize up to ten more photographs.

Your support would allow us to contract our colourist, Mark Truelove of Canadian Colour, and our historian, Caitlin Bailey of the Canadian Centre for the Great War, who work together to make sure the photographs reflect the colours that existed in the moment image imprinted on film.

Contributions will also help us cover other, smaller costs, which might include photographic rights and fees associated with the source archives, as well as promotion and outreach once the photographs have been colourized and are ready to share.

Even if we don't reach our entire goal, all money raised will be put towards colourizing new photographs, and sharing them with our supporters and followers.

Perks include:

  • Copies of They Fought in Colour signed by contributors Margaret Atwood or Peter Mansbridge;
  • Copies of At Vimy Ridge signed by author Hugh Brewster;
  • Limited edition postcards;
  • Limited edition Vimy Foundation tote bags;
  • A selection of books from Dundurn Press;
  • And more!

Every contribution over $10 will be partially eligible for a tax receipt. Please contact the Vimy Foundation for more information.

First World War veterans learning handicrafts under the Department of Soldiers' Civil Re-establishment. [1918-1919]. Peake & Whittingham / Library and Archives Canada / PA-068115 (modified from the original)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us get the word out by sharing our campaign on social media using the hashtag #PeaceInColour. Find us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!

story:
Who, What, Why?

My name is Michael DiFilippo, I am a senior at Long Island University and will be graduating in May 2013 with my BFA in Photography. [NOT] A Home is my senior thesis project. I have put my heart and soul into this project. My wallet has also taken a big hit. This work focuses around the central idea of what makes a home. By using dollhouse miniatures I create scenes that are just a little "off" from what we expect. They are vacant of people and each room has something that is just not right about it. This work is like nothing I have done before.

The final prints are quite large, 44x30 some of the largest prints I have ever made. Unfortanetly large prints equal large costs. Along with printing costs I also acquired all of the dollhouse components my self. This project is 100% self funded. 

This work has taken 5 months and will all come together in a gallery show at the end of March. I have finished photographing the sets and making my prints. Now I am hoping to share it with others as well as help make back SOME of the money I have put into the project. 

What I Need & What You Get

  • The dollhouse is only one component. Each room hasd to be furnished and decorated in order to give each image the impact that was desired. 
  • Printing is a complicated and time consuming process. Multiple test strip prints are made long before any final print is created. Additionally due to the large size handling the prints is a very cautious task as well. 
  • The cost of all of the dollhouse components alone would stop many from doing what I did but I needed to bring my idea to life. Add in the expensive cost of ink and paper which I had to pay for out of pocket and this project quickly adds up. 

I am only looking to make back a small portion of what I spent, in return I want to share the work with you. Whether it is a $1 or $100 you will be able to enjoy my work as much as I have enjoyed it. 

 

The Impact

As a senior college student I have spent the last four years focusing on my work, I have chased the dream that everyone always told me to. I have caught the dream and the costs of tuition,  living, along with fees incurred at every stop along the way to getting my Bachelors Degree have caught me. 

You will also be spreading my work, by donating you will recieve a piece of original artwork that you can display and show to family and friends. The feeling of your work being shared is one that cannot be explained in words. The feeling is incredible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't afford a donation, I understand but perhaps you can pass this campaign along to your friends, and family. 

 

Thank you!

 

** I can only ship within the US.
